text: 355ml bottle. Pours pitch black. Thin beige head. Chocolate, spices, notes of bourbon, cocoa, coffee in the aroma. Coffee, coffeebeans, chocolate, vanilla, spicy notes in the taste. Coffee in the aftertaste. Rather heavy bodied, well balanced imperial stout.

On tap @ Browariat  
Brak dokładnych notatek 
Aromat: kawa, słodycz, czekolada. 
W smaku paloność, kawa, wanilia, nuty beczkowe, jest bardzo dobrze.

Pours dark with minimal head. If opened early has strong coffee and chocolate taste finishing with a strong barrel aged notes. As it ages the barrel notes become more prevalent. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

(355 ml bottle) Having searched high and low for this infamous beer, I finally found a small stock, in a bottle shop in Hannover. Four months later, I finally decided to crack it open, to celebrate finishing another round of university exams.

As soon as the cap leaves the bottle, the aroma rises in wisps of smoke. This beer is no ordinary beer. A syrup-like fluid glugs into the glass: close to jet-black, with a chestnut hue. Its carbonated with little streams of fine bubbles, which form a small, tan-coloured head.

The aroma is irresistibly seductive: bags of dark chocolate and roasted coffee; then vanilla, and smooth Kentucky bourbon; rich brandy cream; raisins, and cinnamon; clove and walnuts; mineral water, tobacco smoke, charred oak, brown sugar, rum, alcohol, and freshly-tanned leather. 

Despite being served at cellar temperature, the alcohol immediately warms the mouth, throat, and stomach. The whisky combines and magnifies the aromas - its a drink within a drink. And the mouthfeel is silky, creamy and smooth. It lies on the palate and coats the tongue like no other beer Ive ever tried.

Its almost a shame that this stout is flavoured. But, the coffee and chocolate only bring out the best in what the malt and hops provide. 

A wonderful beer - surely one of the worlds best.

Bottle, 355mL. Home. Best before 1/12/2017. A sparkling black beer witha big beige foamy creamy head ; good retention and lacing. Chocolate bourbon nose, same in the mouth with roast and coffee. Medium round sweet warming, light dry bitter. Full body, light to medium texture, soft carbonation, bourbon chocolate lasting finish. Overall, awesome !

Kolor czarny, piwo nieprzejrzyste. Aromat świetny. Bardzo intensywny - dominuje mocna gorzka czekolada, z nutami waniliowymi, mlecznymi i odrobiną kawy. Wszystko bardzo dobrze się zgrywa. W smaku również piwo jest świetne. Wysoka słodycz, dużo ciała, gęste jak na RISa przystało. W posmaku bardzo wyraźna beczka po bourbonie, która nie przysłania całości. Jest również czekolada, kawa, wanilia. Goryczka średnia, przyjemnie kontrastuje z ciemnymi słodami. Wysycenie niskie.

Nieprzejrzyście czarne z niską kremową pianą. Dużo dobrego w aromacie - kawa, wanilia, mleczna czekolada, beczka, sporo słodyczy. W smaku już tej słodyczy jest trochę mniej, jednak reszta bardzo podobnie jak w aromacie. Kawa, czekolada, wanilia. Na finiszu pojawiają się lekkie nuty bourbonu. Jest słodko, bogato, z pełnią smaku. Świetny balans, kawa stanowi kontrę dla słodyczy wanilii i czekolady. Nie zawiodłem się, sporo się dzieje, jest słodycz, jest kawa, jest beczka i to świetnie skomponowane w całość

(Butelkowane 08/12/16 (eu format)) Czarne, nieprzejrzyste. Piana brązowa, drobna, średnio-obifta, mały lacing obecny. W zapachu dużo wanilii, mlecznej czekolady, bourbonu, kakao, kawy, trochę paloności, wszystko bardzo ładnie zbalansowane. W smaku mocno wyczuwalne czekolada, kawa, paloność, do tego wanilia i bourbon. Wysycenie niskie, goryczka średnio-niska, posmak czekoladowy, pralinowy, bourbonowy.

355 ml bottle, served in a snifter. Held on to this bottle especially for my 200th rating, whoohoo! Poured black as midnight on a moonless night with a two finger mocha tan head. Aroma: coffee, chocolate, vanilla, bourbon, licorice. Taste: dilicious! Freshly roasted espresso beans, dark chocolate, vanilla, bourbon, salty licorice, dark fruit, molasses, soy sauce, fudge, whipped cream, whole wheat raisin bread, graham cracker, caramel, roasted nuts, oak, bakers cocoa, dates and loadsa roasted dark malts. Velvety, smooth, thick and gloopy mouthfeel, soooo good. A full body with a roasted bittersweet and slightly boozy finish. This is friggin delicious! A real sipper and really lives up to the hype. Awesome!
On tap at New World Brewing. Pours a dark, opaque brown. Nose is semi sweet chocolate, bourbon with hints of vanilla. Mouthfeel is very rich, taste is more chocolate and bourbon. Excellent stout!

Rich aroma of chocolate liquor with notes of molasses, some drinking chocolate, cocoa and roasted malts. Jet black in the glass with minimal tan head. Taste is semi sweet with bunch of chocolate bars, a noble alcohol, vanilla, some roastiness and hints of wooden barrel. Beer is sticky, rich and drinkable. Maybe bourbon notes are too aggressive, but in the long run - ass kicking brew.

UPDATED: JUN 12, 2017 Color negro con capa de espuma marrón de tres dedos de grosor (apariencia cremosa y de buena retención). Carbonatación media. Textura oleosa. Aroma a bourbon, madera, vainilla, chocolate, café. Sabor a chocolate y café, con mucha presencia de bourbon y vainilla. Mucha madera. Dulzona. Final licoroso de larga duración (los primeros tragos queman mucho). El postgusto a chocolate dura siglos. Esperaba algo más pero muy rica.
No zawód no.. Piwo dobre. I tylko dobre. Nie udźwignęło legendy ani rankingu RB :). Dużo kawy, czekolady jakieś tam resztki. Burbona prawie nic. Taki tam RIS jakich wiele.
Exactly as in description - dark and dense, full of chocolate (but not very sweet) and coffee, barrel to a lesser extent. Alcohol very well covered. Simply speaking, great RIS.
Very good beer, well composed, lot of aromas, chocolate, coffee, vanilla, wood. Light bodied, very drinkable and could be daily beer

Draught @ Albion. Inky black with small foamy tan head, rich mocha aroma, low carbonation, sweetish mocha taste with alcohol undertones kicking in 2 seconds later, slight woodsy aroma, smooth thick body, long woodsy mocha finish with faint alcohol aftertaste. As good as advertised!
355ml bottle from Beerometr in Moscow at 12.4% ABV. Pours pitch black with a large tan head. Aroma is bourbon, oak, coffee. Taste is coffee, vanilla, bourbon, moderate bitterness. Very nice.

Пробова& на Big Craft Day 2017 в Москве, причём было указано, что крепост& 12,4.Пиво произве& хорошое впечатл& но не могу сказать, что ошеломи& - хороший имперск& стаут. Крепост& и плотнос& заметны, конечно.

Keg @ Caribou, Galway [060517]
Pitch black, tan head, some lacing
Aroma of very rich dark chocolate malt, very mellow roast, really deep chocolate malt, wow
Taste - Massive rich dark chocolate malts, soft roast, deep chocolate, very rich malts, mellow roast, awesome
Palate - Soft carb, full body, rich, sweet, alcohol well hidden. Finish has a rich choc malt linger, some warming alcohol
Overall - Just superb, world class
Picked a bottle up on a trip to Founders brewery. Great beer, strong flavors of bourbon and chocolate. Dark appearance

2/2/17 (Chicago). 2015 Draft 10 oz pour into snifter at Fountain Head. Black pour, thin lacing, minimal carbonation. Cocoa and coffee aroma and taste. Smooth and easy drinking, solid texture. Overall very good beer.

Oil black pour. Super viscous. Gasoline smell with loads of coffee, dark cocoa, roasted malt and hop. Thick body. Dark and bitter and then sweetens up in the finish. Cant detect much heat but Im feeling it almost immediately.

2016 bottle shared at tasting. Black colour, small beige head. Aroma of strong coffee, vanilla, toasted coconut, bourbon, with notes of dark chocolate - nice and complex. Taste is medium+ sweet, medium- bitter, coffee, vanilla, chocolate, with bitter cocoa and wood in the finish. Medium to full body, oily texture, soft carbonation. Definitely not disappointing BA RIS - rich and balanced, although could be thicker.

Piana drobna, kremowa, całkiem trwała. Kolor czarny, nieprzejrzysty. W aromacie wyrazista czekolada, wanilia, kawa, bourbon i drewno - w tej właśnie kolejności. Fajnie. Smak intensywny, słodki, palony, czekoladowy, waniliowy, kawowy, bourbonowy, w tle jakiś kokos, tonka, lody kakaowe, nieco sztuczny olejek migdałowy... W kontrze dość wysoka, tytoniowo palona goryczka, sporo ciała, niskie, drobne wysycenie, lekko popiołowe, wyklejające i rozgrzewające w odbiorze.

Potężne, kompleksowe piwo - wszystkiego jest tu dużo, wszystko jest dosadne, wręcz agresywne, ale to w końcu Russian Imperial Stout, w dodatku Bourbon Barrel Aged, co więcej, prawdopodobnie na sterydach (z aromatami?)... Mi to odpowiada!

Pours a thick blackish brown, with ample dark tan head. Aroma is rich, with notes of malt, whiskey, oak, and chocolate. Taste is rich and complex. Notes of coffee, malt and BA bourbon. Thumbs way up on this delicious stout.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

W aromacie przede wszystkim kawa, wsparta lekkim kokosem i niestety wsparta czymś dziwnym podchodzącym pod żelazo. W smaku też króluje kawa, tutaj natomiast wsparta gorzką czekoladą, która przez dłuższy czas zostaje w ustach. Na pewno jest to dobre piwo, ale raczej nie jest to piwo dorastające do swojej legendy. Wszystko poza delikatną nutą kojarząca się z żelazem w tym piwie gra, ale gra nie w jakiś legendarnie intensywny i przyjemny sposób. Pomijając oczekiwania, jest to po prostu dobre, a nawet bardzo dobre piwo.

UPDATED: MAY 28, 2017 Smell of caramel, roasted malt, coffee, bourbon, vanilla, and wood barrel itself. Come in deep dark red brown with thin tan crown. Taste of roasted malt, bitter offee, slightly sweet, very smooth, complex but well balanced. Not taste sour coffee as it gets warm like other founders beer. Seeing oak barrel when drinking, just wish it more pronounced. Slightly slimy texture. One of best beer I drank.

This is the bourbon barrel stout that all others aspire to be when they grow up

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma:

Heavy aroma of malts, caramel, wood, vanilla, chocolate, mocha, roasted malts and coffee.

Appearance:

Opaque black beer with slight yeast and with a slight dark brown head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium/heavy sweet with malts, caramel, wood, vanilla, chocolate and mocha; ends slightly bitter and dry with roasted malts and coffee.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. Amazing barrel it aged on, bringing loads of vanilla, working perfectly with the chocolate and coffee already present. Amazing aroma and taste, with a perfect appearance and palate as well.

the aroma of caramel and roasted malt, green coffee, port, toffee, toast and vanilla... the taste is caramel and chocolate with notes of roasted malt, fresh coffee, toast, toffee, oak wood, nuts and vanilla... sweet, bitter, dry and warming aftertaste...

Poured black with a tan head and an espresso, vanilla, dark chocolate nose. Smooth intro with a lightly-carbonated, malty mouthfeel followed by a caramel, espresso, dark chocolate, raisin, date, syrupy finish with some alcohol warming.

Coffee, velvety chocolate, creamy, it really hits all the notes. Terrific. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

An Imperial Stout with large and rich aroma of coffee, roasted malt, alcohol and raisins. From the start, the taste is full and sour and offers a great taste of coffee, chocolate and dried fruits. Alcohol dots a part in the mouth and releases a low heat. It can undoubtedly be long-term storage and become more soft and round within some years. The storage on oak wood contributes to a taste of wood and woodland and provides a very delicate, but also intrusive, Imperial Stout.

Dark Color with strong coffee aroma and slightly bitter taste. Body is well balanced end taste is a bit sweet because of its strong bitterness from coffee from the start. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Appearance: dark black with a chocolately head
Aroma- bourbon predominately, chocolate, coffee
Taste- a heavy, thick stout with first taste bourbon, followed by stout, followed by bourbon with a hint of chocolate

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This is a standout. Marvelous color in the beer and head. Strong, but not jolting coffee flavor, with lingering mild coffee finish. Palate is extraordinary; velvety and lush. This is a winner. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Piana niewielka, wymuszana, brzydka opada. Kolor czarny. Aromat drewno wanilia, mleczna czekolada, kawa, kakao. Smak wyraźna beczka, wanilia, gorzka czekolada, nuty palone, praliny, średnia słodycz, lekkie w odczuciu. Alkohol ułożony wyczuwalny w szlachetny sposób. Piwo Bardzo dobre ale patrząc w ranking RB szczerze spodziewałem się więcej.

Nose of alcohol, barrel and vanilla
Thick body with aromas of chocolate, coffee and barrel.
Finish on alcohol.
This one is quite rough, relies heavily on alcohol and barrel, way less gourmand than the Breakfast Stout.

Pours black with a small tan head.
Nose shows well-integrated coffee and chocolate, roasted and nutty malt. Very well balanced.
Flavours include heavy roast, booze, coffee, cocoa and liquorice.
Carbonation seems pretty aggressive, especially for a beer of this nature.

Butelka 11,9%. Aromat przede wszystkim orzechowy. Wanilia, kakao, beczka. Jakieś takie ziemiste posmaki. Skoro alkoholu po ogrzaniu. Długie posmaki czekoladowo-ziemisto-bourbonowe. Do długiej degustacji. Zawód i to spory.

Bottle shared on the balcony with Martin, Rachel & Nadders. I brough this fellay back from Edinburgh at Christmas. Its been in the cupboard ever since. A special occasion called for a special beer. I understand why everyone gets so worked about it. A delicious beer in every respect with the key strength being *balance*. Coffee, Chocolate, Bourbon, Vanilla. All in equally restrained measure baring in mind its lofty ABV. Very nice.

KBS, what else is there to say? The balance is crazy by tasting each of the three main components.

Reviewed - A Brew With You, Ep. 30
Dark brown with small light brown head. Excellent aroma of whiskey, chocolate, vanilla. Strong but mild bitterness with some sourness and vanilla sweetness and same notes as in the aroma.
Thick black chewy deliciousness. Intensely chocolatey. After two sips from the bottle I realized my foolishness and got it into the snifter it deserved.

Best imperial stout I have ever had. I'm proud because I am from Michigan

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap. Pours pitch black. Khaki head leaves lacing on the glass. Nose is cocoa, mocha, vanilla, and hazelnut. Taste is similarly complex with a big boozy component. Not a beer to be taken lightly, but to be enjoyed leisurely.
Nose: def bourbon aroma, sweet, malt. Taste: nothing I expected. Smooth, sweet, bourbon w/o strong alcohol flavor. Mild coffee. Chocolate.
Well ... one of the most bourbon scent/flavored IS I have tasted. Ultra dominant notes of barrel, fine wood, coffee and cocoa. A bit too vulgar for my taste.

Bottle. Opaque machine oil, small chocolate head with average retention and good amount of lacing. Aroma of dark chocolate, cocoa, vanilla beans, lava cake, bourbon and woodsy notes. Taste of condensed milk, vanilla chocolate, wood chips, leather, burned caramel and alcohol spiciness. Lovely, truly lovely.

Distinct aroma of roasted malt and roasted coffee, but with a sweetness to it that makes my thoughts go to chocolate. Its a difficult ale to analyze since the taste of roast is so clear that I think it is difficult to describe much more but theres definitely more layers to the ale and the top layer of roast isnt spoiling at all. The sweetness might have traces of banana, but I guess it also might be vanilla as it is a long warm sweetness.

The color is dark-dark brown or black, and it had a large head with a light brown color. The foam disappeared a bit quickly though.

Taste wise it has a clear sweetness to it, but the bitters blend in perfectly.

A really thick and oily ale, feels a bit like whole milk in the mouth. The only negative thing in my opinion is the soft carbonation as I prefer a little sting. Luckily the alcohol provides a sting on its own which makes up for it.

A really tasty stout, probably the best Ive had as of now. I also think people with more experienced taste buds than mine would get more out of the ale.

Half pint at Rovers- served pitch black, tan lacing. Aroma of tobacco, smoke, and charred oak. Hits mouth with wide body, malt thick and nicely smoked, middle holds up well, finish has a whole lotta whiskey. BOOM.
Ocena spisana z unttapd w celu uzupełnienia profilu na ratebeer. Z pamięci lekki zawód jak na 14 ris na świecie.

Hype hype hype. I think this beer is worth seeking out the hunt is truly half the fun right? First of all breakfast stout is one the best top shelf easily accessible stouts. Then to barrel age it! This beer is well crafted and flavorful. With that being said I was overwhelmed by the coffee everything took backseat to the coffee And that was disappointing the barrel brought forth vanilla and oak the chocolate roast was there. Its truly a wonderful stout once the coffee punch subsidies. Yes its one of the better barrel aged stouts Ive had but the coffee dominates and masks a lot of flavor that would make kbs really shine. Just my opinion still a beer I will seek out and buy a six pack of reggie to obtain..

Black, medium-brown moderately fine head. Aroma is chocolate, cold-brew coffee, touch of BBQ mesquite, molasses, caramel, (wow!). Body is oily/creamy, heavy, but not overbearing, slightly delayed soft carbonation of moderate coarseness. Flavor is a woody roasty flavor, slight BBQ caramel, moderate cocao. Some bread, oatmeal. Yeah, this is worth the hype!

Flarra restaur krokius. Lite oväntad havsdoft. Och så krämig i munnen. Omedelbart viss havssmak . Ja lite sälta du fattar. För att snabbt få in sötma sen kommer eftersmak av mörk choklad för att följas av fint rätt Mörkrostad bryggkaffe. Viss sötma även i eftersmaken. Sjuuukt god Imp Stout.

UPDATED: MAY 12, 2017 Opaque, tight lace. Full body, very dense flavors, slick and thick mouthfeel, hot, low carbonation, average length. Moderately bittersweet. Assertively coffee liqueur flavored, malty, barley candy, alcohol flavor. Very good but not worth the price. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

You really get the bourbon aroma with caramel, marshmallow, spices, a tiny bit of nuts and a ton of booze. Its a very intense drop with tons of sweet malts and loads of alcohol to warm you on a cold winters night. My only criticism is that its a fraction overdone IMHO.

12 oz bottle, 2017 vintage. Pours a dark brown/black with a 1/2 finger mocha head. Aroma is cherry, vanilla, chocolate, coffee, bourbon. Taste is a big bitter coffee throughout, with minimal chocolate, vanilla, barrel on the backend. Mouthfeel is medium-medium plus. Overall, this is a great stout, but isnt as good as previous years. The bitter coffee dominates the taste, and the barrel is minimal. It is very good, but not as good as other big coffee stouts...Epics Big Bad Baptist and Prairie Coffee Noir are superior in my opinion.

Nearly black with creamy dark brown head. Looks get roast chocolate and oak barrel aroma. Sweet boozy cocoa with oaky roasty with a boozy whiskey vanilla finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma - intense, with lot of strong coffee with some milk, old ground coffee, roasted malt, burnt fruit wood, some black and wild fruits. Taste - intense and rich, with lot of strong coffee with some milk, roasted malt, a bit of burnt malt and fruit wood, burnt bitterness, good combination of alcohol with some black and bitter chocolate, some black fruits slightly smoked. Very good!

Pours: black with small toffee color head. Aroma: is dark chocolate, coffee/espresso, vanilla, and notes of bourbon. Palate: Creamy, Smooth like a stout should be. Taste: Sweet chocolate with a rich roasted malt, dark dried fruit, vanilla bean, with a boozy bourbon finish. 2016 edition, 11.9% abv)
One of my fav stouts... when available!

This tastes like coffee flavored sugar syrup that burns. Its actually better than most BA stouts! Not cardboardy or soy saucy and barely anything wrong with it aside from burning your mouth and being too sweet. People dont like this because its too easy to find but I think its pretty good.

Bottle; pours black with a thin ring of mocha colored head; aroma of coffee, chocolate, bourbon, roasted malt, and hints of vanilla and wood; taste is more sweet than bitter with chocolate, roasted malt, coffee, vanilla, and some bourbon and wood notes; finish is dry, light bitter with some chocolate and a touch of booze; delicious

A perfect balance. Black, thick, smooth, light foamy head, rich, chocolatey , and a great bourbon undertone that is not overdone.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle, 2016 release, pours almost pitch black with beige, fast falling head. Aroma is awsome with a lot of coffee, chocolate, vanilla, oak, red fruits, marzipan and figs. In taste well balanced with medium sweetness and some roasty bitterness. Very coffeish with a lot of dark chocolate flavours. Full bodied but extremly easy drinkable. Great beer.

Bottle, 0.355l, shared with Leo. Pours pitch black color with thin creamy light brown head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, chocolate, nuts and oak. Taste starts moderate sweet and rich roasted malt, follows by chocolate, vanilla, wood and bourbon, mouthfeel is warming, while finish is mild bitter. Full body, thick creamy texture and average carbonation in palate. Superbly drinkable for such high ABV...

UPDATED: MAY 13, 2017 From tap at Taphouse, pours a lively black color with a lasting tan head. Aroma is big with bourbon, coffee, chocolate and roasted barley. Taste is a lot more boozy than I remember it. I have had it a few times and this time, it was like someone added a shot of bourbon to the glass. But the taste is still fantastic, sweet chocolate, creamy mouthfeel and of course bourbon. 

Update:
Had a new keg, and this one is so much better. Discrete coffee and bourbon, sweet chocolate and vanilla. Just like I remember it!

Tap. Aroma coffee, chocolate, caramel, nuts, raisin, and of course the Bourbon. Pours dark with a thin tan circle atop. The sweet vanilla fruitcake burst is a little overpowering but it seems a nice way to conclude this portion of my US trip. I can see why imperial stouts dominate the ratings and equally why they are beers realistically taken on their own. A festive tipple. After these 10oz, nothing further could cope.

Poured into stem glass from bottle. Black with toffee head. Aroma is dark chocolate, espresso, vanilla, date, leather, and notes of bourbon. Flavour is chocolate walnut brownie, dark dried fruit, vanilla bean, bourbon, and roasted malts. Medium to full body. Amazing barrel-aged imperial stout.
355ml bottle, 11,9% abv. Pours black with small brown head. Imperial stout with coffee, vanilla and bourbon edge. Bitter boozy charcoal finish. Really good.

UPDATED: MAY 16, 2017 From a 355ml bottle on 27/4/2017 (2016 edition, 11.9% abv). Pours near black with a small tan head. Has a strong aroma of chocolate, coffee and bourbon. The flavour is huge, and similar to the standard Breakfast Stout, but with the bourbon edge and some extra booziness. It features masses of chocolate and coffee, some vanilla and hints of caramel, with some light roasty bitterness. the palate is thick and creamy, and the carbonation soft. A magnificent brew, though my failure to fully embrace barrel aged beasties means I cant rate it higher than the standard Breakfast edition. But if youre into barrel aged, youll struggle to find better.
This one is a little over-hyped, but still great none the less. The coffee doesnt hold up well to aging this beer imho. Worth trying at least once. Cheers!

Ocena przepisana z Untappd w ramach uzupełnienia profilu. Aromat: na pierwszym planie kawa, mleczna czekolada, praliny. Smak: dobra kawa (żadne tam kwaski arabiki PL), kakao, czekolada, ciut wanilii, bardziej w kierunku goryczki niż słodyczy, alkohol bardzo dobrze ukryty.

2017 vintage. Nice aroma of vanilla, dark chocolate, hint of coffee, and some bourbon. Ebony color with a thin tan head. Sweet up front. Vanilla, followed by rich coffee. Bitterness covered by charcoal notes from barrel, then boozy bourbon comes through nicely. Carbonation just right, pin like and small. Slightly slick mout feel. Warm boozy finish. Nice.

(bottle 2017 vintage)
Aroma:intensive coffee beans note,vanilla,milk chocolate.
Appearance:black color,small yellowish head.
Taste:semi-sweet,flavour of coffee,vanilla,roasted malt,dark chocolate and boooooooz,boozy/roasty finish.
Palate:full body,quite boozy,low carbonation,
Overall:Good one but the booz is way too strong,needs some age to be enjoyed fully.

KBS bourbon barrel aged is strong, aromatic and surprisingly easy to drink. I love a shot or two of Blantons or Woodford, but combining the essence of a fine bourdon so brilliantly with Founders ability to construct a bold stout creates a masterpiece. For those who appreciate Epics Big Bad Baptist or North Coasts Old Rasputin, KBS will ignite your passion. Truly the epitome of bourbon barrel stouts.
On tap, pours black with medium long-lasting head. Nose of coffee, vanilla, bourbon, and chocolate. Flavor to match that just coats the entire palate. Not much else to add to this classic!

Finally found a bottle of this. :-) 35cl sample. The aroma has strong vanilla, smooth moccha and chocolate, bit roast and bourbon. Black coloured beer with a creamy, beige head. The taste is light-moderate bitter, light-moderate sweet with strong vanilla tones, very smooth moccha chocolate, bit fudge, chocolate and roasty tones. Very pleasant smooth mouthfeel. Barrel aging is wonderful done, not too much and definitely getting the bourbon complexity in the beer. Good stuff. Lives up to its status.

Très bien foutue.
Nez bien gourmand, rond, complet : café, chocolat, signature carame, torréfaction timide, ça sent un peu le gras, doù le côté gourmand.
Bouche plutôt puissante, pas agressive, assez épaisse, bien plus torréfiée et noire. Petite attaque café. Les notes gourmandes sont en soutien mais sefface devant le caractère. Superbe longueur.

2017 brewing. Crowler from Kunda Beverage in King of Prussia, PA. Pours oil black with minimal dark brown head. Sweet bitter coffee and booze aroma. Mouthfeel is heavy but not super heavy. Little carbonation. Taste is both of coffee and bourbon. Coffee makes it kind of bitter. Bourbon makes it sweet and bourboney but not crazily so. Very good but I doubt Id hunt it down. Glad to have tried it though.

Bottle (12oz). Black with 1/2 finger light brown head. Aroma of bourbon and coffee. Taste is very coffee. Not much chocolate. Pretty good, but after one try, it does not live up to the hype. I have another, will try again with an open mind.

Pours a a half finger of tan head on a black body. Aroma is coffee, milk, wood, burnt caramel, and roasted malt. Amazing. Taste is black coffee, licorice, alcohol heat, and roasted malt. Texture is soft and smooth.

Black body with a rather small, long-lived, medium brown head that sticks to the glass. Intense aroma of dark roasted malt, dark and bitter chocolate, cocoa, strong coffee and fruits, with alcohol and ash in the back. Quite intense flavour that follows the aroma, but with more pronounced ashy notes, and also quite obvious influence from the barrel ageing: wood, a bit too boozy bourbon and some vanilla. Moderate to heavy sweet taste with a very long-lasting and heavy bitter finish. Full-bodied, creamy and smooth mouthfeel, soft carbonation. A magnificent brew, but I guess a couple of more years in the bottle would have made the experience even smoother (i.e. mellowed out the alcohol). 
[33.5 cl bottle, 2016 edition, enjoyed 11 months after bottling, from Vinmonopolet Storo, Oslo]

On tapm Boozy aroma. Some roast, more woody notes than malt as it warms. The sort of aroma I associate with wine. Weaker than expected. Pours black with a lace of tan head. Flavor is rich. Sweet, roasted malt, wood. The malt is pretty generic roast, not super coffee of chocolate etc. Some bread notes. Lots of alcohol warmth. It also kind of stings the tongue. Sticky on the tongue, like so thick. Its not at all cloying, and maybe Im broken but its not as complex as I had anticipated.

Bottle, 355 ml, 2016. Courtesy of klm1 (thanks for this one!), shared with JFK10000. Pours dark brown, medium brown head. Coffee in aroma. Sweet, lasting strong coffee, roasted malts, bourbon finish. Sweet, bitter finish, oily, chocolate. Smooth. Warming. Medium to full bodied. Very nice.

12 oz bottle, black with tan head. Aroma of coffee, vanilla, cocoa. Taste is oak, roasty coffee, dark chocolate, vanilla, hints of bourbon. Thick and chewy body, a little boozy but smooth overall. Long aftertaste of bitter dark roasted coffee. Great BBA stout but a tad underwhelming.

BOTTLE 12 OZ. Pitch black, dark espresso head. Loads of earthy coffee upfront, dark treacle, cooking chocolate, rich yet smooth and well polished. Smooth Chocolaty and coffee taste, rich and intense, like chocolate truffles, background spicy alcohol, gentle yet robust roasty and hoppy bitterness. Great.
Both 2016-and 2017 on tap at whole foods in Wexford. Both great with subyile vanilla notes that smooth the coffee. Not much lacing but a modest head

355ml bottle from LCBO. Pours an opaque deep brown colour. Aromas of dark chocolate, coffee, vanilla and a whiff of bourbon. Intensely complex taste. It matches the aroma. Creamy and full mouthfeel with moderate carbonation. Excellent brew

Coffee, vanilla and a real bourbon profile that is nothing short of awesome. A little sugary, a little roasted, a little chocolaty. Quick on the palate. VERY strong. Completely lush and full with a long, pleasant bourbon syrup finish.

Aromat jest bardzo intensywny i złożony. Na początku czuję sporo gorzkiej czekolady. Po chwili pojawiają się słodsze nuty kawy oraz pralin. W smaku piwo jest jeszcze intensywniejsze. Pierwszy łyk to bardzo mocny zastrzyk gorzkiego smaku. Czarna gorzka czekolada z lekko palącym finiszem. Biorę drugiego łyka i teraz na finiszu mam długą waniliowa nutę. Świetnie piwo.
12 oz bottle pours black with a brown head. Aroma of bourbon, vanilla, oak, coffee and toffee. Taste is bourbon, chocolate and coffee.

Love this beer! Poured into a Teku glass from bottle. The beer is jet black with a beige head which doesnt hang around for too long. The nose is bourbon, coffee, vanilla and chocolate. Mouthfeel is thick and coats the mouth. Taste is heavy alcohol (as expected) with bourbon, oak, vanilla and coffee. Overall, a great BBA Stout.

Pitch black with thin espresso head that vanishes quickly to leave a fizzy coating on the surface. Nice lacing. Strong notes of bourbon-like alcohol, cocoa, vanilla, oats, discretely smoked oak and American coffee in the nose. Taste is strong bourbon upfront, but the alcoholic potency fades only slightly towards the end to leave some room to the coffee and vanilla undertones. Flavours of cocoa, dark chocolate and licorice are present, partly underwhelmed by the ever-present booze kick. Even if the bourbon flavours definitely stand out, the overall harmony of the flavours is not affected. Low carbonation, full bodied, creamy mouthfeel. Very good.
Poured from bottle into stout glass. Pours with a good 1 finger dark tan head. Aroma of bourbon, vanilla, dark coffee, chocolate. Taste follows suit, thick mouthfeel.
Butelka, barwa ciemna nieprzejrzysta. W aromacie kawa, czekolada, bardzo wyraźna beczka po bourbonie. W smaku wspaniała słodyczka, kawa, czekolada, beczka. Świetnie zbalansowane, dużo ciała.

An unexpected find at the Casual Pint in San Angelo, many thanks. The 750 ml bomber yields a black as death body into my snifter along with a thinnish brown foam on top. The nose is outstanding, very bourbony, very boozy, a delight. A drink gives a solid, strong hit of dark chocolate, spiciness, roasted pecans, very full mouth feel. Actually it gets better as you progress through the bottle. Really fine.

355ml bottle at 11.9% ABV. Pours black with a one-finger tan head, surprisingly good retention for the ABV. Aroma is very rich - chocolate, roasted coffee, vanilla, bourbon oaky notes and alcohol. Taste is also rich and complex, lovely sweet chocolate and bitter roasted coffee flavours, big hit of vanilla, nice oaky bourbon notes and a lovely warming sensation given by the alcohol, treacle, biscuity malt, some dark fruit. Full bodied, soft carbonation, lovely silky smooth mouthfeel. This is a fantastic beer. It gets a ton of hype and I think it just about lives up to it. I have another bottle of this which I will age and drink later in the year, probably at Christmas, well see if it gets better...

Draft. Black with a little cola. Khaki head. Aromas of very dark chocolate, plums, cherries, oak, leather, and a little dark roast coffee. 12.9% is nearly completely hidden, but bourbon is warming. Prune and just a little smoke added to the aromas. Great stuff. Mild aftertaste for all the complexity. Silky consistency.
on tap dark pour mocha head lots of chocolate and roast in aroma flavor was same with nice warm finish
Bottle split with DiarmaidBHK - Its smooth chocolately coffee decadence rolled in bourbon. Its hyped for a reason, because its fantastic.
Opaque black with a thick beige head. Aroma is boozy bourbon with a hint of cinnamon and espresso. Flavor is same bourbon with molasses and a strONG but gentle dark chocolate aftertaste. Heavy palate
Wow great everything on this image sure all the superlatives have been used up on this but just wow.
czuć wyraźnie beczke i w smaku i w zapachu. Do tego czekolada, wanilia, kawa. Piana szybko opada, redukuje sie do pierscienia. Swietny balans miedzy slodycza i goryczka. Swietne piwo.
A really solid stout, but I think it didnt live up to the hype. I dont feel that much bourbon flavor that i was hoping for.

New bottle (?) at 11.9% alc. vol. Pours with coffee colored foam and color is very dark brown, almost pitch black. Aroma is strong and has bourbon whisky notes, alcohol, roasted malts, some rainy day soil notes, some tea notes and tanninic red wine notes as well. Palate is a bit more oily than dry and is not balanced, but not poor either. Strong taste has bourbon whiskey, alcohol, mämmi, dark malts, tanninic red wine, dried plum. The taste is quite complex. Its a quality dark beer, but personally I dont fancy its taste "spectrum" too much. I know tastier beers in this style. Not bad at all though.
Ouch, 11.2% stout. Had a bad day, wife in hospital, needed a strong drink, tried the KBS... k.o. Perfect beer for the situation.

Bottle from Beerhawk. Pours oily black with tight foam tan head. Nose ticks all the boxes nicely: smooth vanilla, dusty dark chocolate, boozy oak cask, dark roasted coffee. Flavour hits big, boozy sweet treacle, strong bitter coffee and chocolate biscuits. Lovely soft smooth texture with a gentle dry sparkle. Chest warming. Big boozy luxury stout thatll warm the spirits. Just think of the booziest cafe mocha and youre in the ballpark.

Flavor of roasted sweet malt, oak, dark chocolate, caramel, rich coffee, some licorice, and bourbon notes; Smooth warm finish; Nicely balanced & complex; This is a rerate for me - this current batch seems better and smoother than others I had in the past. Tasted @ Olut 

Shared @ Olut Sabadell

Bouteille avec un BB du 20/12/2017 en plus dune birthday brew. Robe noire comme la nuit et surmontée dun léger col de mousse brunâtre laiteux qui sestompe rapidement. Arômes de chocolat noir onctueux, vanille, pâte à biscuit, crème de café, malt légèrement caramélisé, le tout sur un fond de bourbon sucré se mêlant à merveille aux autres effluves. En bouche, cest carrément un dessert liquide. Brownies au chocolat noir, liqueur de noisettes, vanille, café latte. Tout cela sans devenir trop sucré et lourd. On perçoit quelques saveurs de caramel fraîchement fondu et de malt grillé au même moment que le liquide semble vouloir sépaissir. La finale est très axée sur le chocolat noir mais aussi sur le bois arrosé de bourbon et bien sûr du café moyennement torréfié qui forme un duo parfait avec le chocolat. Le bourbon nest aucunement mis de lavant et ne fait que se mêler parfaitement au reste. Il est plus présent de longues secondes après une gorgée où on sent son côté épicé/alcoolisé. La texture onctueuse et lisse est superbe, le corps dune rondeur à faire pâlir les concurrentes de Miss Monde. Le haut taux dalcool est pratiquement imperceptible. Superbe bière.

Botella en 99Cervezas.

De intensidad media-alta en nariz (probablemente, porque una vez más no me he podido esperar el tiempo suficiente a que se atemperara; la tentación era demasiado grande). Enseguida salen las notas de chocolate y licorosas, que reinan sobre las demás: notas de café, un puntito de regaliz, una nota muy seca que no acabo de identificar y que resulta extremadamente agradable y algo de ciruela pasa bastante clara. Sin duda compleja. Su generosa graduación alcohólica ya se percibe en nariz, aunque de forma contenida y terriblemente elegante. Sin duda alguna, en nariz es una de las mejores cervezas que he tenido el placer de probar. Huele tan bién que casi da pena empezar a bebértela. Pero creo que lo superaré

Vierte en color castaño muy oscuro, que en la copa resulta opaco a pesar de lo cual, es una cerveza claramente brillante e incluso bonita. La espuma es muy escasa, de color café y con burbuja muy pequeña. Sorprende mucho la extraordinaria persistencia de la corona de espuma para ser tan poco abundante. Las lágrimas son perfectamente apreciables y dan a la cerveza un aspecto licoroso y muy elegante.

En boca es Impresionante. ¡Qué maravilla de cerveza! Me repongo y sigo con las notas de cata. De entre los sabores básicos destacan el dulce y el amargo, en un equilibrio absolutamente perfecto, agradabilísimos y jamás dulzona o agresiva. El café sale aquí con toda su fuerza, acompañado por el chocolate. Si el alcohol resultaba evidente en nariz, en boca parece mucho más suave, sin perder el grato toque licoroso. El sabor en su conjunto es una auténtica delicia, para paladearlo con calma, ...aunque a la vez con prisa de echar otro poco de cerveza a la boca.

Gran cuerpo, textura sedosa, indudablemente cálida y con una persistencia en boca media-alta. Llena perfectamente la boca sin apoderarse de ella. Lo hace a la vez de una forma delicada pero con carácter, dejando una sensación en boca de absoluto placer cervecero. Soberbia!

Generalmente, cuando pruebo una cerveza en la que tengo altas expectativas, tiende a decepcionarme un poco (sin duda por culpa de mis expectativas, no de la cerveza), pero en esta ocasión las ha superado de lejos. Es una cerveza con una elegancia arrolladora, impresionante en nariz e increíblemente deliciosa en boca. Sin lugar a dudas, es la mejor Imperial Stout o que he probado nunca.

Forgot to rate this last year. "Word on the street has it that this 2017 batch is the best in years", according to the man at the beer store. Honestly, my beer memory is not that good. All I recollect is that last years was damn good and so is this years. Kind of a Rite of Spring. Thousands of people have described this extra special brew so all I can say is if you dont know already how this looks, smells, tastes and so on, saddle your pony and head on down to the nearest shop that has this in stock, open your wallet, cause it aint cheap, and get ready for a real treat.

ASPETTO: nero impenetrabile, schiuma marrone abbastanza scuro, praticamente perfetta. AROMA/GUSTO: caffè, cacao, cioccolato, liquirizia, ciliegie sotto spirito...bbbona!!!!! Corpo decisamente, ma decisamente strutturato, consistenza direi oleosa. Veramente si fa ricordare!!!

After 4 years of chasing this beer down, I finally hit the mother load! KBS did not disappoint. Poured in to a brandy snifter. The head was a bit thin but the carbonation was perfect. The aroma wasnt as powerful as I had hoped but it was still incredible! 

Taste was perfect! It did remind me of the Breakfast stout but with just a touch more chocolate and coffee. Not to mention a nice bourbon backbone that settles in just right; not to heavy, not to soft.

12 ounce bottle into snifter, bottled on 2/14/2017. Pours opaque dark brown/black color with a 1-2 finger dense and rocky tan head with fantastic retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lasts. Great dense soapy lacing clings around the glass. Fantastic appearance. Aromas of milk/dark chocolate, cocoa, dark roasted coffee, caramel, molasses, vanilla, bourbon, toasted oak, coconut, dark bread, light smoke, and roast/oak earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of dark/roast/bready malt, chocolate, coffee, and bourbon barrel notes; with solid strength. A bit of booze as it warms. Taste of huge milk/dark chocolate, cocoa, dark roasted coffee, caramel, molasses, vanilla, bourbon, toasted oak, coconut, dark bread, light smoke, and roast/oak earthiness. Light roast bitterness and bourbon/oak spiciness on the finish; with lingering notes of milk/dark chocolate, cocoa, dark roasted coffee, caramel, molasses, vanilla, bourbon, toasted oak, coconut, dark bread, light smoke, and roast/oak earthiness on the finish for a while. Incredible complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/roast/bready malt, chocolate, coffee, and bourbon barrel flavors; with an awesome roasted bitter/sweet balance, and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Slight dryness from roast bitterness and bourbon/oak spiciness as well. Light-medium carbonation and full body; with a very smooth, creamy/silky/velvety, and slightly tannic/chalky mouthfeel that is awesome. Minimal warming alcohol for 11.8%, with zero barrel booziness. Overall this is an amazing barrel aged imperial coffee stout. All around incredible complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/roast/bready malt, chocolate, coffee, and bourbon barrel flavors; very smooth and dangerously easy to sip on for the huge ABV. Pretty much perfectly balanced between barrel, malt, and chocolate/coffee flavors. A highly enjoyable offering.
Very, very nice. Strong coffee aroma and taste, mellow carbonation. Some booze, but not much. Roasted malt.

UPDATED: APR 11, 2017 Draught. Pours black-ish with a small tan head. Aroma is very boozy; coffee, whisky, oak, sweet malt, and some dark chocolate. Taste is similar, but bigger; whisky, fudge, roast, coffee, bittersweet dark chocolate, and oak. Just a hint of vanilla - less than expected. Boozy finish. Lingering coffee and some resulting light bitterness. Full body. Soft carbonation. Silky mouthfeel.

Black pour, quick tan head. Nose is chocolate, coffee, wood, and bourbon. Bittersweet. Middle caresses the tongue with silky mocha, oak, mellow bourbon, spices, and charred malt. Finish is bittersweet and a little smoky. Masterful brew
UPDATED: APR 30, 2017 You dont need to hear the same thing from me as everybody else, so Ill just say this is as good as Ive ever had. Wish I knew how to get lots more.

Rich dark brown/black color; Heavy creamy body; Aroma of smoky malt, oak, vanilla, coffee, chocolate, & some bourbon; Flavor of roasted sweet malt, oak, dark chocolate, caramel, rich coffee, some licorice, and bourbon notes; Smooth warm finish; Nicely balanced & complex; This is a rerate for me - this current batch seems better and smoother than others I had in the past.
Bottle from systembolaget. Pours a deep dark colour beer with a small head. Roasted malts with chocolate, coffee, hazelnut and coffee. Very nice beer, well balanced and with a dry velvety finish.

Shared with Ted E cause lets face it, at $14.95 for 200ml at Spooning Goats, and only on my second rate for the night. I knew this would be an unusual palate charger, something to end with, not quaff as a starter, Dark as the table we are sitting at, all I can see is the cream head floating like a magic trick, rich chocolate notes hit the nostrils first, bordering on tia maria, the licorice I want to smell is sweeter than usual, more dutch triple no smoke, though there is a burnt caramel tickling my olfactory, first sip and the tastebuds go into backflips, what the hell am I tasting? Roll it for a while and the viscosity is extraordinary, bitter sweet and exotic, a stinging abv says drink me while eating something rich, possibly smoked, cream would cut this so well. Beer liquor, I feel like my night has ended early, who wants this taste to dissipate. Complex and divine.

On tap at Spooning Goats, Sydney. Obsidian black with thin tan-coloured head. Nose is caramel, bourbon, dark chocolate and treacle. Amazingly inviting. Smooth mouthfeel. Oily texture. Finish is raisin and dark chocolate. Great beer.
Bottle. Black with small brown head. Aroma and taste is roasted, wood, vanilla and some coffee. Alcohol is present. Very bitter. A good beer, but I personaly thinks its a bit to bittter.

Bottle from RED in Bellevue. Pours a deep, dark brown with a very creamy, chestnut head. Nose is of roasted malts, alcohol, and a hint of bourbon. Taste is of roasted malts and a clean bitterness. Mouthfeel is very creamy. There's a lingering bitterness and twang from the bourbon barrels, with a horsey note. Somewhat lives up to the hype, although there are comparable beers in more abundant supply and for a lower cost. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

What a treat! This one, just like Backwoods Bastard, takes me to a place where it is almost a forbidden experience like moonshine in the early days. The alcohol is strong, but smooth and warmingly friendly. Notes of coffee and chocolate layered inbetween the barrel aged muscle. A true classic.

2017 edition. Really strong coffee note in the nose. Pours black with sticky dark tan head. Velvety mouth feel finished smooth. You can feel the booze on on your breath but no sting. Lives up to its reputation.

Bottle into tulip glass, opaque black color with dark tan head. Aroma notes of strong coffee, chocolate, roasted malt, caramel and bourbon. Taste adds chocolate milk, mocha, oak, brown sugar, raisins and some Baileys liquor. Heavy body, low carbonation, rich, creamy, sticky with lingering coffee roast finish. Wow this really nails the style, no wonder its tops.

strong coffee, roasted barley, and chocolate aromas with faint hints of oak. pitch black in color with nice brown head. full body and silky mouth-feel. taste is strongly coffee and chocolate up front. light oak and bourbon flavors follow, finishing with coffee, light chocolate, and faint vanilla flavors.

12 fl. oz bottle from Craft Beer Kontor Hannover and costs me 6,99 . BB date 6.Dec.2017. Pours out oily and BLACK! Smallest dark beige head. Vanilla, choco and dark fruity on the nose, caramell in the background. Taste has a lot of whiskey, dark choco, some coffee. Huge body. Hopy in the second row, increasing bitterness and alcoholic. Great strong stuff!

The famous kibbis, 2017 edition, poured from a 12 oz bottle on 04.04.17. A: Fizzy head quickly recedes with a hard pour. A: Mocha, chocolate, coffee beans, and bourbon. It smells well balanced. T: Well balanced in the flavors too. Cherry, chocolate, mocha, coffee beans, bourbon, and oaky woodiness. P: On the thin side for a BBA stout. Fizzy at first, but it smooths out. O: Balance truly sums up this beer. After all of the years of hype, I expected this to be a bomb of one form or another. But its not. Every flavor plays off of another, washing over and over, and then repeating the cycle until its gone.

Beautiful balance among the coffee, chocolate and bourbon flavors. The body is silky/creamy, and just slightly syrupy. The finish is extremely lengthy and smooth with no excess heat. An absolutely wonderful Imperial stout that was well worth the wait to finally enjoy.

Bottle from systembolaget Sweden. Medium lasting brown head. Very dark color. Marvellous aroma of dark chocolate, bourbon and dark roasted malts. Nice balanced malt sweetness and bitterness. Big body.

Botella 33 cl en el Taxman León 27..03..2017. Sin Lote Fcpref 30..11..2017 Color negro intenso con espuma beige oscuro que desaparece al poco tiempo. Sabores intensos maltas quemadas torrefactos con grandes toques de maderas empapadas en bourbon y gran sensación licorosa y alcohólica con 11.9 vol que la hacen casi difícil de beber. Cuerpo medio a intenso. Bastante buena. Para repetir.
I stort sett svart öl med ett kraftfullt mörkare brunt skum. Doft och smak av choklad, kakao, kaffe och bourbon. Boubontonerna kommer fram mest i eftersmaken, vilken ligger kvar länge.
One of the best beers (imperial Stout) I have tasted... Possibly because it is difficult to have it regularly (expensive).

On tap @ Toronado Seattle. Finally the fruits of Founders distro hitting Washington - this has been a long sought brew. Pours thick dark brownish black with thin mocha head. Aroma is sweet milk chocolate, some vanilla, dry oak barrels, light boozy bourbon. Taste is creamy milk chocolate, rich with a full mouthfeel. Loads of sweet, oaky bourbon whilst not being heavy or overly boozy. Milky mocha espresso notes linger. Dry with a lightly sharp dark chocolate note on the finish. Really good. A bit underwhelming when compared to all the modern adjunct laden barrel-aged imperial stouts, but a true original.
Rich dark brown, tan foam. Aroma toasted chocolate, cigars, raisinets. Tastes caramel chocolate raisins. Creamy and mild. Underwhelming. Too soft.
Super famous, really good. Its close to be mind blowing, but for now, around all this amazing beer - its not any more. Must try, worth to try.

Bottle 2016. Pours pitch black, low head. Cocoa, vanilla, chocolate, bourbon, alcohol, some coffee, roasty, biscuits. Strong bitterness, some sweetness and sourness. Supprisingly rather medium than full body, lively.

Jesus Christ Jesus Christ Jesus Christ Jesus Christ Jesus Christ Jesus Christ Jesus Christ Jesus Christ Jesus Christ Jesus Christ Jesus Christ Jesus Christ Jesus Christ Jesus Christ Jesus Christ

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap at Red Hot. Black, thin tan head. Scent is coffee and brown sugar. Taste very roasty. Dark chocolate, coffee, molasses. Pretty boozy stuff. Good burn on the way down. Very tasty.

Brown bottle, 355 ml, purchased at the LCBO - Rideau, savoured on April 3 2017 ; eye: black, opaque, sheet of dark brown head that turns into a ring, slight lacing; nose: bourbon, ink, roasted malt, light burnt malt, anise, ink, vanilla, coffee, slight chocolate, caramel; mouth: bourbon, ink, roasted malt, light burnt malt, anise, ink, vanilla, light soy sauce, coffee, light chocolate, caramel, finale in bourbon with presence of coffee, full body, below-average carbonation, mildly sweet, lightly harsh texture; overall: fine

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille brune, 355 ml, achetée à la LCBO - Rideau, savourée le 3 avril 2017; il : noire, opaque, couverture de mousse brun foncé qui se transforme en un anneau, très légère dentelle; nez : bourbon, encre, malt torréfié, léger malt brûlé, anis, encre, vanille, café, très léger chocolat, caramel; bouche : bourbon, encre, malt torréfié, léger malt brûlé, anis, encre, vanille, léger sauce soya, café, léger chocolat, caramel, finale en bourbon avec présence de café, corsée, carbonatation sous la moyenne, moyennement sucrée, texture légèrement râpeuse; en résumé : bien

Keg at The Bottle Shop, Bermondsey, London in Apr 2017 - Opaque Dark Brown / Black colour. Beige head. Aromas of coffee, chocolate and bourbon. Taste of roast malts, roast coffee, dark chocolate, caramel. Bourbon and vanilla notes. Bit oaky. Dark fruit notes and a hint of spice. Warming alcohol. Thick texture, smooth and rich. Sweet roast coffee, chocolate and bourbon malty throughout. Bittersweet roasty finish. Enjoyable. Very nice Impy Stout. (2017-04)

Served on tap at Park House (Pitt). Black color with a brown head. Sweet maple bourbon aroma. Sweet cherry chocolate vanilla alcohol. Heavy body. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Strong aroma of coffee and bourbon, some vanilla. Taste of coffee, vanilla and cocoa, with the coffee dominating. Quite a sweet taste but the high alcohol content seems to be evident. Some depth of bourbon flavour. Overall very pleasant beer, the alcohol is very noticeable on the taste, but the flavours work remarkably well. Essentially a strong coffee stout, with this batch at least.

Barwa czarna, piana bujna, beżowa.
Aromat intensywny, kawa, nuty palone, czekolada, słodkie kakao, nieco pralinkowe.
W smaku pełne i wytrawne.Ciemna czekolada, kawa, nuty popiołowe. w tle słodkie kakao typu nesquik. Piwo wytrawne. Finisz to średnio-wysoka kakaowa goryczka.

tap at Mikkeller Bar in Copenhagen. pours deep dark brown, almost black, unclear. little beige head. aroma is fantastic, from quality coffee notes, dark chocolate, cream liqueur, vanilla and pralines at the end, even more intense once warmed as suggested. aroma reflected perfectly in the taste, full body and silky texture, almost flat. barrel felt significantly at the finish. alcohole only perceptible as a pleasant warming in the throat. really, really good stuff...

Bottle. Pours oily and dark brown with light brown head. Aroma has vanilla, bourbon, chocolate, coffee and roasted malts, wow. Taste has a lot of chocolate, vanilla, coffee, roasted malt and bourbon too. Great beer for dessert, amazing beer.

0,33 l bottle. Pours oily, dark brown with a finger of brown head. Nose is huge, chocolate, bourbon vanilla, coconut, brown sugar, plenty of malt, biscuit malt and roasted malts, caramel, coffee and a big dose of bourbon liquor. Not just alcohol, but proper bourbon. Flavor is similar. If you hold it in your mouth long it becomes a chocolate and bourbon bomb. It is heavy sweet, but sweetness is complemented well with alcohol and long chocolate bitter finish. Texture is oily, thick even, carbonation average, finish is long and bitter, full of chocolate, coffee and bourbon aftertaste. I drank it, as its name suggests, for breakfast and I can feel it. Huge beer!
Shared bottle. Pours very dark brown with a thin tan head. Complex aroma - vanilla, chocolate, coffee, sweet smoke, spices - that translates into the flavour. Lovely warm finish
Black beer, brown head. Smells of coffee, chocolate, toffee, liquorice. Taste has all of that too. Its rich and smooth, some earthiness, some dried fruit in there too. Delicious.

Cocoa, bourbon, vanilla, chocolate, black with a thin brown head, full body, practically flat, thick and a bit oily, again strong notes of chocolate and cocoa, coffee and a extremely pleasant warming final of bourbon...great beer obviously.

DWF; Bottle from Vinmonopolet. Pours small , black with a creamy, lacing and lasting tan head. Nose is heavy, dark chocolate, roasted malt, coffe, light smoke and spice. Taste is heavy sweet and bitter with lasting warming, light barrel finish. Body is full, texture is silky, carbonation is flat.

Massive coffe, oak, vanilla and chocolate in the nose. Very smooth low carbonation tons of coffe oak and vanilla. Slightly boozy finish. This version is pretty big with coffee and oak, just a bit rougher than what I remember but still good stuff.
Delicious. Coffee, vainilla and cocoa aroma, coffee, vainilla, cocoa bourbon flavour. Amazing aromas, flavours, textures. Tasted in Olut club de cata

From a 12 oz bottle, pours a black body with a small and fast despairing tan head.
Aroma of roasted malts, vanilla, chocolate and hints of liquor. Flavors of rich roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, oak, licorice, spices and herbs, and light smoke. Nice rich full body,with some nice complexity, but some flavors are not lasting, but the chocolate does finish nicely. Nicely made and quite enjoyable.
Bottle from Alko. Black with xl not lasting head. Strong coffee, dark berries. Vanilla. Strong alcohol bite from start. Quite fizzy.

Bottle. Pours a black body with a medium tan head. Looks good! Aroma of roasted malts, caramel, bourbon, vanilla, wood, smoke and coffee. Flavour is light sweet but balanced. The bourbon is not taking up too much "space" which makes the malts, coffee and vanilla notes really shine! Finishes with a bit of warmth, tho the alcohol is nowhere to be found in the flavour, an assertive bitterness and notes of coffee and dark chocolate. Really a superb stout this. Drinks like it was atleast 2-3 % less abv also. Smooth mouthfeel and soft co2 levels.
2016 bottle, rich biscuit chocolate coffee cake, hints of coconut vanilla and fruity esters, lovely medium sweetness, med roasted bitterness, light alcohol warmth and bourbony spike.

Bottle as a gift from Helsinki, shared with M. ABV 11.9%. BB 29.11.17. Really dark brown with smallish mocha head. Retention good. Coffee and bourbon nose and flavour. Sweetish vanilla and saltier bourbony notes. Really dark roastiness. Coffee rather strong, fresh ground. Alcohol well covered, its got rather modest booziness considering the 11.9%. Pretty surprising light body. Carbonation mellow. Pretty neat stuff!

Butelka 2015. Aromat przykryty przez kawę, taką świeżo mieloną, intensywna. W tle kakao, czekolada, wanilia. W smaku zaś już lekko utlenione. Intensywna beczka, wanilia, bourbon, czekolada. Goryczka średnia, podbita palonymi słodami. Aksamitne, niskie wysycenie, wręcz oleiste ciało. Z pewnością dorównuje swojej legendzie.

2017 LCBO bottle. Pours black with a half finger of mocha head that thins to a bubbly film. Aroma has big notes of coffee, roasted malts, bourbon barrel, slight nuttiness, mild caramel and chocolate, and hints of dark fruits.
Taste is huge. Big and roasty with bourbon barrel, coffee, caramel, toffee, dark chocolate, dark fruits, and just enough hops to balance out the sweetness. Medium-full body with a low-medium carbonation. A medium syrup in the mouth with a dry finish. Overall big, bold, and unapologetic. Lots of coffee with smooth whiskey barrels mixes with caramel, chocolate, and dark fruits.
Full bodied creamy bear with large head. Aromas of coffee, chocolate, bourbon, roast, vanilla, sweet fruits, oak. Very complex. Everything in balance. Extraordinary beer.

Pullo @ Alko. Kaatuu snifteriin sysimustana ja hyvin paksuna, noin sormen paksuisella hyvin tummalla vaahdolla. Tuoksussa vahvimpana on, kuten pelkäsinkin, hyvin runasa kahvisuus. Tätä tukemassa on maitosuklaisuus ja puinen tynnyriaromi, joten pelkäksi kahviksi tämä ei onneksi jää. Hieman on myös vanilijaa ja makeaa vaahtokarkkimaisuutta, sekin ehkä vanilijasta. Maku on edelleen vahvan kahvinen, mutta viskisyys on lähes yhtä vahvaa. Hiven on myös suklaisuutta sekä puumaisuutta, varmaankin tynnyristä. Myös lakritsia löytyy, hieman yllättäen mukaan ja jälkimaussa on vanilijaista makeutta. Suutuntuma on melko alkoholinen, hyökkäävän humaloitu ja epätasapainoisen oloinen. En ymmärrä alkuunkaan tämän saamaa hypeä, aivan liian kahvinen ja alkoholinen omaan makuuni. Tynnyröinti tuntuu, muttei pelasta. Kypsyttely tekisi varmasti hyvää, ainakin itseni kannalta.

Bottle shared @Pułapka, Gdańsk
Coffee took over the aroma. I wish the aroma was more complex. A bit sweet taste, coffee and cocoa, mild oat finish. Would love move body

33CL BOTTLE
from Valhallas goat glasgow
 pours a dark colour with thin beige head
 aroma burnt sugar bit of spice
 very alcoholic taste dry and sweet spicy 
 nice beer
33 cl bottle from systembolaget. Pours black with little head. Sweet caramel malty aroma with coffee, chocolate and cocoa taste.

black color with brown small head. aroma is alcohol, malty, roasted
flavor is chocolate & coffee , sweet & strong
well balanced..nice beer!

UPDATED: MAY 11, 2017 1 finger light tan head.
Pitch black beer.
Aroma is mostly sweet vanilla and coffee with a lovely boozy kick, but man.. Nothing else is needed. Could smell this all day. 
Taste follows the aroma with a pleasant whiskey afterburn. 
So simple yet so delicious. A bit short aftertaste though, which drags it down a point. A strong 7.
Mouthfeel is medium thick and slightly oily. Quite dry at the back, probably from the barrel aging. 
Overall: Very nice Imp. stout. Kinda understand the hype but nowadays, this baby has a lot of competitors in the scene and it isnt a 10/10 with todays standards. Still, it holds its own and this, along with Breakfast Stout and Imp. Stout by Founders should all be Stouts that one should always have at home.

UPDATED: MAR 23, 2017 Bottle (2016) courtesy of Iznogud, shared with Trolleo and Veceo. Almost black, tiny brownish head. Enormous coffee and bourbon aroma, more soft than roasty. Well hidden strength. Lovely, lovely aroma, smooth as f*ck. Chocolate, coffee (slightly more than chocolate) , bourbon, smooth with prickly carbonation. Smooth, simply tasty, technically flawless. A lovely beer, worthy of hype!

Garrafa 2016/consumida em Mar 2017: Cerveja preta, espessa, com espuma bege de boa formação e média duração. Aroma predominante de café e cacau, álcool e ao fundo malte torrado, leve baunilha. O sabor tem predomínio do torrado, base de malte doce, mas equilibrado pelo amargor, com bastante café em destaque. O final é bem alcoólico, a impressão é de se estar tomando o próprio bourbon dos barris na qual a cerveja foi envelhecida. Bem encorpada, licorosa, mas com carbonatação que a deixa bem fácil de beber. Muito, muito saborosa, realmente faz jus ao sucesso.

w aromacie wszystko przykrywa mocno kawa, gdzieś tam w tle jest beczka i troche wanili

W smaku jest pełne i dosyć kwasne, podobnie jak w aromacie beczkę mozna wyczuć gdzieś tam w tle beczkę, taka juz dosyć stara jakby z ławka w kościele utopiona w alko, jest tez bardzo długi posmak kawowy

Podsumowując bardziej smakowało mi pite przed chwila edge barrica #24, które jest bardziej subtelne, deserowe i czekoladowe, kbs wydaje mi sie ze spodoba sie bardziej fanom agresywniejszych piw i fanom kawy, ogolnie dobre piwo
Pours dark brown with dark brown head. Extremely intense aroma. Cocoa, coffee, chocolate, caramel, roasted malts. Tastes the same. Full body, creamy texture and sweet aftertaste with bitter notes.

Bottle into a red wine glass as that is the best the holiday cabin had. Allowed to warm for half an hour from the fridge. Poured black with a chocholate milkshake coloured one finger foam. Rich tones of coffee and chocolate and a hint of booze. So smooth, full and round in mouthfeel. Loads of lingering flavour and a hint of bourbon at the end. This was +12% (2016) and it didnt show any alcohol taste at all.
Brilliant. Definitely something to savour at the nights end, but only if you hadnt been drinking prior as it counts as 3.5 standard drinks per small bottle.
On tap at BCTR. Pours black with a tan head. Aroma and taste are roast malt, chocolate, caramel, cocoa, coffee, bourbon and has a nice warming finish.

Black with strong dark tan head. Coffee beans, real and not just something like it this time, vanilla, very dark burn malt, alcohol. Salty, licorice, alcohol, vanilla and wood. Slick, oily palate, full body, An excellent very heavy stout. Split it with a friend!

I would eat breakfast 3 times a day, just for an excuse to drink it. Difficult to find in Belgium.
Could not find anything really to criticize, except that the bottle is too small.
Black with small beige foam. Nose of chocolate and espresso. Dark malt and coffee in taste!

33cl bottle. Black color with thin brown head. Aroma has chocolate, rum, vanilla, cookies, alcohol and roasted coffee. Very smooth and creamy mouthfeel, taste has liquirice, cookies, malt and coffee. Warming finish with distinct rum notes. Excellent!

2016 release

Nose: coffee, chocolate, roasted malt, maybe some vanillla(?)

Taste: wow, dark chocolate coffee! With such depth and very creamy!

Aftertaste: long

Bottle @ Wika ølsmagning. Appearance: black with good soapy beige head and lacing. aroma/taste: chocolate, coffee, light vanilla, oak and lots of bourbon notes. Palette: strong roasted malty and bourbon aroma, lifgt to average carbonation, full body, notable sweetness, balanced by a medium to notable bitterness, long duration and an oily texture. Overall: Excellent bourbon matured imp stout.
Pours pitch black.The aroma is dark, coffee, chocolate. Tastes like coffee, chocolate and a tiny bit of vanilla. The bourbon barrels giving it a nice depth. Nice long aftertaste.

UPDATED: MAR 16, 2017 355ml bottle (thx, Chris S.!). Bottled on 2016-02-11. 12.4% ABV. Pours an almost black with a dark beige head. Aroma is coffee, bourbon, chocolate, some slight bourbon barrel and fruity sourness. Taste is coffee, toffee, chocolate, roasted malt. Chocolaty, coffee, slightly oily aftertaste. Very nice.
8-5-9-4-17=43

355ml bottle (thx, Darron D.!). Vintage 2012 (no date on the bottle)? 11.2%. Aroma is bourbon barrel, some bourbon and toffee notes. Taste is pretty the same with less chocolate and coffee. Not so thick, less carbonation. The 2016 version is definitely better.
8-4-8-4-16=40

Draught @ sori taproom, Helsinki. Poured black with a thin but lasting brown head. Bourbon aroma, oak, vanilla, dark chocolate notes. Flavor has sweetness, coffee, chocolate notes, lots of vanilla, oak. Alcohol nicely hidden. very nice!!!

Bottiglia 35cl @ scurreria.
Nera con schiuma fine e persistente.
CAffè tostato e cioccolata lasciano il posto ad un finale liquoroso ed amarognolo

(bottle) deepest brown in colour with a creamy beige head. aroma of vanilla, tree sap and earth, with big notes of sugar icing, some milk chocolate, coconut, obstler and bubble gum. flavour is heavy bourbon, vanilla icing and milk chocolate, only slightly ethanolic, with lots of fudge, espresso and a light roasted-bitter finish. heavy-bodied with lively carbonation. bourbon juice.
Flaske. Svart oljeaktig konistens. Lavt karbonert med en tynn skumtopp .smaker eik,vanilje,brent malt og kaffe. Noe hint av lakris. Lang bitter ettersmak. Meget god

Świetne piwo. Czarne, smoliste. Bezowa piana zbudowana z drobnych pęcherzyków. Intensywny aromat świeżo mielonej kawy, mlecznej czekolady i wanilii. Piwo tresciwe, gestaw, kremowe i gladkie. Grzejący alkohol. Delikatnie czuć burbon. Wytrawne na finiszu.

Bottle 355ml from Systembolaget. Black with a light brown thick head. Lots of chocolate, milkchocolate, brown sugar, vanilla. Even more vanilla, some alcohol heat, bitterness. Full body, thick, creamy, low carbonation. Very nice!

Alcoholic aroma, milk chocolate, burnt sugar, vanilla, marshmallows hints of liquorice. You could probably sit for a long time and discover new aromas. Sweet vanilla marshmallow taste accompanied with some roastiness Really thick and creamy texture. A very good Imperial Stout that deserve its high rating.

355ml bottle, 2016 edition, 11.9 % abv, bought at Vinmonopolet Langnes. The oily pour reveals an espresso head slowly fading over a coal black body. Crocheted lacing. Nicely roasted malty aromas with hints of bread, nuts and vanilla oak. Comprehensive flavour character of dark malts, including chocolate and coffee, supported by bread and vanilla oak backed by bourbon notes. Warming and full bodied. Excellent sipper qualities (Tromsø 25.02.2017).
Shared 12 oz. bottle. Pours almost black with a thick and creamy tan head. Aroma of bourbon and roasted malt. Taste is bourbon, roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, oak, vanilla notes. Very good.

Superb! Smooth roasted maltiness all the way. Subtle coffee with perfect bourbon BA note in finish. Lovely vanilla and light licorice, but
no part is over the line. Moderate sweetness with moderate bitterness. Smooth bit floury cocoa finish. Awesome
Świetny ris, mnóstwo ciała, mnóstwo czekolady, słodycz równoważona paloną gorączka.

Flaske 355ml fra Vinmonopolet Tromsø - Langnes. Svart. Høyt lysebrunt skum som varer lenge. Litt lacing. Utmerket sjokoladearoma. Oljeaktig munnfølelse. Smaken en eksplosjon: Eik, lakris, sjokolade. Blir gradvis tørr. Ettersmak av kaffe & sjokolade som varer veldig lange. Toppøl!

Aroma: lots of bourbon with a little stout underneath; Appearance: pitch black with creamy tan head the dissipates slowly; Taste: lots of complexity, with bourbon, dry stout, coffee, bitterness; Palate: heavy body with long, bourbon sweet finish; Overall: quite delicious, although not my absolute favorite imperial stout. Would definitely get again.

355 ml bottle.
An absolute winner. The aroma is lush and massive, with soft chocolate, coffee, dark dried fruit, and a dark chocolate cookie dough. The taste is coffee, dark and bitter chocolate, a hint of smoke, a touch of alcohol, and a really amazing, decadent chocolate dessert. It also has a lighter, sweeter touch behind all this. Bold, heavy flavours all in perfect balance. Smooth mouthfeel, dangerously drinkable, long lasting flavours. Near perfection.
2016 35.5cl bottle. pitch black. small brown head. roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, bourbon. medium bitterness that lingers on. great.

Bottle 355ml kindly shared by Dominique. A dark beer with medium light brown head. Nose is on caramel, toasted caramel, vanilla, very plesant. Aroma is on caramel, bourbon notes, hazelnuts, vanilla, butterskotch, finish has peppery notes. Very peasnt and subtle.

on tap dark good head wood vanilla cocoa coffee chocolate nocino
scura buona schiuma discreta persistenza nocino legno vaniglia fava cacao morbida polvere caffe cioccolata

The (nearly) perfect Imperial Stout. Pitch black, with a fizzy tan head, some lacing. Aroma is quite mild and delicate, with notes of coffee, bourbon, vanilla and roasted malts. Taste on the other hand comes very intense, with strong coffee, chocolate fudge, bourbon, oak, minimal booze and a sweet vanilla finish. Very full bodied, with low carbonation, perfect for a long evening sipping session while it warms up to room temperature, which enhances its flavours. Gorgeous.
Bottle. Pours black with low creamy tanned head. Aroma is coffee beans, chocolate beans. vanilla, bourbon. Taste is smooth, sweet, dark chocolate, coffee, wood. Nice!

The aroma is full of chocolate, coffee, vanilla, toffee, fudge, caramel and tar. The color is pitch black and there is no head present. The taste is full of chocolate, coffee, vanilla, toffee, fudge, caramel, dried fruits, tar, smoke, leather and oak. A nice beer!

Pours oily, pitch black with creamy, deep tan lacing. Intense malty aroma, lots of coffee, some cognac. Taste is tingly, light bitterness at first, then plenty of lightly roasted malts. Hint of alcohol in the aftertaste but surprisingly little so considering the ABV. Mouthfeel is rich and oily, smooth carbonation. Its a great imperial stout without too much coffee, really great full flavoured taste.

35.5 cl bottle. Black beer with a lasting cappucino-coloured head. Aromas of chocolate and coffee dominate with vanilla, muscovado sugar, syrup, you name it. Taste is initially basically bourbon with malt, very boozy. Wow, I wouldnt call that an undertone, more like drowning the beer in the bourbon. Almost none of the sweetness in the taste, palate is quite hoppy in the finish. Its great, but it does feel kind of weird drinking this as a beer.

Black, quite nicecbrownish head. Aroma: fresh coffee, caramel, some vanilla notes. Full to medium body, medium sweetness. Flavour: again lots of coffee, cereal, caramel (some lactic notes?), subtle barrel notes ( vanilla and woody finish). Alcohol perceptible but in acceptable level. Propercbut not captivating.

Bottle from Rickfifty, thanks! Pours dark brown with a small, brown head. Lots of coffee, some sugar, malt, dark chocolate flavour. Herbs. Sweet, with quite a lot of bitterness as well. Thick body. A bit dry. Medium to soft carbonation. Good!

Yeah baby, this is a good one. Had a rather subdued aroma to start, just some roastiness and coffee. Flavors were surprisingly sweet but not cloying - would make a perfect after dinner dessert beer. Tastes like chocolate covered coffee beans, but very well balanced. Opens up nicely after a bit of time and makes an excellent slow sipper.

Medium brown head. Opaque black body. Roasty earthy taste with rye and
coffee notes. Sweet earthy chocolatey mineraly taste with toffee and
hot vanilla notes. Full-bodied. Hot, mealy, flattish mouthfeel, kind
of sharp. Sweet vanilla fudge and coffee aftertaste with toffee and
caramel notes. Lots of great flavours here, but too sweet, too sharp,
too hot, and too much. Scaling it down a little bit and drying it out
would have made for a much better beer. (0.355l bottle, from wine
monopoly, Strømmen storsenter.)

0,355l bottle, 2016 version (12.4%). Pours oily black colour with good amount of head for a IS. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, vanilla, sweet bourbon, roasted malts, wood. Quite bitter and sweet taste, alcohol is quite present, but isnt out of place. One of the greats.
Bottle at home. Pitch black with a small tan head. Full body with low carbonation. Well balanced sweet and bitter tones. Chocolate, coffee, roasted malts, bourbon, vanilla and oak. Very good.

Petroleum black pour, dense tan head. Massive oak tannins, roasted malts, coffee, chocolate on nose. Full body. The barrel is not dominant on taste. It leaves just a hint of vanilla. Chocolate. Minor coffee. More whisky. Solid hopping making balance. Incredibly complex. Perfect.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
For a beer this tasty I expected a bit more in the aroma. The flavor has some coffee, but its smooth instead of grainy. Quite nice.
355ml bottle at House of Belgium, Xiamen stated as 12.4%. Pours with a cream head. Aroma of bourbon which dominates anything else. Some chocolate flavour. Sweetish finish.

This is nice, real bourbon bomb. Full of roasted malts, vanilla, cocoa, licorice, raisins, figs. But the bourbon barrel notes are really up-front, very smooth, silky and balanced. The only cons are some boozy notes, which are noticeable all round. Feel like drinking some nice glass full of bourbon. Definitely worth above 4.0 rating, IMO should stay in a bottle for a bit longer to be even more better.

355 ml bottle at abv 11.9% bought at HK Brewcraft in Central.
Looks: Deep, tan blackish brown colour; Less than one-quarter finger head with residual soapy dark beige foam which fades in 15 seconds; Very good sticky lacing with barely notable bubbly carbonation.

Aroma: Very fragrant dark malt which can be smelt a foot away, with strong roastyness, strong chocolate, strong vanilla, roasted coffee, bourbon, strong oak barrels, strong cream, caramel, sticky toffee, raisins, dark fruits, waffles, alcohol, sugar, dry bread and grass. Very smooth and seductive! 

Taste: Strong sweet, very rich dark malt, with strong roastyness, bourbon, rum, strong liquorices, smooth oak barrel, caramel, burnt toffee, strong burnt toast, strong black coffee, dark chocolate, floral, strong brown sugar, strong herbs, dry biscuits, strong lemon and strong bitter grassy hops. Very robust and layered. Wow!

Body: Full body. Oily and creamy palate.

Mouth Feel: Rich dark maltyness in a very thick background, of which oat smoothness played a big part. Liquor hit first, followed by French oak and strong burnt toffee and bitter toasty malt. Black coffee and chocolate come on strong as beer warms. Quite flowery with strong nice brown sugar sweetness. Biscuity with strong lemon to round. Powerful yet very smooth!

Alcohol: the 11.9% booze with bourbon barrel is potent, but never come across as train wreck at any point. The liquor is a combo of light bourbon and rum, pretty restrained and tasty. The best of all it is smoothed out by the rich French oak and vanilla which makes it so easy (and dangerous) to down. A well-produced rarity. A big Yes for me! 

Hoppiness: Grass in nose. Strong herbs, strong lemon and strong grass in taste; Bitterness - burnt malt, liquorices and hops - is very strong for a lasting, very high astringent sweet-bitter herbal malty finish.

After Taste: Dry. Liquorish and very herbal bitter to mouth.

Comments: I normally dont like barrel-aged RIS because the barreled whisky / rum / whatever simply overwhelmed the otherwise well-brewed dark stouts. In this case, the brewers worked magic with the bourbon barrel with lasting vanilla aroma, and a nice neat rum-bourbon liquor taste. The booze never upstage the RIS proper, which packs a complex oat creamy smoothness, strong fresh black coffee, very toasty burnt malt, and massive bitterness. The overall effect is powerful yet very likeable. Very well made and very well managed. A fellow reviewer described this one being the Rolls Royce of RIS, which sums it up pretty well. A must try and must buy!

P.S. As soon as I snapped it up, I knew this one will be my perfect 1800th beer rating, and I got it right! :-P

Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)
Imperial Stout
949419

Lukt: Mye nydelig mørk sjokolade og en liten anelse alco.
Utseende: Sort.
Skum/kullsyre: Tykt dekkende brunt skum, heng langs kant.
Smak: Mye nydelig mørk skokolade, anelse lakirs, noe vanilje og en liten svak alco i avslutningen.

Kommentar: WoW, denne var god.

Aroma; roasted dark malts, dark fruits, chocolate, fruity coffee, black-caramellic hops, bourbon n oak - wow, here are scents! Look; beautiful rose-beige cacao foam, black body, blanket sheety lacing, dense. Taste; roasted dark malts, superbowl of dark fruits, wineous berries, very high black chocolate factor, fruity coffee, black hops, creamy bourbon, oakey dokey notes - balanced solid smooth creamy black-fruity finish, warming. Feel; solid body, softish. Overall; the Rolls Royce among imp-stouts. When they have breakfast in Kentucky, we sip this slowly in Europe. [35.5cl.btl Abv%?(11.2?)
