Crowler from Chans Craft Bar that I saved for the Super Bowl. There are many good to very good beers that are elevated when barrel aged and even some great beers that suffer in the process, but the barrel aged FBS results in a great beer that has a different but deicious flavor profile. FBS is one of my all tIm favorites as is FKBS. The bourbon has a subtle impact on all the great flavors in the base FBS, changing the order of the flavors.

Draft at Beer Gonzo taproom opening 27/01/17
Black. Beige head. 
Vanilla, Bourbon presence, Chocolate, light coffee, Thick, creamy, solid. Ding Dong!

Im not a stout guy but this one is up there. A bit heavy and definitely not your normal stout. Easy pour with no head and i feel like my glass is heavier than normal. As for taste its like a black coffee that you stirred in a twix candy bar. On the back end has a slight bourbon note. Over all for me it a drink again stout

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
I drank versions 2015 and 2016, both great but the older better arranged, my favorite beer of the founders
Suprised i forgot to rate. Have had multiple bottles. Pours black with brown head. Aroma of roasted malts an bourbon. Taste is roasted malts an lots of oak and bourbon

Draft at First Draft in Chicago. Its the fourth beer on my 41st birthday so I owe it a re-rate in the future, but it has eluded me for many years. Boozy bourbon and oak on the nose. Lots of vanilla, char, and sophisticated oaky flavors. Bourbony finish. Awesome.
Its always hard to live up to the hype and while I enjoyed this it didnt blow me away. The taste was a little unbalanced and over powering but maybe thats just me. My drinking partner loved it.

UPDATED: APR 29, 2017 RATE FOR RELEASE 2015 from a bottle (11.2% abv)  & RELEASE 2016 (12.4%abv) on tap and severals bottles:
Pours black oily color with big creamy long lasting light brown head, which transforms itself to a ring like by espresso coffee. Visually low carbonation. Aroma: big coffee note, dark chocolate, vanilla, leather, oak, dark fruits, dried fruits, oak, vanillin. Flavor: double espresso coffee, dark chocolate, dark fruits, especially plums, vanilla, molasses, hint of licorice, roasted coffee bitterness-astringency, oak- vanilla - tannins, bourbon is almost hidden (in bottle not evident)...finish is dry.. Body is medium to full, texture is creamy, smooth, carbonation is low. Dangerously drinkable for 12%.
KEG 2015: 8-5-9-5-18=4.4
KEG 2016: 8-5-9-4-18=4.3
BOTTLES 2016: 8-5-8-4-17=4.2
AVERAGE: 4.3

Bottle, 2016, 12,4% abv. Dark brown, almost black color, tan foam. Great aroma: bourbon barrel, caramel, chocolate, oxidation, butter, vanilla, oak, malt, coffee, leather, maple syrup. Taste: coffee, vanilla, chocolate, cream, bourbon, caramel, caramel, port wine, a little oak, mighty and warming.

Draft to taster at Cappys pour opaque black with thick mocha head. Nose light barrel, molasses, light chocolate,and coffee. Taste dark roasted coffee, dark chocolate, sweet malt, red fruit and light vanilla. Very light bourbon mid to late. Certainly a nice example.

Produzida em 2016, Versão 12,4% ABV.
Cor negra com espuma marrom (de capuccino) de média formação e persistência de uma fina camada com excelente lacing.
Aroma muito intenso de chocolate ao leite, além de torrados (café e cinzas), madeira e leve álcool.
Sabor inicial com doce do chocolate ao leite e torrado de café, evoluindo para um meio amadeirado e alcoólico. Final com toque de bourbon, evidenciando o dulçor da baunilha e o amadeirado.
Retrogosto equilibrado entre a madeira e o doce da baunilha do bourbon, ficando mais amadeirado e alcoólico (aquecendo a boca) com a elevação da temperatura.
Corpo sedoso e licoroso com baixa carbonatação.
Perfeitamente harmonizado com panetone de doce-de-leite com especiarias e coberto com chocolate.

W aromacie kawa, czekolada, kokos i wanilia. W smaku kakao, wanilia i kawa. Nisko wysycone, dużo ciała. Super piwo.
Очень вкусное пиво, шикарны& аромат, красивы& цвет, отличны& мощный вкус и послевк& с горечью. Алкогол& ощущает& Срок годност& до 16.02.2017. (Bottle 0,355/ 12,4%)
UPDATED: JAN 6, 2017 On draft at Brew and Brew pours black with a brown head. Oak, Bourbon , cherries, coffee, corn. Medium mouthfeel. Boozy alcohol finish. Medium sweetness.

UPDATED: JAN 27, 2017 Pitch black with one finger tan head.
Smell of roasted coffee, oak, bourbon light, chocolate. nice
Taste of alcohol, bourbon, warming booz, slightly acrid.
Medium high body, med low carb, balance toward bitterness.

2016 version BB 30/12/2016.

If i wanted boozy kick I would have sip and actually enjoy a good islay whisky. Overhyped

26-12-16 // bottle shared at home. Deep black beer with medium beige head. Heavy bourbon in the nose. Taste is sweet malty, caramel, coffee, little spices. Bourbon and bourbon and wood and oak and bourbon. Heavy stuff, bit too much bourbon in my opinion.

0.33 l bottle bought by Marin & Toni at Edinburgh. Shared with Vinja 666 and Goran. Huge thanks guys for bringing this and Vinja 666 for sharing! Hoppy birthday! Completely black, brown small lasting head. Highly aromatic, ground pepper, very spicy, very heavy on the barrel, alcohol. Dry, alcoholic, aromatic. Full body, silky texture, extremely aromatic finish. I understand why people go mad about this one.

UPDATED: JAN 1, 2017 A legendák házának egyik legkiemelkedőbb darabja, amit pályafutásom során megkóstolhattam, idejét sem tudom már, mióta vártam rá, hogy megkaparinthassak egyet. Az imperial stoutok egyik meghatározó példánya, a pontszámai alapján a legstabilabb főzetek egyike. Kifogástalan kinézet, olajos, lassan csordogáló szurokfolyam, elegáns vonalakkal megáldott imperial stout, valósággal árad belőle a kifinomultság. Illatai minden vadságtól, tolakodástól mentesek, cseppet sem nehézkesek, szinte már légiesen könnyűek, annak ellenére, hogy csordulásig teltek aromákkal. Kávé, vanília, csokoládé untig ismert szövevénye, krémes kavalkádja, s a whisky csontig hatoló, minden molekulát átitató, mégsem erőltetett, eltúlzott jellege. A fahordós jegyek finomsága elsődleges meghatározója az ízének is, lágy karaktere minőségi étcsokoládés, marcipános, bourbon-ös, kakaós, sötét, mégis gyümölcsös színezetű elemek roskadásig telt szelencéje, igazi kincsesbánya, melyben minden korty során találhatunk valami sejtelmeset, valami megfoghatatlant, némi ismeretlent, s mindent, amit egy imperial stout-tól elvárhatunk.

Bottle
Aroma-chocolate, artificial flavour
Appearance-brown, hazy, brown foam, 
Taste-heavy sweetness, lightly sour, 
Plate-medium body, sticky, average carbonation, long finish, 
Overall-disappointing

(2015) Pours pitch black with a light brown head dissipating quickly. Aroma of bourbon, roasted malts, coffee beans, dark chocolate and some dark fruits. Flavour is just the same, and some vanilla and a nice oaky note as well, given by the barrel aging. I was expecting a little bit more from it, considering the hype. Maybe the worst year? Cant wait to try the 2016 thats in my cellar, hoping to taste something better.
Bottlesharing at DobryZbeer. Black, aroma is expresso, light liquorice and bourbon. Taste is coffee, bourbon and some liquorice. Quite good, but over rated
Lots and lots of coffee undertones and aroma. Pours dark and heavy with a tan head.
Sample from the importer. Absolute fan form the founders barrel aged series, this beers are simply perfect. the wood and bourbon balance is huge.

2015 BJCP Category: 33B Specialty Wood-Aged Beer (base style: 20C Imperial Stout)
AROMA: French roast coffee; chocolate syrup; black grape; vanilla; bourbon; wood. General dark malts; no specific hop character; no hot or distracting alcohol character. 12/12APPEARANCE: Opaque black body; dark tan head retains and laces well. 3/3FLAVOR: Strong, but gentle wave of sweetness envelopes palate immediately. Chocolate is the most prominent flavor. At the apex there is some dry bitterness to impart a modicum of balance. Sweetness changes to vanilla, wood and bourbon. Coffee emerges as it finishes and offers additional bitterness. A slight tartness and taste of currant or black grape appears briefly in the aftertaste. Alcohol is a major component of the palette, but is smooth with a gentle warming. Overall, an amazing balance of 33B, 30A and 20C styles. 20/20MOUTHFEEL: Full bodied; medium carbonation. Texture is soft, smooth, velvety and warm. No sticky or cloying sensation. For 12.4% ABV, this is not a gentle sipper. 5/5OVERALL IMPRESSION: This is an amazing, delicious and commendable beer to say the least. A remarkable achievement in brewing history. Simply put: its a perfect beer. 10/10TOTAL SCORE: 50/50

Founders KBS, short for Kentucky Breakfast Stout, is indeed suitable for breakfast -- particularly on this Christmas morning. at 11.2 percent, its a nice jump-start on the holiday unwrapping. Poured from a growler purchased from the Beer Camp in Plattsburgh, New York, KBS is opaque. Pitch black! Theres minimal carbonation and Belgian lacing, yet theres a dark, slick residue coats the inside of the glass. The aroma is dark chocolate, earth and booze. The taste is dark chocolate, burnt cacao nibs, vanilla beans, toasted coconut, followed by a slight hop bitterness to balance out the sweetness without cloying. The bourbon smoked woodiness lingers along with a boozy warmness. The mouthfeel is silky and smooth. KBS, the breakfast of champions!

Bottle from Peter, thanks a lot pal!
2016 vintage.
Pours thick and black with a small espresso coloured head.
Aroma is slightly vinous at first, with raisins, loads of roasted malt, chocolate and bourbon. Surprisingly enough, theres pretty much no alcohol at all in the aroma
Very roasted taste with peppery, strong bourbon notes, loads of dark chocolate, espresso vanilla, espresso, slight alcohol, slight burnt/smokey. 
Full body, high but soft carbonation, thick and round mouth feel.
Slightly peppery and bitter aftertaste with dark chocolate.
Niiice! I havent had a BBA Imperial Stout for some time now and this really hit the spot. Quite well balanced, though heavy on the roasted malt and dark chocolate.

Very dark with a thick, creamy head. Lots of lacing. The aroma is really dense and complex with liqourice, vanilla, chocolate, bourbon and coffee. Taste is sweet with just the right amount of burned bitterness. Mouthfeel is almost like heavy cream! Brilliant stout!!
En tyk fyldig stout. Den er noget brændt lakrids i eftersmagen. Rigtig god. Lakridsrod sidder i munden efter lang tid.

SB beställning, flaska. kolsvart med mörkt skum. Ogenomsynlig för tom kökslampan. Doft av malt och whiskey på en halv meters avstånd. Makalöst intesiv smak. Choklad, bränt, kol och skånerostad Zoega. Inte att leka med. Svårslagen i sin klass. Founders levererar alltid.
Цвет плотный, насыщен& Аромат бурбонн& бочки, вязкий, тягучий. Вкус плотный, бочка и бурбон, нефть.

Pours dark almost black with brown head. Aroma is smooth chocolate, roasted malt, coffee and a smooth bourbon note into the finish. Fantastic balance and only with a smooth bourbon note into the finish. Excellent!
Poured a viscous black with no head. Aroma of roast coffee grinds and sweet, dark chocolate. Full body, flavour of the aroma with the alcohol of the bourbon apparent.

Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Nieco alkoholowy aromat, potężna czekolada, genialna wanilia i Bourbon w smaku. Czekoladowa gęstość, syrop klonowy, dobra kawa. Trochę za dużo alkoholu. Zbyt świeże potrafi być nieco rozpuszczalnikowe, po roku-dwóch robi się naprawdę genialne piwo.
UPDATED: DEC 23, 2016 Very good. Heavy bourbon and chocolate but smooth and perfectly balanced. No harsh bourbon like some bba stouts.

Draft at Hollingshead. Pours a dark, black color with a nice, tan head. Great bourbon notes with vanilla and roasted malt. Unreal taste. Smooth and warm. Bourbon, oak, coffee. Everything you want. Simply an amazing brew.

Pitch black coloured body with a nice three centimetre tall rich brown microfoamed head. Aroma of alcohol, bourbon, vanilla, oak and a lot of caramel sweetness. Full-bodied; Super rich malty flavours dominate with licorice, anise, roast, coffee, dark chocolate and a pungent oak and vanilla flavour with bourbon and boozey notes right behind. Aftertaste shows some roast, coffee, earth, licorice, vanilla, oak and a lot of sweet and very easy-to-drink cereal sweetness with marshmallows, lactose and some residual vanilla flavours, but all goes down very easily and much better than youd expect at 11%+ abv. Overall, a great beer as expected - definitely well worth having, finding and aging! Im finally sampling this on tap in NY after being from MI and still never having it! I sampled this eight ounce pour on draught at Rattle N Hum (West) in New York, New York on 03-December-2016 for US$8,00.

4 pack from Whole Foods Market in Redwood City, CA (Bottle date 2/16 - already 9 months old). Aroma is rich chocolate, caramel and vanilla (from the bourbon I suppose), very little coffee. Taste is chocolate, vanilla...not as oily and rich as I had hoped (wondering if these bottles are just a bit too old to hold the coffee notes). Let me also add that while the booziness is really well hidden, this beer will punish you. Dont normally feel too tipsy off of beers but this one got me twice. Not as good as I hoped but will def look for fresher bottles next time.

UPDATED: APR 22, 2017 Dont get me wrong, this is a beer of the highest quality. Its the most well balanced boozy beer Ive ever had and I really enjoy it. Its just that it doesnt fit my palate and I have to be honest.

Update: I love this beer, I was wrong.

Bottle, courtesy of SinH4, many thanks! Pours deep brown with a diverse-foamed beige head. Aroma is dominated by oak barrel and vanilla next to coffee and booze. Body is full, sweet, a little booze (but matching extremely well), and mostly chocolate. Some nuts. Very smooth and round. Palate is surprisingly non-super-sweet, making it a great pleasure to drink this beer at whatever speed you would like. Both dry quenching and warm sipping work very well. A well deserved top 50 spot.
Pours a deep brown color with a boozy malt aroma. Taste is warming, with a distinct bourbon flavor that overwhelmed all other flavors. Coffee and vanilla notes make this beer very enjoyable.

Bottle from Coppers, Newcastle. Aged for around 1 year. Inky black with a thin dark tan head of foam. It has a rich dark chocolate, liquorice and coffee flavour followed by oak, vanilla and spiced dried fruit on the warming finish. Good.
Pours black. Arima is malty, roasted, coffee,vanilla. Taste is balanced, coffee, vanilla, bread, roasted.

UPDATED: MAY 15, 2017 Re-rating with a fresh bottle - 2017 release. Rich coffee and chocolate, a surprisingly distinct chocolate fudge note in both aroma and flavour, really tasty and balanced. Better than previous versions Ive tried.

Dufter virkelig godt; vanilje, nellike, enebær, kaffe, træ, bergamotte måske også eller noget mere mentol agtigt? Voldsomt, i hvert fald. Sprittet også, som bourbon (hvilket den jo også er lagret på)
Smagen er kaffe-vanilje drøn, med en voldsom og langsomt overvældende sprittet råhed af bourbon. Bliver mere spiritus end øl i eftersmagen! Hvilket jeg nu egentlig godt kan lide!
Men alligevel: Måske den bliver for bourbon-agtig undervejs (kan det blive det?!) - nå noget nyt dukker op, fx lidt honningsødme, lidt røg, så kommer vaniljesprutten og banker det ned. Det må nok ses som en begrænsning; at den ikke udvikler sig. Og så alligevel - hvis man, som jeg, er mere end ok med en bourbon-drønnert af en anden verden, så er man glad her!!

Pours thick black from the bottle and leaves a dark, creamy head that soon fades. Aroma is dominated by the bourbon, but accompanied by hints of coffee and maple syrup. Taste is very dry, full of bourbon, with an almost astringent finish. Body is heavy, very heavy, with a lightly oily feel. Good, although I think some of the flavors get lost beneath the blanket of bourbon.

Bottle at home. 2015 vintage. Lovely bourbon aroma. Taste of liquorice, coffee, wood, green peppers, bourbon and chilli. Dry aftertaste. Not perfectly balanced in body-alcohol-sweetness-dryness.

---Rate via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Jet black with beige, fine-bubbled but modest foam. Chocolate, vanilla, licorice, dark fruits and intense bourbon notes in aroma. Full bodied, oily, softly carbonated. Complex in taste: rum, molasses, raisins, chocolate and vanilla with a hint of coffee.

From a 12oz bottle in the presence of many Nielsens. Jet black pour with a dark khaki/cola head. Aroma of bourbon, oak, vanilla, coffee, and chocolate malts. I chugged this and was very impressed on how easily it went down. Lots of flavors similar to the aroma all working well together, not much detection of alcohol, drying finish. Warming sensation in the belly. $8 for 12oz was worth it. Highly recommend to others.

Poured from 12 oz. bottle into a tulip. Darkest of browns with a minimal tan head. Nose is roasty, malty, boozy, chocolate, everything you want in a bourbon barrel stout. Sweet thick taste. Quite good.
Tap at Olutexpo 2016. Pours black with small tan head. Aroma is roasted coffee with some bourbon. Taste has coffee, licorice and a hint of vanilla. Long finish. Great beer!

Bottle. 
Pitch black pour, stable tan head. 
Roasted malty nose, taste bitter malty with a slightly bitter finish. 
Full body, soft carbonation.

Bottle. 2016 vintage 12.4%. Oily black with a beige head. Lots of chocolate and malt in the nose. Full bodied, more chocolate with a bit of coffee to the taste. Some vanilla and then bourbon. Overall its chocolate and bourbon that dominate with a long mellow finish

Bottle - rating #1000. Pours black with a big dense tan head. Aroma is a rich mix of chocolate, malt, bit of soy sauce and espresso. Taste is an immediate hit of chocolate that then turns into a rummy molasses middle, before a sharp espresso dark chocolate finish with a clear indication of the abv. Rich creamy palate. Great beer to mark this milestone!

355mL bottle from Beer Exchange. 2016 vintage 12.4%
And so here we are IMPERIAL STOUT #100
Some people make occasions for such things - in this case, the beer is the occasion.
Been a rather odd lead up - weather turned grey, heavens open up with howling winds, and I found a gosling in a trough half dead that Im currently nursing back to health - its times like these you need something to take your mind off the world outside...
A viscous obsidian liquid is poured from the body - thick, like sump oil. An espresso-like dark tan creamer rises up & holds; taking its sweet ass time to drop down into a dense cap & painting the glass with cappuccino-like stains in its wake.
Theres an assault to the olfactory upfront - heavy on the bourbon undoubtedly, like cracking open a good bottle of Bakers - in itself complex with layers of vanilla, and charcoal, and sour mash grains. That combines with rich liqueur-like coffee, or maybe slow drip? Has a good deep cocoa note about it too, and burnt, almost blackened sugar.
Mouthfeel is what gets me first - this is not nearly as rich as most beers of this strength - quite well attenuated, dry, rather boozy, warm, get some woody tannin in there - very reminiscent of a swig of good Bourbon - that smoothness, yet dryness.
Palate doesnt quite deliver what the nose promises, but its bloody nice! Bourbon up the wazoo - charred wood, sour mash twang, vanilla, toast, sort of overly ripe apricot, lots of wood! like massively. Chocolate, dark, coffee, strong, sugar, dark & strong & kinda burnt with burnt raisiny notes, smoky but not in a conventional manner. Smoooth finish, yet theres a sort of acrid coffee & woody bitterness that counterpoints everything, sort of spurring you on as you take the journey.
This is spectacular! And it must be said, Im not a huge Bourbon fan (single malt Scotch fan), but the execution & intensity here is second to none!

Black color. Medium-sized , beige head . Chocolate, vanilla , dark fruits, caramel, wood and bourbon in complex aroma. Chocolate, coffee and vanilla dominate in taste which is even more complex. Warming, bourbon ending with wood bitterness ( which I don't like) . Is it a great beer ? Yes! Does it worth to hunt for it like crazy ? I'm not sure))

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle @home (Euro-vision 2016 tasting.) Pours black with a tan head. Nose is vanilla, some coffee, chocolate and a wee touch of whisky. Taste is along the same lines big dark bitter chocolate up front then some warming whisky notes, some vanilla a touch of coffee.

355ml bottle. Jet black colour with average to huge, thick, creamy, fairly lasting and lacing, tan head. Vanilla and liquorice aroma, hints of oak, some leather, a touch of coffee in the background. Taste is initially coffee dominated, roasty dark malty, later Bourbon and vanilla-flavoured; warming, minimally alcoholic finish. Full body, oily texture, slightly sticky palate. As the label says: "A Favoured Stout"; therefore a somewhat empty feeling of a strangely "neutral" basic beer remains.

UPDATED: OCT 27, 2016 Perfekt!! Klar!!! Ein einzigartig ausgewogenes, schwer bourbonfasslastiges IMPERIAL Stout der Königsklasse. Duftende Vanille, Lakritz und Kaffeearomen legen sich auf die Nüstern. Im Glas schon formvollendet dickflüssig und mit öliger Textur gesegnet, nimmt das edle Tröpfchen im Mund noch mal richtig Fahrt auf. Ein wunderbar plazierter, dezent säuerlicher Röstmalzteppich bietet Platz für das nun folgende und fast als spektakulär zu betitelnde Tänzchen der Highflavours. Fass, Schoko und famose Whiskeynoten gesellen sich zu den bereits erschnupperten Gefährten. WOW!!! Das Mundgefühl ist cremig und zusätzlich gentlemanlike schlank. Der Nachspann lang und hopfenbitter. A big thanx to Maui. Das 355ml Fläschchen gabs von ihm, für schlappe 3,50. Yippie ✨

Apparence : Noire, col brun foncé, rétention moyenne, légère dentelle, carbonatation semble faible. 
Nez : Fudge, chocolat noir, vanille, bref, traces bien présentes du bourbon. Café plutôt effacé. 
Goût : Chocolat noir, boisé, alcool, bourbon bien présent, finale avec une belle amertume. Équilibre entre le sucré, lamertume et lalcool. Aspect légèrement piquant. 
Sensation : Crémeuse, corps moyen-plus, chaleureuse, effervescence faible, finale assez longue. 
Bref : Huit mois en bouteilles, est-ce que le café sest estompé à ce point où bien mes papilles étaient saturées par le café de la journée? Peu importe, le breuvage qui métait offert était néanmoins dune excellente qualité. Chocolat à la vanille, bourbon et alcool bien présents en bouche, la chaleur qui se fait sentir cest équilibré, réconfortant, crémeux, goûteux et très savoureux. Je suis seulement perplexe par rapport au café!

UPDATED: OCT 9, 2016 Donkerzwarte stout met mokkakleurige schuimkraag. Precies goed op alle vlakken. Zoetig maar niet té. Volle bak chocolade met een licht bittertje. Vanille, koffie, dik stroperig mondgevoel. Absoluut één van de beste stouts ooit gedronken. Subliem.

UPDATED: MAR 19, 2017 UPDATE: re-rated for 2016 bottle version, slightly upgraded. Tap at CBB Bud, Founders launch in Kansai. Black as night with a lovely tan head, great lacing. Massive bourbon nose that moves aside a little after warming and lets roasted malts, chocolate, and coffee through. Similar flavour, light vanilla, some ash, and the underlying bourbon booze. Very smooth to sip, warming, full and rich. First time to try, very impressed.

Tap at Founders tap-takeove, Devil Craft Gotanda, Tokyo. Pours deep brown, I mean almost black that has some brown notes. At first is quite cold but while it warms, starts revealing toffee-filled, bitter chocolate-cocoa mocha nose with some hints of bourbon. Taste is roast, coffee is actually not that strong, I am getting mainly bitter roast chocolate, dusty cocoa and some vinous liquorice. Tastes deep, alcohol is well balanced with the flavour profile coming out loud and clear as I let the beer get warmer. I can understand the craze around this beer, feeling lucky to enjoy it from tap.
pour pitch black with a small off white head. Aromas of chocolate, vanilla, bourbon, light caramel, and coffee. taste light bitter, medium sweet, full bodied, creamy texture.

Finally got my hands on this classic imperial stout and its absolutely beautiful. Aroma of coffee, bourbon, chcolate cake. Taste of coffee, sweet chocolate, oak, bourbon, a bit of licorice and some roastiness. Great stuff.

Bottle from Systembolaget a while back (small release). 2016 edition.
Coffee, chocolate, vanilla and boozy bourbon on the nose.
Deep brown/black colour. Minimal head, tight tan bubbles.
medium sweetness, medium bitterness. 
Tastes like it smells, lots of bourbon, vanilla, coffe and chocolate.
Full bodied, thick, oily, slick, very light carbonation. Bitter and sweet finish.
Absolutely delicious!

Sample from keg @Stockholm beer & whisky festival. Lovely smooth stout with flavours of coffee, chocolate and ripe fruits. Vanilla coming on strong in the aftertaste along with the woody bourbon notes. Liked this a lot. According to the Founders guys in the festival stand, production is increasing. Hope they are correct, I missed the latest limited release in Sweden.....

Black colour, beautiful mocca head. Aroma of coffee, vanilla, bourbon, soy sauce. Taste is medium sweet, light to medium bitter, flavours of bourbon and coffee. Medium to full body, creamy texture, soft carbonation. For Alba´s 24th birthday.

I grab this beer every year, one to have right away and a few to age for months to a few years. Ill rate a fresh one( I wrote this review in my phone notes when it was released but forgot to submit here). Poured from the bottle almost completely black, thick and with just about a fingers worth of brown head. The nose is all barrel and alcohol before you get coffee and Vanilla. The flavor follows suit for me, the hotness of the alcohol hits first before it gets smoothed out by vanilla and coffee. The feel is thick like syrup but carbonated adding to the appeal of the beer. This is an outstanding stout that I will continue to purchase many of and enjoy!

(Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)) Bottle 355 ml at home, served into a snifter, ABV 11.2%
Totally black colour on the body, small but thick dark brown head on top, with average retention.
Arom aof chocolate, vanilla, cold coffee, light liquorice, alcohol.
Nice taste with lots of chocolate, vanilla, fudge, bourbon, oak, light coffee, mocha, alcohol.
Medium thick body with good carbonation.
Great beer.

12oz bottle. Pours black with a thick light mocha head. Smells strong cocoa and coffee roastiness. Unbelievable mouthfeel. Tastes like their breakfast stout but the flavors come through much, much more. Cocoa, vanilla and coffee roastiness. Lovely, lovely beer. Well worth its rating.

12oz bottle thanks to Rene. Pours out black and oily, small tan head. Big, bold aroma of coffee and chocolate. Sweet chocolate bar, more coffee, roast grains, bourbon notes and vanilla. This one stands up to its reputation.

20/20 outstanding. Rich chocolate, subtle coffee undertones with the oak/bourbon finish. So well balanced. Delicious. Finest beer I've ever had. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2016 bottle from Stone in Asagaya. Pours an oily black with a half finger of dark brown foam that dissipates quickly. Tons of cacao nib, roasted coffee and light vanilla in the nose. Some light wood on the palate with more cacao nib, espresso and lightly charred molasses. Light warming finish with some bourbon notes. Fairly dry. Great stuff.
Stoked to finally try. Strong vanilla and coffee flavours upfront. Finishes with some sweetness and oak. Really well balanced and hides the booze pretty well.

UPDATED: APR 29, 2017 2017 Update:  From bottle better rating up from 3.8 to 4.2  Palate is a bit rough.  Nose is completely coffee.  Taste is less bourbon but present.  Still balanced.  and still enjoyable.  Wood harshness could be stepped down.  

2016: Truly not as amazing as expected. For the hype get epic BBB. Nose light vanilla. Lots of coffe notes little barrel or bourbon. I am guessingthey arerepeating barrels. Thick on tongue. Good beer but not incredible. Nice lasting head.

Coffee and tobacco aroma. Vanilla, sweet coffee, oak, wow great sweet imp stout. I can taste the bourbon a bit more. If you like sweet pleasant stouts with less bitterness and more booze and chocolate then this is it. Youre the man @lore Thanks!!!

De la micro cervecera Founders(USA) esta Imperial Stout de nombre Kentucky Breakfast Stout (KBS) con 12.4% ABV y 70 IBUs en nivel de amargor, una Imperial Stout o Russian Imperial Stout (RIS) compuesta con maltas tostadas de cebada, chocolate y café, madurada por todo un año en barricas de Bourbon para pulir bien el terminado e integrar todos los sabores, la receta de esta cervecera originaria de Grand Rapids, Michigan tiene la calificación en la pagina especializada en cerveza Ratebeer de 100/100 en estilo y 100/100 en general.

En vista posee una corona de espuma mediana con perlas compactas y de ligera tonalidad canela, hay poca retención por la gran densidad del cuerpo y el contenido de ingredientes y alcohol, el liquido es de color obscuro opaco, no tiene destellos o tonalidades mas claras ya que no entra la luz, aspecto muy correcto al estilo.
En aroma es muy evidente el aporte del envejecimiento en barricas ya que de inicio el aroma es muy amaderado, hay notas a café, chocolate, nuez y almendras, algo de aroma a pasas, licor como a jerez, muy compleja y agresiva.
En el sabor igualmente se presenta el amaderado, mucho chocolate dulce, carácter a café, frutos secos como; almendras, nuez y ciruelas, hay dulzor a caramelo y azúcar morena, los 12.4% de alcohol son perceptibles en gusto y calidez en garganta, incluso el carácter de madera lo exalta, no hay acidez ya que el reposo pule y elimina dichos sabores, muy rica y potente, el retrogusto es pesado, achocolatado y dulce que se prolonga bastante.

BOTLE. (BO. 02/11/2015). Cola black with minimal dark tan head.. Boozey bourbon nose with woodiness & some vanilla.. Barrel shines throughout, creamy vanilla texture yet still packs thick darkness, toasty malt, good booze warmth, a lot packed into this one.. Sourced Cape Cellars

Really dark brown color with creamy tan head. Aroma has warming bourbon, caramel, sweet malts, slight butterscotch but also a weird dirty rag note that I get with some sniffs. Taste starts with slightly astringent roasted malt, warning booze, slightly bitter roasted malt. Finishes with a bit of coffee bitterness but overall its a bit underwhelming considering the hype and also the body is not as heavy as I would like it to be.

0,355 l bottle 
caramel, coffee, chocolate, roasty, butterscotch, vanilla, woody, herbs, black,-brown, hazy, frothy, brown foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, full body, creamy, oily feel, thick feel, soft carbonation, long finish,

UPDATED: SEP 11, 2016 Tasted as one masterpiece of a marvellous beer tasting with Kapusil and Cristobal; Dark brown colour creamy beige lacing; aroma of tobacco, vanilla, chocolate, some coffe and herbs; taste is the same with syrupy-roasted notes and whisky; some peppery-chilli like notes in the aftertaste; smooth beer without any mistake

0.355l bottle thanks to Lore. Pitch black body, brown head. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, tobacco, wood and vanilla. Taste of chocolate, coffee, whiskey, vanilla, pepper, grapefruit, grapeseed and floral hops. Amazing.
I never had this in a bottle..only on draft. Once in Brooklyn at Skylark and once in Taipei at Landmark... This beer does not disapoint

Aroma: barrel notes, vanilla, bourbon, coffee, bitter chocolate.
Appearance: jet black and brown head.
Taste: bourbon barrel notes, coffee, bitter chocolate, vanilla, roasted dark malts, smooth and dry.
Palate: medium body and medium carbonation, barrel notes.
Overall: Masterpieces.
Aroma is filled with alcohol and coffee. Taste is not too overpowering. Coffee notes balanced with oak flavor of Barell. Enjoyable.

Flaska. Svart öl med ett gräddigt beigt skum. Dofter av choklad, kaffe och trä. Smakinslag av choklad, kaffe, ekfat, lakrits, karamell och torkad frukt. Ren och skär njutning. Alkoholen ligger i bakgrunden men bygger bara upp kroppen till en vacker skapelse, mer än att den stör. Stor och fyllig kropp. Ibland blir man bara väldigt lycklig av att dricka öl.

Draught. Creamy lightbrown good mostly lasting head. Black colour. Heavy malty and hoppy aroma. Heavy bitterb flavor. Strong bourbon notes. Long heavy bitter finish. Creamy palate. Great but bourbon is not my thing.

Draught sample at CBWF 2016. Pitch black with a thin, tanned head. Sweet, roasted aroma with dark malts, chocolate, coffee, caramel malts, whisky barrel and vanilla. Taste is sweet. Full body with an oily texture and a soft carbonation. Finishes dry and roasted bitter with lingering dark malts and whisky barrel. Excellent Stout.

Dark brown-black with a chocolatey head, good lacings. Aromas of roasted malts, coffee, chococlate, bourbon vanilla, wet wood and some earthy tones develop with a very faint herbal impression. Faintly carbonated, velvety-smooth and medium-full bodied. Chocolate sweetness with bourbon vanilla action and a pinch of roasted coffee flavours rounds this beer very well off in a lasting joyful finish.

Bottle from 1776 Liquors in Bristol. $10 for just one 12 ounce bottle. Sounds crazy but I had to pull the trigger. Well worth it. Not an everyday occurrence. Save this for special occasions. Poured into a snifter. Huge tan head. The lacing is incredible. I see chariots and tigers! Super smooth velvety texture. Strong bourbon sweetness. Deep chocolate and coffee notes. So delicious. Lots and lots of layers. Some oak and vanilla. This is simply fantastic. Better sit down for this one!
Tap @ Mikkelller, Aarhus. Nice head with excellent duration. Color is black. Aroma and taste are roast malt, chocolate, caramel, cocoa, coffee, bourbon and has a nice warming finish.
Black liquid with beige head. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, oat, vanilla, whiskey. Tastes same, medium sweet, medium bitter, light sour. Full body

2015 KBS on tap. Poured thick and oily in tulip. Nice two finger head,,sticky lacing. Smell of cocoa nibs, figs, vanilla, worn leather. Taste of tobacco, aged bourbon, coffee, was a little bit hot on the tongue. Well rounded beer. Love to get my hands on more.

On tap at Cervecería Flandes and Cervezorama 2.0 (july 2016). Both are 124 ABV. Same rating.
Creamy brownish head, very long lasting.
Very dark brown, almost black. Opaque.
Aroma is very complex: coffee, cocoa, roasted malt, roasted dark fruits, liquor, barrel, brownie.
Taste is liquor, roasted dark fruits, alcohol, black coffee, black cocoa, soft acid bitterness. Long Irish coffee after-taste.
Thick, dense palate, smooth and creamy. Full bodied.

Intensywny aromat czekolady, kakao, kawy, vanilia, lekko bourbon. Smak słodki, lekko gorzki. W smaku sporo wanilii, czekolady i kawy, wyraźnie bourbonowy i beczkowy, lekko grzejący alkohol. Ciało spore, faktura oleista. Posmak kakaowy, wytrawny i gorzki.

2016 version (12,4%) sampler tasted from the tap on the 04/08/2016. Opaque black colour with a big head. Coffee and aroma are predominated by coffee bourbon and vainilla. Seems like a coffee liquor. Next one please!

0,335L bottle. It is opened to farewell a good colleague and friend that will be missed by us.
Appearance: Pours a pitch black colour with thin to medium tan head. Leaves some good lacing.
Aroma: Intense aroma of roasted malt, coffee beans, dark chocolate, nut, vanilla. Also have some resin, wood and oak and light alcohol in the nose.
Taste: Medium to heavy roasted malt and coffee beans bitterness. Balanced with medium creamy vanilla sweetness. Some bourbon taste as well.
Palate: Medium to full body. Very creamy and smooth texture. Long-lasting roasted malt and coffee bitterness. Just a little bit too alcoholic at the end.
Overall: A really solid imperial stout. That wonderful bittersweet aftertaste of roasted malt, coffee beans, bourbon and vanilla linger at your mouth really long. It may even taste better if cellared and aged it.
Bottle. Pours almost black with brown head.Aroma: coffee, dark chocolate, liqorice, roasted, whiskey. Taste: medium bitter, dark chocolate, coffee beans, roasted, warming alcohol, hints of bourbon.

Aroma: chocolate, coffee, nuts, toast, 
Appearance: black, clear, brown foam, 
Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour,
Palate: full body, sticky, soft carbonation, long finish,
Pours pitch black with a tan head. Nose is very boozy, slightly smoky and earthy. Taste is smoky bourbon, coffee and toffee sweetness. Very well balanced and hiss the booze well. Great drop
Snifter from Pazzos. Pours a dark black with an extremely thin tan head. Aroma is coffee and chocolate with alcohol, vanilla, and oak from the bourbon barrel.
Pours dark, lacey tan head. Velvety chocolate, vanilla, oak and coffee on the nose and palate. One of the best beers in the world.

35.5cl bottle. v2016. Deep black colour with a nice beige head than persists as a lacing. Vanilla, chocolate, coffee, bourbon and light alcohol in the aroma. Average carbonation and full body. Taste is complex bittersweet with the same notes as the aroma. A bit too alcohol and for that I would say it should be aged a little. Overall, a very good beer.
Nice and well rounded head, but a bit lackluster in volume. A color nearing complete black. Great taste, a noticeable coffee taste while keeping the beer fairly light.

Bottle from Greenslopes Cellars 310716. My first beer rated on RateBeer was a stout so I thought it only fitting that beer 5000 should also be a stout. And what better stout to drink than this one. There is not much that I can say about this beer that hasnt already been said. It looks great, smells, great and tastes great. Smooth and velvety in the mouth with a burnt aftertaste that is long and a touch dry.

Oh so many flavors going on here. Very subtle wood chip nose; lacey tan head; medium carbonation; subtle bitter coffee / chocolate taste with a touch of bourbon on the front pallet with a lingering finish of bitter roasted malt. The hop amount helps hide the alc. content.
2016 bottle. It looks great in the glass and smells great as well but from my point of view its unbalanced and too alcoholic. It has great potential for cellaring and should be drunk aged.
Tastes like a a melted smores dipped into bourbon and then liquefied. Only bad i encountered was running out of them.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android
Aromes de pastiset de licor, vainilla, xocolata, cacau, bombo.Final llarg, amarg i licoros. Cos alt, dens i sedos.. Oxidacio tipus port. Bonissima!

2015 (labeled 11.2%) and 2016 (12.4%) side-by-side and blind until after tasting notes. Pours black, thin, tan head. Aromas for both are chocolate, coffee, bourbon, vanilla, treacle, caramel. First real divergence from year-to-year comes through in the taste. 2015 - very smooth, semisweet chocolate, woody vanilla, big bourbon, espresso, fainter notes of anise, molasses, and toffee. 2016 - still smooth, coffee and bittersweet chocolate and vanilla much more at the forefront, more muted bourbon, oak, molasses, and caramel, some heat at the back of the throat that isn't present in the 2015; it doesn't detract at all, just a noticeable difference. After the initial side-by-side we poured a one-to-one mixture of the 2015 and 2016. They both were great individually, but the mixture was stupendous.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours thick black like motor oil. Aromas are somewhat subtle considering the powerhouse of flavour. Metric tons of chocolate with hints of coffee and bourbon. One of the best Stouts Ive had.
Imperial stout with strong dark chocolate and coffee flavours. This is smooth as silk and is like a liquid dream. Its big, powerful and delicious.

From bottle. Very dark, almost black in colour with beige head that fades to lacing all round the glass. Coffee and chocolate aroma. Complex depth of flavour, bourbon taste comes through with coffee, liquorice and chocolate aftertaste. Good body and one to savour. Recommend that you try it.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
AMERICA🇺🇸 Simply put this is one of the greatest beverages in existence.

This came to me highly hyped. Im glad to say it lived up to it. Aromas of dark chocolate, coffee beans, bourbon, and roasty malts. Flavours, all in line with that. The 12.4% abv is very well hidden. Less boozy and hot than Nickelbrooks Kentucky Bastard (and you know I love that stout). It has a surprisingly silky smooth mouthfeel. This is one highly enjoyable stout.

Low head vanishing fast.
Good lacing.
Borbon barrel is shining through in the aroma.
Briliant mouthfeel, good balance between sweet and bitter.
Coffee crawling in as the brew gets warmer.
There is no flat/off spot in the palate.
Wonderful brew.

Bottle, Beers of Europe. Black with a beige head. Coffee with vanilla oak barrel and chocolate. Meaty soy with peppery alcohol. Oily, roasted with spices. Dark berries. Hints of cola and liquorice. Boozy finish. Metallic notes. Good but a little thin bodied.

Pours black with light beige head. Aroma is chocolate, roasted, ashes and licorice. Flavor is roasted, oat, bourbon, vanilla, chocolate, heavy sweet, light bitter and licorice. Sticky, full, smooth and oily. Well balanced, well crafted. A great example of balanced barrel aging.

UPDATED: MAR 16, 2017 Tasted as both 11,2%, 11,9% and 12,4% ABV. Tar black. Aroma has coffee, roasted malt, chocolate, vanilla, wood, bourbon. Taste is heaven. Perfectly balanced between the sweet vanilla, chocolate, bitter roasted malt, coffee and the heavy influences from the bourbon barrel. The finish leaves you with a warming and longing sensation that demands that you take another sip. And another. And another... My favorite beer to date.

Ratebeer-Bewertung #250:
Zu diesem besonderem Zeitpunkt, kommt ein ganz besonderes Bier.
das KBS:
Hervorragendes Imperial Stout. 
Unmengen von Kaffee und Tabak. Röstig, fein herb, Kaffee, nicht zu süß. Sehr, sehr lecker.

2016 bottle in porter glass (12.4% abv). Pours jet black with 1 cm tan head that dissipates quickly. Aroma dominated early by choc and coffee with a bit of oak sneaking through. The bourbon comes through on the palate with a bit of smokiness from the oak; remarkably smooth for a beer thats 1/8th ethanol. The best i-stout Ive had to date.

355ml bottle from The Beerhive. 2016 release. 
Small tan head disappears quickly, a little lacing. Dark black body. Nose is chocolate, coffee, bourbon, alcohol, vanilla. Flavour is rich chocolate, creamy vanilla, coffee beans, bourbon, chocolate syrup, light alcohol burn. Aftertaste of roasted nuts, a little bitterness. Very light carbonation, rich mouthfeel, good thickness without being chewy, a little syrupy. The bourbon really shows, tremendous stuff.
Black and beautiful. Great aroma and flavors. Balanced, nuanced, perfect. Wish I had not lost my notes, but this is highly recommended by me.

Bottle. Thanks to Sin4h. Black body with tan head. Aroma is coffee, roasted malts, chocolate. Taste is chocolate, coffee, vanilla, wood, alcohol, vanilla and hints of dried fruits. Aftertaste is very nice balanced. Very nice one.

UPDATED: JUL 4, 2016 Bottle, 2016. Black color with beige head. Aroma is bourbon, booze, black chocolate, a bit of green peppers. Taste is thick black chocolate, a bit vanilla, molasses, liquorice. Medium carbonation, creamy mouthfeel. Excellent, complex and balanced. I liked their Imperial Stout better though (but I had that in the winter).

UPDATED: JUL 1, 2016 On tap at søernes ølbar. Pours pitch black with a big foamy tan head. The aroma is bang on chocolate. Really intense. Some roast as well. Perhaps some vanilla like sweetness. There is some roasted malts as well, though not as present as in other stouts. Taste is somewhat roasted bitter, but mainly chocolatey sweet. There is a hint of smoked wood as well. A full-bodied, creamy mouthfeel. Medium carbornation.

UPDATED: MAR 24, 2017 Bottle from Alko Arkadia, Helsinki. Pours black with a little brownish head. The aroma features a strong combination of roasty maltiness, coffee and licorice with touches of plum and vanilla. Extravagant. Taste is light to medium sweet initially, later becoming more and more bitter. Flavours contain similar elements with the aroma; this is very rich and potent, but still brilliantly balanced. Roasty malty qualities are accompanied by nuances such as vanilla and ripe dark fruitiness. Aging shows but does not dim hoppiness that also adds attributes to the varied mix. The palate is full-bodied, deliciously smooth and low in carbonation. Simply a breathtaking beer. Highly rated and spoken of, and rightly so.

On tap at Craft Beer Helsinki 2016. Pitch black with a large beige head. Fairly intense roasty aroma with chocolate, bourbon, vanilla, dark fruits, spices and hints of alcohol and caramel. More raw than expected, assume its fairly young. Expected something rounder and smoother, but by all means - still nice. Sweet, roasty and complex with nice bourbon notes and a surprisingly decent bitterness. Certainly a tasty sipper, but wouldnt mind trying it more aged next time.

Bottle 0.33l at my place Amsterdam, The Netherlands. Bottle from Zlotta. Thanks a lot man. 31.05.2016. Pour it dark color with thick black head. Aroma chocolate, coffee and just pinch of vanilla. Nothing mind blowing. Taste starts with coffee, bourbon in the middle, vanilla, sweet milky coffee note, sticky feel, full body, soft carbonation, pleasent bourbon and coffee after taste.

UPDATED: JUN 27, 2016 Bottle at home, 2015 ed. Pitch black, firm brown, stable head. Huge bodied chocolate, cacao, coffee and roasted malty toffee and butterscotch come in first, then the bourbon, vanilla and alcoholic heat come in, blending beautifully. Rich coffee dominated, bourbon-y aftertaste. Low to absent carbonation, soft and really creamy mouthfeel. Exceptional beer, but the coffee/chocolate are more present than the bourbon, which stays a bit thin sadly imho.
Bottle utobeer. Looks and smells outstanding and exciting. Taste is excellent. Extremely well balanced but very tasty. An exceptional drop.

Bottle. Pitch black pour with dark brown head. Aroma is fresh and powerful with roasted coffee, raw liquorice and bourbon. Taste is very balanced and round with a bit of dark chocolate and bitter coffee. Full body and low carbonation

Svart med fingerhøyt lys brunt skum. Lukter whiskey, vanilje, trevirke, fløte og espresso. Fyldig. Whiskey dominerer også i smak. Salt lakris, vanilje og tørket fruktsødme. Alkohol, kakao og whiskey i avslutningen. Tørr

Bottle. The beer has got a deep black colour with a smooth body and small steady head. Aroma of malt, chocolate and coffee. Taste of bittersweet chocolate, hot cocoa, malt, barrel, rum, woods, dark fruits. Intense finish.

Notas principales a Bourbon, café y choccolate.
De color completamente negro, cuerpo redondo, corona de espuma abundante de buena retención.
En boca equilibrada, a la vez compleja y llena de sabor.
Al paladar es exquisita. Notas intensas a Bourbon, café y chocolate. Algo de madera y frutos secos. A la vez muy fácil de beber y equilibrada en cuanto a los sabores.

En resumen excelente cerveza. No cabe duda que la guarda en barrica le viene de maravilla

Bottled 11 Feb 2016, 12.4% ABV. Completely impenetrable black with small tight creamy and persistent mocha head. The chocolate, oak and bourbon are immediately apparent in the aroma, with vanilla and some red wine notes. The taste is rich and decadent - big port wine, dark chocolate, big creaminess, bourbon, oak, vanilla, a little licoriced, dry spicy and earthy hop finish. Surprisingly but not unwelcome, the coffee isnt really noticeable. Full bodied and creamy. Was sceptical but this does live up to most of the hype and Im excited what a bit more age will do to my second bottle.

1/3 pint, keg. Pours black with a medium thick brown head subsiding quick but slowing down to leave a nice layer of brown foam. Scent is dense dark roasted cappuccino and light amounts of chocolate as well as maybe tobacco. Taste is dense chocolate and light orange peel, light vanilla, and light caramel. Bubblegum. Little bit of capsaicin. Maybe rosemary. Mouthful is ultra creamy. Ice cream. Finish is a little bit sticky and very smooth with a light bite. Utterly excellent.

Almost dark tan head, that lasted the journey, on a black body. The aroma was a mixture of dark fruit, chocolate, vanilla and hints of smoke. In the taste I noticed rich smooth chocolate, hints of liquorice, coffee, all in balance, full in body but not prominent, very well balanced Imperial Stout. Very wary of all the hype for a long time and have been chasing it for also a very long time, not disappointed and well the worth it, unfortunately I only the got one bottle, as did my customers!
Shared with other people in plastic cups. Medium dark tan head, dark brown color. Strong flavor, coco, coffee, caramel, roasted aroma and taste. Full body, creamy texture.

(35 cl bottle courtesy of Tsekouratos, thanks! Bottled: 02/11/2015) Poured at fridge temperature (meter says 13 degrees celsius at surface) into a Rochefort goblet reveals a pitch black body with one finger of toffee head that subsides fairly quickly leaving film and lace. Aroma has notes of dark fruit, toffee, oak and coconut/vanilla/bourbon. The aroma does not in itself betray the high ABV. In the mouth the brew comes across as softly carbonated, with definite roasted notes on the palate and an assertive alcohol warming finish. The body is full but its balanced by the alcohol astringency and a bit of bitterness. The texture is oily. The flavour is sweet, slightly ascerbic and somewhat boozy. Definitely a sipper with a bit of a snakebite.

Looks.. Think black oil, sml brown head.
Smells..choc, bourbon, vanilla, oak.
Tastes..plenty of choc, roasty malts, bourbon barrel, oak and vanilla. Everything it says it is.

12.4%ABV. Imperial Stout.

Poured out black and oily with a nice thin tan head. 40ºSRM.

Nose from afar, you get sweet funk of molasses, closer you get dark chocolate and the smokiness of coffee.

Mouthfeel is thick and almost syrupy. Strongly alcoholic and medicinal. Palate has black bread, rye toast spiciness, and bourbon. There is a charcoal, smoky finish with alcoholic heat at the back of the throat. There is also a pleasant full-bodied woody or dried aged wood overtone in the palate that rides the alcohol very nicely. I expected a lot of sweetness and fruit from the way it nosed and poured, but this has all the flavor character of a whisky tasting.

Aftertaste of chocolate and some coffee and vanilla.

Palate may be a bit harsh for the uninitiated, but should be right up the alley of someone who likes a good rye bourbon.

Remember that you wont be able to taste much of anything else after this one, so make it count.

Goes on Favorites List !

Pours black with a large foamy tan head. Fantastic aroma of coffee, bourbon and roasted malts. Taste is delicious. Much like the aroma with some hints of vanilla and a slight booziness. A fantastic beer that is worthy of buying as many as you can get your hands on.
Bottle. Black, frothy, brown foam, medium bitterness, medium sweetness, full body, creamy, soft carbonation, & long finish.

This beer to the average beer connoisseur , would be ranked very highly. Top notch. Hipster status: 1000. However, I am not the average beer connoisseur, I am the inverse. The anti-Christ of beer. And like resultant residual spew of adolescent binge drinkers, this beer has been indexed to receive an inverse proportional rating. 
Emancipate yourself from inner slavery.
-Spew

Roasted and sweet malty with notes of chocolate, caramel, nice burnt malty notes, nice bourbon notes in there, lovely. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: NOV 27, 2016 (on tap @EAP) Totalmente negra, espuma marrom de aspecto cremoso, duradoura. Aroma inicial mais para café verde do que torrado, bourbon, cacau, licor de chocolate com álcool presente e duradouro, o torrado aparece no paladar, de médio dulçor e amargor. (versão em garrafa me pareceu mais equilibrada, menos café verde e melhor baoanço entre torrado e bourbon) Corpo denso e média carbonatação. Final tende a ficar mais torrado, alcoólico. Deliciosa, mas ainda prefiro a alesmith speedway stout e a Bourbon County 2015
Bottled:Pours black with a large head.Aroma is coffee, biscuits and vanilla.Flavor is lots of licorice, some bitter cocoa with a dash of Bourbon leading to a warming alcohol finish.

UPDATED: JUN 20, 2016 [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Karlskrona. Pours black with fading heavy tan head. Aroma is complex with dried fruits, roasted malt, vanilla, coffee and chocolate. Finish is pleasantly balanced with moderate bitterness.Also tasted on [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */øernes. Tap version softer and barrel character comes through more intensively. Taste is almost more complex.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, from Alko Anttila, Tampere, Finland. Strong aroma with plum, licorice, coffee and some bourbon. Pitch black color with minimal beige head. Strong, balanced taste with licorice, soft coffee, plum and chocolate. A hint of roasted malts. Some bourbon on the background. Wide taste spectrum and long aftertaste with coffee and slightly roasted malts. Strong/medium body with light/medium carbonation. Overall, superb, bold product with awesome implementation of bourbon flavors. Could have stronger body. The bottle version is much better than draft: softer and not so bitter due to coffee notes.

Pours black with a thin cocoa head that is short lived. The aroma is fresh brewed coffee and a toasted marshmallow with a hint of syrupy dandelion & burdock. A big hit of coffee to start that gives way to a delicious chewy marshmallow flavour too. Amazing. Looking forward to seeing how this ages.

Drank the Friday after Matt's birthday alongside Founder's Breakfast Stout. Pitch brown-black with thin tan creamy fizzy head and spotty legs. Smells of coffee, bourbon/rye, toasty malt, biscotti, stony lightly herbal bitterness, moderate vanilla and toasted marshmallow, light walnut, faint vegetal aroma but in a fresh grassy way. Taste is spice, heavy bitterness and booze, dark stony malt. Body is bitter, very fine creamy carbonation, slightly frothier and sharp lemon acidic finish. Excellent beer. Fantastic aroma, complex palate. This has enough coffee acidix bitterness to complement the spicy rye. Makes the Breakfast Stout seem one-dimensional.

Bottle from Brewcraft at home in new apt alongside normal Breakfast Stout. Was so excited to get my hands on this. Dark brown-black pour with tan head (more brown/caramel than the regular Breakfast Stout). Aroma is big toasted marshmallow, toffee, oatmeal, booze. Nice. Taste is huge astringent boozy bitterness with rich caramel and vanilla and marshmallow. Deliciously pillowy soft and rich palate. Creamy but still fizzy. Very boozy finish with lasting warm bitterness. Delicious barrel aged imperial stout - almost as much for what it isn't (licorice-y, cloyingly sweet, overly viscous) as what it is. Best thing you can say - does not at all disappoint.

Breakfast notes of coffee, and really good flavours to remind you of red eye breakfasts. Don't get vanilla but may be too cold out of the fridge, the coffee dominates in a good way. Taste is great and texture is excellent. Silky and lasting with rich dark chocolate. You are left with the best chocolate you've ever eaten hugging your mouth.

Bottle, Slow Beer (gone now) 14C. Pretty much black, tan head. Aroma has whiskey and chocolate out front with heavy roast, earthy nuts, youngish oak with vanilla and pepper. 8+ Plenty going on, nothing dominates. Really lovely. Luscious, smooth texture, lowish carbonation is about perfect for me. Very sweet with sweet syrupy notes - vanilla and coffee more than chocolate, even some pretend hazelnut - bossing the stout. Never dries out, but bitterness, booze and oak all register at the end. A let down after the fine aroma - the non beer things are too much and theyre not that good.

Vanilla, butterscotch, coffee, roasty, licorice, alcohol, chocolate, light berries, dark sugar, woody.
Black colour, medium beige head, lacing.
Big heavy sweetness, heavy saltiness, medium bite, lots of bourbon, and heavy coffee.
Very fullbodied, soft carbonation, oily feel, warming and salty finish.
Solid.

355 ml bottle from Systembolaget. Black with tanned head. Roasted malt, coffee, chocolate, milk chocolate, bourbon vanilla, oak and cappuccino. Smooth, semi sweet with low to medium bitterness and low carbonation. Fantastic stout!

Pours black with thick brown head. Roasted malt aroma with cocoa, dark coffee and bourbon. Big roasted malt flavor with coffee, cocoa and bourbon barrel. Fantastic. Was afraid this one was all hype but lived up to reputation.
Black with thin head. Aroma has tonnes of Bourbon. The aroma and flavour also have some cigar-like qualities. Very intense.

Bottle from Hops & Crafts Exeter,pours black with a dense dark beige head, aroma of bourbon,chocolate coffee,raisin & a hint of liquorice & polished leather,the taste is similar with more bourbon,dark chocolate, coffee,roasted malt,liquorice & raisin plus alcohol ,surprising light bodied,lightly oily ,smooth with medium carbonation,the finish is dry ,slightly bitter with more dark fruit ,chocolate & bourbon becoming slightly mellow . Nice but I expect more dark malt flavours,warmth ,& body from an imperial stout!!!

Tap @ Basement Beer Bar, Aalborg. 2016 edition, 12 % ABV. Aroma of vanilla, chocolate, coffee, oak, bourbon alcohol. Black with tan head, mostly diminishing. Moderate malt bitter, moderate sweet, some from alcohol. Full body, smooth thick feel, chocolate bourbon finish.

Dark almost pitch black beer with amazing beige head that lasted awhile and left beautiful lacing. Aroma has sweet vanilla Bourbon, dark chocolate, some roasted coffee and roasted malts. Taste is quite sweet with dark chocolate at first then coffee notes come up and salty licorice also. In the end there is Bourbon and wooden notes with slight hint of warming alcohol. Oily texture and lowish carbonation.
Bottle pours jet black with tan head. Aroma is chocolate, light coffee, caramel, vanilla, oaky. Taste is oaky, chocolate, caramel, coffee, little alcohol. Very smooth seeet finish. Great beer.

0.355 l bottle from De Bierkoning, 2016 release at 12.4% abv, bottled in February 2016, shared at Markos place. Sweetish-malty, slightly roasty taste of milk chocolate, some coffee, vanilla and hazelnut. Sweet, malty and slightly roasty taste of milk chocolate, nougat, vanilla, some coffee, hazelnut and hints of bourbon, followed by a medium long, slightly roasty-bitter, a little warming finish. Full body, creamy mouthfeel, almost flat. At first, the aroma is not that over-whelming, pleasant, of course, but a bit too faint. The taste is lovely though, quite sweet but superbly balanced, bourbon notes almost too subtle. I expected a bit more due to the high rating, but it is nevertheless very good.

Ölen ser fantastisk ut, riktigt mörk nästan svart öl med kaffefärgat skum. Doftar kaffe, vanilj, rostat, malt, choklad m.m och smakar i samma bana med en mycket mjuk munkänsla och lagom beska. Riktigt trevlig!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAY 7, 2017 Pours black with good tan head but doesnt last long. Aroma is full on sweet oak, with a hint of roasted malts and spice. Taste is, again, full on oak sweetness with hints of chocolate and coffee. Medium carbonation and thick mouth feel. Finish is oak bitterness. I love bourbon and imperial stouts but this is far too oaky for me - it really doesnt taste of beer. Very disappointed :(

Re-rating: This beer is much better served 15C. At 4C it was as rated above.  Once it has reached room temp the oak subsides to a more chocolate/coffee beer.  The balance is far better now with the oak mostly on the finish.  There is still a noticeable alcohol burn but then again it is 12.4%. Just make sure to serve at room temp.

Really great Coffee Imperial Stout the only reason for not giving it a little bit better taste score is its a little more bitter than I prefer! Otherwise its a really great breakfast Imperial Stout!

RIS warzony z dodatkiem czekolady i kawy leżakowany w dębowych beczkach po bourbonie. Edycja 2016.  
 Alkohol:  12,4% obj. 
 Data butelkowania:  11.02.2016 
 Kolor:  Czarny jak węgiel. Brak jakichkolwiek przebłysków. 
 Piana:  Średniowysoka, beżowa, grubo i średnioziarnista. Może nie jest aż tak puszysta jakbym tego oczekiwał, ale wciąż pięknie znaczy ścianki Sniftera.
Po zamieszaniu szkłem odbudowuje się delikatnie i spływa w dół po krawędziach.
Rozległa oponka oddziela ostatnią warstwę trunku. 
 Zapach:  Bardzo piętrowy, wielowarstwowy zapach.
Zdecydowane nuty beczki po bourbonie. Nie ma się co dziwić piwo spędziło tam ponad rok. Mokre drewno, trochę rumu, trochę whisky, chwilami nawet czerwone wino. Mnóstwo odnośników do szlechetnego alkoholu.
Gorzka czekolada dochodzi po nieznacznym ogrzaniu, a na sam koniec delikatna sugestia świeżo palonej kawy.
Paloność na niskim poziomie. Alkohol w aromacie zupełnie niezauważalny. 
 Smak:  Smak jest zdecydowanie wieloelementowy. Beczka po bourbonie daje wyraźne motywy mokrego drewna, dębiny oraz szlachetnego alkoholu.
Gorzka czekolada wypełnia swoją słodyczą usta i podniebienie.
Słodycz rozchodzi się równomiernie. Kontrują ją nuty kawy Mocha i delikatne orzechowe posmaki. Za nimi minimalna lukrecja i karmel.
Po ogrzaniu pojawia się pokaźna wanilia.
Goryczka dość wysoka, ale krótka i szybko znikająca.
Odczucie w ustach pełne, kremowe, aksamitne.
Przyjemnie rozgrzewający alkohol dochodzi do głosu jedynie już po zakończonej degustacji.
Wspaniałe piwo, chociaż jeszcze nie genialne xD 
 Wysycenie: Niskie. 
 Podsumowanie:  

Jedna z tych tzw. "perełek" na które poluje się od dawna. Szukałem tego piwa przez długi czas. Udało mi się go zdobyć w jedym jedynym miejscu w San Francisco. 

Wracając do KBS-a.
Piwo to wypuszczane jest na rynek tylko raz do roku w bardzo limitowanych ilościach. Edycja 2016 trafiła na rynek 
1 kwietnia 2016.
Miałem to szczęście, że połowie kwietnia byłem w USA i udało mi się cudem dorwać KBS-a.

Najfajniejszą i najbardziej godną uwagi informacją była cena za tego RIS-a.
Zapłaciłem za niego $5!!! Można było kupić tylko 1 buteleczkę na osobę.
Browar ustalił taką cenę i mimo limitowanej ilości nikt nie pragnęł wcale zdzierać pieniędzy od jego miłośników. 
Wielki szacun za to! (Dla porówniania Bourbon Stout z Goose Island kosztował $16). Bardzo się cieszę, że udało mi się spróbować tego RIS-a.

Dodam na koniec, że z tych RIS-ów, które piłem nie jest to RIS wybitny, ale z całą pewnością b.dobry.

UPDATED: NOV 8, 2016 Spent my entire savings on two of these, it was worth it. Bought in Oslo at Cafe Sara, it deserves the praise. Big flavours, chocolate, Bourbon coffee and vanilla are at the forefront. Would love to try one that has a few years of aging under its belt.

2016 edition, 12,4 ABV. Bottled 03/03 2016
Pours black with a thick brown foam, long lasting. Aroma is chocolate, coffee, bourbon and I also imagine I found some licorice there too. 
Taste is mainly chocolate, coffee and roasty tones and after a while a harsh finish when the bourbon tones hits in. The licorice turns more obvious as the beer is getting warmer. Creamy and pleasant mouthfeel. Excellent beer of course though I am not still convinced the barrel aging makes the imperial stouts better. Will be interesting to check out how tthis batch ages,

Butelka 355ml. Barwa czarna, nieprzejrzysta. Piana jasno brązowa, drobna, obfita, bardzo trwała jak na taki woltaż, dokładnie oblepiająca szkło. W aromacie paloność i czekolada podkreślona nutami beczkowymi, szlachetnego alkoholu, lekko słodkiego, takiego likierowego i subtelnymi nutami wanilii, dość intensywny i mega przyjemny. A w miarę upływu czasu nuty beczkowe, drewniane stają się coraz bardziej wyraźniejsze. W smaku mega gładka czekolada, likierowy alkohol, goryczka palono-alkoholowa leciutko drapiąca w przełyku ale bardzo przyjemna z wyraźnym efektem rozgrzewania choć sam alkohol (12.4 w wersji 2016) bardzo dobrze ukryty. Piwo leciutko oleiste, pełne w odczuciu, dość pijalne jak na swoją moc choć zdecydowanie pośpiech jest zbędny i degustacja powinna trwać bardzo długo. Bardzo dobry stout a leżakowanie w beczce po bourbonie nadaje piwu szlachetności choć nuty beczkowe są tylko dodatkiem i nie dominują piwa choć nadają mu wyjątkowej wytrawności, takiej drewnianej, leciutko ściągającej, bardzo przyjemnej.
Extremely well balanced BA stout. No booze, awesome coffee and vanilla flavor, dangerously drinkable. I would love to have multiple cases of this beer and drink every freaking day.

2016 edition. Strong coffee/chocolate dessert aroma, taste is same plus toffee, vanilla, oaky bourbon, burn sugar, roast coffee notes, hint pf licqorice. Thick oily mouthfeel. Ends on a strong booze burn. Great big 'ol beer.

Bottle generously shared for breakfast by Arturo-sama! 2016 version. Rich and decadent just as I like for the style, lots of vanilla and espresso, brown sugar, cocoa, oak, just enough bourbon bite, touch of spice, dangerously smooth, nice dry finish. Perfect Saturday breakfast warmer :)

355ml bottle from Beer Gonzo. 2016 Release. Pours black with a beige foam head leaving lots of lacing and aroma of chocolate malt & coffee. Flavour is roast malty. sweetish, molasses, chocolate & coffee, woody oak, bourbon, boozy, some spicy bitterness. Smooth mouthfeel, medium to full bodied, soft carbonation, dry warm boozy woody oak bitter finish. Very drinkable indeed.
Sehr dunkel braune Farbe, mittelgroße bräunliche schaumkrone. Geruch kräftig röstmalzig, Kaffee, leicht alkoholisch. Geschmack sehr röstmalzig, Kaffeebohnen, süß, Vanille, geil.
kolsvart med stort ljusbrunt skum. Doftar och smakar mycket av fatlagringen bourbon , vanilj, kaffe och choklad. Fyllig med lagom beska. Det blir inte så mycket bättre!!

This lovely beer was vintage, 2014 KBS bestowed upon me by a close friend. Pour thick with a beige head, aromas of tobacco, tar, leather, chocolate, raisins, coffee and liquorice. Smooth taste. no lingering bitterness perfect end to a great evening. Drank at home

From a bottle. It's all been said already. If you're lucky enough to run across it get it no matter the price. 

This is most certainly true.

Pitch black color with small, creamy and long lasting brown head. Aroma of roasted malts with lots of vanilla and hint of bourbon. Flavour is multi-layered mixture of all with nice bourbon notes. Well balanced. Great , great beer just amazing stuff!
Doftar mörk choklad och espresso. Kraftig kropp med viss bitterhet. Kompenseras av balanserad sötma och viss alkohol.

Flaska från SB. Kolsvart med krämbrunt fluffigt skum. Syrlig och intensiv kaffe/espresso-ton i doften tillsammans med mjölkchoklad, bitter kakao, vanlij, toffee, tendens till chark, lite spritiga bourbontoner och inlagda körsbär. Stor, kompakt kropp. Oljig och absurt fyllig! Ordentligt värmande alkoholtoner. Stor beska ganska snabbt in i smakbilden. Rejält med kaffe i förgrunden. I bakgrunden pekannöt, vanilj, lönnsirap, lakrits, ekfat. Börjar oerhört bombastiskt för att sedan ge mer utrymme åt sträva och strama ekfatstoner och stor kaffebeska. Stor spritighet, men inte så det stör. Stor, komplex och skiftande smakbild som håller ihop snyggt, trots sin kraftfullhet. Välgjord.
Great long lasting flavour. Chocolate, vanilla, liquorice, anissete. Packs a punch.

Kentucky Breakfast Stout von Founders. Das Bier zeigt sich fast schwarz mit einem bemerkenswert dunklen Schaum. Das Bier ist mit Kaffee und Schokolade gebraut und anschließend ein Jahr lang im Bourbon-Fass gelagert. Das verspricht eine tolle Aromenvielfalt und diese steigt dann auch nach dem Einschenken in die Nase: dunkles Malz, Schokolade, Espresso, Whisky, Holz, Vanille. Im Antrunk kommt kommt dann die volle Wucht dieser Aromen. Die 11% Alkohol und die dominanten Bourbon-Aromen lassen einen fast glauben, einen amerikanischen Whiskey oder zumindest einen Weinbrand im Mund zu haben. Ein echtes Erlebnis, aber ganz sicher nicht jedermanns Sache und erst recht kein Bier für Zwischendurch.
Flaska från SB. Oljig svart med smutsbrun skumkrona. Kraftig doft av choklad, tofe och kaffe. Söt kropp med lite besk avslutning. Smak av choklad, mörkrostat kaffe, nötcreme och sötlakrits.

UPDATED: AUG 13, 2016 For my 100th rating I could not choose something other than a 100 scoring beer. Purery black with a brown head. Aroma is complex, yet roasted malt, vanilla, oak and coffee are easy to identify. Taste is powerful with strong coffee finish that slowly dissipates and lets the alcohol through. The bourbon is also there. Fantastic beer! Probably the best beer in the... This is really one of my favourites!

UPDATED: APR 23, 2017 5/19/2016: This is a 2016 version. Pours a dark brown almost black with a medium sized khaki head with some red notes in it. The aroma is of alcohol and bourbon. There is also hints of vanilla. The taste is alcohol and bourbon right up front. There is quite a bit of a warming in the taste as well. I also pick up some vanilla as well. 

4/23/2017: I am comparing a 2016 and 2017 vintage. The appearance is very similar with a dark brown almost completely black but the 2017 has a much creamier khaki head than the 2016. The aromas are very different right off the bat. The 2016 version has lots of oakiness, vanilla, alcohol, and faint notes of coffee with some charred roasted malts. The 2017 version is coffee and lots of it right up front. The malts are more dark roasted than charred. There is some sweetness in there as well. The aroma definitely goes to the 2017 vintage. The flavors are also very different with where they can be detected on the palette. I wonder if each years vintage is brewed slightly different. In the 2016 vintage, you get some booziness but not overpowering up front with some oakiness and vanilla and it finishes with lots of chocolate and coffee. In the 2017 vintage, you get hit with lots of coffee, chocolate, vanilla up front and in the finish you pick up some booziness and alcohol. Coffee is known to go away over time so I am not too surprised by that. The mouthfeel is heavy and drinkability is quite low. Obviously this is more of a sipper than a gulper.

From XXXII. In Teku glass. Reading CSHTP6 Ch18. Tastes like coffee a lot. I dont like coffee. But this brew is so great that even Ive enjoyed its coffee. The more you drink the more you want. A pity its high ABV that keeps you from repeating. Well, and its price here (8?)

UPDATED: JUL 11, 2016 Bottle at Harts. Dark malty aroma, reasonably subtle bourbon and quite a bit of coffee. Pretty much as expected and not surprisingly, pours pitch black with a small beige/brown head. A little on the sweet side, possibly not as full bodied as expected and soft carbonation. Bourbon comes through nicely and lingers on the finish with a bit of dark malt, vanilla, wood, coffee. The long, smooth finish is the highlight of this. It?s really good, but an all time classic? Nah...
Dark and rich malt aroma with soapy notes. Pitch black with not much of a head. Sweet beginning with a light bitter wood finish. Smooth palate.

Poured from the bottle the beer is extremely dark with a small beige head. Aroma has booze up front with espresso, chocolate and vanilla. Taste is big and rich. There is some woody bourbon first and then a wave of other flavors roll in. Coffee, roasted malts, cocoa beans and vanilla come through. Long smooth finish, Great beer.

Pours pitch black with medium head disappearing fast. Aroma: vanilla, wood, roasted malt, coffee, chocolate and coconut. Taste: incredibly thick and rich taste of chocolate, coffee, vanilla, coconut. The barrel aging is present but perfectly balanced with other tastes. Palate: very pleasant long hoppy finish with a touch of warming alcohol. Generally alcohol is present but in a positive way. This beer is very intense and burtling with flavors, but at the same time incredibly drinkable - you immediately want another sip. My top 5 when it comes to russian imperial stouts.

UPDATED: FEB 17, 2017 Tän ku antaa vähän hengittää, niin alun kovat maut pyöristyy ja nautinto on taattua.

2017, hanasta Brewdog Helsingissä. Erittäin pehmeää alusta alkaen.
Tätähän se on Instagram pullollaan. Otin maisteluun. Aivan kammottava...n kova. Paksu ja paahteinen. Ei yhtään tähän keliin, mutta kyllä se tässä Rockyn kanssa menee.

A tale of two beers. While trying this cold from the bottle I was underwhelmed. Nice Aromas of chocolate and coffee but the taste was a bit weak compared to a BCBS and the mouthfeel was almost needled and overly fizzy. Once this was allowed to decant to room temperature, this truly blossomed into an exceptional representation of the style. The mouthfeel was more rounded and silky. The nuances of the bourbon barreling were finally on display as well as the chocolate and coffee. Overall an excellent Imperial Stout when enjoyed at a warmer serving temperature.

Bottle at a tasting in Portland-Oregon, many thanks to douglas88 for hosting and offering. Dark brown coffee bean, tan little lacing. Nose: vanilla, total whiskey, pure bourbon nose, just a little roast. Mouth: so warm, clean warm clean roast, more whiskey, some vanilla roots. Nice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draught at Taproom Malmö, Malmö, Sweden. Black with beige head. Chocolatey roasted malt aroma, boozy, a bit unfresh green pepper coffee, plenty of bourbon and wood. Full bodied, soft carbonation. Semi dry, medium bitterness, quite tannic/astringent.

UPDATED: MAY 6, 2016 2016, only a month past bottling. Pours black, 1 cm tan head, light carbonation. Dominated by huge bourbon nose, booze, hints of coffee. Taste is rich and decadent, first sweet chocolate and caramel, trace of vanilla/butterscotch, then a nice dry roasty coffee finish. Oily, thick, luscious mouthfeel. Halfway to just drinking bourbon. Really great, a paragon of the style. Can?t quite live up to the hype, but it?s really delicious and well executed.

35,5 cl bottle from our lovely monopoly. Black color with small brown head. Nose has strong roasted notes, hint of whiskey and coffee. Strong rich taste with bourbon mixed with wood notes, alcoholic notes, coffee and some hops at the end. Excellent brew.
Black, dark brown thick foam. Chockolate, vanilla, chili in the sweet aroma. Sweet, caramel, candy, toffee, candy cocoa, coffee in the aftertaste, chockolate.

Pours a deep dark brown color. Small tan head head that lasted throughout. Aromas of bourbon and wood. Flavor was a lot of bourbon, hints of smoke, chocolate. Full bodied and creamy. Tasted more bourbon than beer. WOW, this is a flavorful beer!!

UPDATED: MAR 3, 2017 A black beer, a head is dense, medium and light brown. Aroma has fruitness and plums, roastiness of cofee, liquirice, some vanilla and hint of alcohol. Taste has richness of malts, coffee, salt liquirice, nice bitterness, balanced roastiness and sweetness, notes of alcohol. Full bodied, smooth not stickyness. The great balance and complexicity. Good and tasteful beer.

Smells of booze with hints of vanilla, chocolate milk oak wood. Beautiful deep dark silky black color. Taste of sweet vanilla with bitter sweet chocolate strong coffee maybe even esspresso like, oak wood flavor then comes out followed quite fast by the bourbon flavor which almost numbs your tougue then lingers for a bit but for not being a fan of the boozy stouts this one is an exception for the intro flavor blows my mind and after the boozy flavor all the flavors run over your tougue for a second time its quite amazing how any beer could do that. Definitely a full body beer with light weak but crisp carbonation which really work for this stout for some reason I can not explain but it works so good. All in all one of not the most exceptional stout I will ever drink. Awesome brew!

Tap at McCoys in a tulip glass. Deep, dark brown/black with a quarter finger tan head. Nose has plenty of chocolate paired well with a bourbon peat-like presence. There is a nice roasted nutty and coffee element as well. Taste is big and boozy with a healthy dessert chocolate finish. This is delicious. Good bite from the alcohol before giving way to a pleasant sweetness. Getting some toffee and caramel. Super smooth mouthfeel. Little bit of a hazelnut coffee finish. This is something to sip and enjoy. Meets and almost exceeds the hype.

On tap at Cafe Sara, Oslo. Pitch black color, some foam. High aroma intensity; cocoa, some roastiness, choclate, leather and coffee. Full body & high complexity. Some immediate sweetness, some balancing bitterness- balances very well. Very enjoyable

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

(2016 Release)
Very dark, opaque. 1 inch tan/brown head, creamy and think, recedes slowly. No visible carbonation, but then, nothing is visible except black. Initial odor is bourbon, a bit boozy, follow by distinctly chocolate with coffee underneath. Some roastiness as well. Thick mouth feel, but still no carbonation on the tongue. Mild, coffee, bourbon, chocolate initial taste with a nicely bitter and bourbon finish. As you drink, it leaves a thick, clingy, stringy lacing down the glass. A bit boozy, but just wonderful overall.
From a taste. Heavy taste of coffee and vanilla. Chocolate......bourbon whiskey. Nice!

Dark brown black, head rapidly dissipates. Aroma impressive, coffee, vanilla and arouma. Flavour, immediately struck by coffee and vanilla with bourban about middle of tongue. I could definitely taste the alcohol. 
A very good drink.
