Pours pitch black with a creamy mocha head. Huge chocolate aroma with lots of coffee as well, slight bourbon notes, really nice. Taste is rich and malty with a dry bitter backbone to balance the sweetness. Full bodied, good carbonation, and quite thick on the palate. Just an awesome beer.
Drank 29-04-2016 with Thijs and Bram in Waalwijk. Thanks Thijs for sharing! Awesome beer. I liked it better than the BCBS.. very rich, smooth, great!

Type: 12-oz. bottle
Glass: AleSmith Barrel-Aged Reserve snifter glass 
From: San Diego Wine Company in Miramar (San Diego), Calif.
Price: N/A
Purchased: N/A; Received on April 23, 2016
Consumed: April 27, 2016
Misc.: Bottled on March 3, 2016 at 1:21 a.m. ET 

Thanks, Tom!

My wifes uncle, Tom, brought this as a gift, along with Trapistes Rochefort 8 and Acoustic Ales Instant Triple Karma. Unbelievably nice as I hadnt had the chance so have either. I had obviously really been looking for this one. Wasnt sure what he paid for it (was able to check the other prices on the places website), but have heard others pay anywhere from $7 for a single bottle to $24 for a 6-pack. Have unbelievably high expectations for this one. Im talking 4.60 range. 

Poured a pitch black color with two fingers of frothy, tan head. Great uneven, spiderweb lacing. Very good retention. (Sight - 4.50)

Smelled dark milk chocolate and black coffee malts. After second effort got smooth bourbon, oaky wood, booziness, toffee, caramel, crayon, hints of vanilla and roasted hazelnut. Reminding me a bit of Tioga-Sequoias Autumn Rush. (Smell - 4.25)

Taste followed the nose nicely. Still reminding me of TSAR. Got dark milk chocolate, boozy bourbon, oaky wood, creamy vanilla, hazelnut, chocolate milkshake, roasted coffee malts, toffee, caramel, Oreo cookies, wet cocoa and hints of spice (cinnamon?). (Taste - 4.25)

Full body. Creamy-to-sticky texture. Average carbonation. Long, smooth, warming finish. (Feel - 4.75)

This was just an awesome beer. I still think I slightly overrated it a tad with the pedigree, but so be it. It is not elite to me, but just a great beer. (Overall - 4.25)

4.32 96 A
Aroma: Espresso. Appearance: Jet Black. Taste: Espresso& deep dark cocoa. Palate: smooth, powdery cocoa. Overall: Well worth the 100 score. Good deep dark strong desert beer.

2016 bottle. Dark black color with barely a thin medium brown ring of a head and little to no lacing. Aroma has sweet vanilla, roasted malts and creaminess, toasted marshmallow, and vinous bourbon notes. Flavor is smooth cocoa with good balance of hot smoky bourbon. Strong alcohol burn but great flavor. Im sure this would be great with a couple years on it but I dont have the will power to wait!

Bottle @ bishops arms. Thanks Johan. Pours pitch black with a small moccha  head. Aroma has chocolate, Chilli peppers, bourbon, vanilla, licorice, burnt candy, alcohol, bitter coffee. Big bodied with medium to high carbonation. Taste is roasted, sweet and dry with coffee, dark chocolate, chilled, vanilla bourbon, wood barrel, alcohol, cocoa, , raisins, plums. Long duration with Lingering chocolate, orange peel and grape. Assertive bitterness.
Bottled. Pours thick black. Has a huge caramel smell. The palate has medium to light and has a medium bourbon taste. A hint of coffee taste. Awesome stout

12oz bottle poured a pitch black pour

Very good stout. 

Chocolate, oak, and some coffee. 

Glad I had it, but not sure its worth the price. Many other BBA stouts that are easier to find and are cheaper may be just as good IMO.

Bottle. Pours dark brown, black oil with a small amount of mocha-colored bubbles near the edges. Aroma is rather oaky, some vanilla, some roast, slight chocoalte. Taste is quite a bit of vanilla, roast, some smooth chocolate. Strong, herbal oak in the background. Smooth. Alright, if not really to my liking.

12 oz bottle, poured into a snifter. Dark brown, tight tan head, little lace.  Aroma is coffee, vanilla, oak, bourbon, subtle smoke.  Flavor is coffee, creamy chocolate, bourbon, vanilla, oak, dark fruits. Finish is long, and filled with oaky dryness, coffee bitterness, and bourbon sweetness. Gets better as it warms, and is never boozy despite the high ABV.

2014 version keg pour into taster glass at Cask and Vine. Aroma of nice burnt sugar/molasses, chocolate, dark fruits. Appearance was thin light brown head, less than a finger width with poor retention, opaque black with minimal lacing. Taste of sweet dark chocolate, dark fruits, and oak and bourbon as perfect complements rather than overshadowing other flavors. Alcohol is hidden well. Palate was full bodied with thick, smooth texture, average carbonation and sweet fruity, boozy flavorful finish. Overall, the aroma and taste are heavenly and aging appears to have done this justice. A true pleasure to drink.

on tap @ Hebron Brew Haus / Hebron KY --- Solid bitter malt aroma. Opaque black color, brown head that stays around, wide bands of lace. Taste is full-bodied dark malt that adds vanilla and coffee on a mild fizzy swallow. Then, on to mild hops and a bit of bourbon in an incredibly long finish in which hops and malt alternate. A terrific bold, malty brew.

Pours a black brown from a bottle. Sooo...I initially poured this right out of a fridge, quite cold, which was the wrong move, boozy and syrupy, no dimension. Let it sit out and warm up over a few hours and just came back to it. Oh man, what a difference, subtle floral and cherry notes in the mouth. That boozy burn became a welcome lingering warmth, and the lackluster sweet aroma added classic bourbon notes (vanilla and dark brown sugar) and coffee. Very good beer.

UPDATED: APR 20, 2016 My second KBS, this one is closer to room temperature and it makes a difference.
Vanilla, coffee, whiskey and woody aromas punched me right in the nose.  Pretty consistent sip after sip, semi sweet dark chocolate with moderate bitterness add to the mix.  Oily and slightly astringent mouth feel for a stout. 
Great but not exceptional.  Im glad I tried it and would not turn one down but I prefer their breakfast stout and a few other bourbon barrel stouts.

UPDATED: MAY 6, 2016 Bottled 2/11/16, 355 ml. 12.4 % abv. Pours black with a decent light-brown head. Aroma: Coffee (espresso lungo), licorice sweets. Dark chocolate. Taste: Mocha, dark chocolate. Touch of vanilla and bourbon. Moderately sweet, balanced roasted bitterness. White chocolate, too. Complex. Palate: Full body, creamy. Fulfilling brew. Extremely pleasant. Lovely roasted tones. Well balanced. Favourites. 
-----
[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Pours black with a nice light-brown head. Aroma: Chocolate. Taste: Medium sweet, pleasant balanced bitterness. Like condensed kinder chocolate. Palate: Full body. Extremely well balanced treat. (15.4.2016)
Bottle. Pours black with thin tan head. Aroma is Chocolate, Malt and Bourbon. Taste is sweet bourbon chocolate coffee with a warm bourbon chocolate finish. Its excellent.
Pours black with a tan head. Aroma is chocolate, coffee, whiskey and vanilla. Taste follows nose.

This beer is a mess. I do not understand the hype on this beer. The stout is way too thin and gets drowned out by the bourbon barrels. No chocolate notes, no coffee, and on top of it the "beer" has no body. The mouth-feel is way too thin. This tastes like black bourbon water
Pours black. Large brown head with sporty lacing. Alcohol and cocoa. Chocolate, coffee and lots of alcohol.

The mouthful with the alcohol burn is the best part. Yes , the factors are all present as stated ad nauseam... coffee, bourbon, chocolate, vanilla, alcohol...the small head and lacing... It really is a delicious beer. One must partake at least one KBS in their life. Drink it fresh and not too cold and in a large bowled glass to appreciate its characteristics. Hell yeah, FOUNDERS!!
Complex flavors, excellent after taste. Great beer but Backwoods Bastard has my heart.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

On draft at Golden Crust, Red Lion, PA. Served in an 11.2oz. snifter glass. Pours BLACK, creamy tan head. Scant lacing with slight retention. Aroma of bourbon and coffee. Taste is very sweet and pretty damn bitter creating an amazing balance. Full bodied, moderate carbonation, sticky yet creamy mouth feel. Finishes long. Tasting notes of bourbon, vanilla, coffee, dark chocolate, oak and sour cherry. Alcohol apparent in its gentle warmth. Never thought I could give any beer a 5, but it just happened! Wonderful stuff gang!
From the bottle poured a black hole dark brew with a chocolate brown head. Powerful aromas of coffee, chocolate, malt, and hops. This stout has everything I like about a stout. Yee Haw!
Bottle. Very dark with mocha head and decent lacing. An aroma of bourbon with a strong coffee note. Robust- roasty, dry, smooth.

For those who dont understand the hubbub about this beer. You probably drank it cold or fresh. This beer gets better as it warms up and as it ages. Open a bottle, pour, and let it sit. This is a SLOW sipper. As it warms up it becomes more chocolate notes over the coffee and high abv. Flavor ADVENTURE.

Aroma: coffee, vanilla, bourbon
Appearance: black with a brown head
Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, coffee, bourbon
Palate: medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish, 

Superb
Completely black, little head. Complex tastes of chocolate, cocoa, coffee and vanilla. Heavy body, great smooth carbonation and a lasting aftertaste of cocoa. Really great

2016 release, 12 Oz bottle. The aroma is excellent, dark chocolate and sweet bourbon with coffee notes. Jet black. Coffee and black bread are the big flavors. The mouthfeel is the best part of this. Perfect consistency for an imperial stout. There is a hint of alcohol well after you sip it. Which isnt a terrible thing. I can see what the fuss is all about. Not quite up to the goose island standard, but outrageously good all the same.

Black pour, beautiful brown head. Rich aroma of chocolate, cocoa, espresso, booze, smoke. Flavor is really incredible. Still lots of sweet chocolate, but big vanilla and bourbon character, with bitterness in the finish. Full, sharp body. Hot damn.
After all the hoopla I was a bit underwhemed. Definitely not worth the going rate of $7/12 oz bottle. While you do get a big ABV for the money they went too strong on the coffee notes.

Wow. 12 oz bottle poured into a snifter. Opaque black color with a light brown head that hang around for quite come time. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, bourbon. Taste is of coffee, caramel, burnt sugar, and chocolate. Hardly any alcohol presence on the finish. Ive never tasted anything like it. Simply unreal.

Well! Encountered this unexpectedly on draft. Ton of bourbon barrel, so a ton of vanilla, coffee much milder than BCBCS which is preferable for me. More like BCBS or Kane ANTEAD. Delicious. Super drinkable, not too hot.

Bottle at Cafe Sara, april 29th 2015. Very dark brown body, short thick brown head. Aroma of nuts, coffee, alcohol, wood. Taste is roasty, sharp oak with astringent notes, mild bourbon vanilla. Heavy dark malt and roast finish. Quite a good stout, though its pretty young and I believe some aging will bring out the full potential of this one.

2016 release, bottled on 3/02/16. Murder black pour with an ok, thin, off white head. Aromas of roasted malts, vanilla and some Kentucky bourbon. Leaves that dark chocolate linger on the tongue, but isnt really that cloying other than that. Alcohol is incredibly masked. Damn this beer is tasty. Nothing really intense considering the high abv, just a solid all around drinker. Wish I had one of these on Christmas morning, but the normal FBS is way easier to find.

2016. Pitch pour with mocha head. Nose of caramel, vanilla, nuts, milk chocolate, dark roast coffee, bit of char. Flavor is very hot. Burning vanilla and oak, dark chocolate, coffee bitter in the back, medium oiliness. Just...really hot. Alcohol is not hidden, and does hinder enjoyment of other flavors. The ohio batch is definitely still well over 12%. All in all, hype is not a flavor. Ill take any Jackie Os stout over this. Sorry.

UPDATED: APR 3, 2016 12 ounces 2016 bottle drank at 15C from the beer cellar. Aroma: awesome nose of vanilla, chocolate, coffee, bourbon. App: pitch black,medium frothy moka head, awesome lacing. Taste and palate: full body, creamy, velvety, coffee forward, light to medium sweetness, light lingering bitter finish. Overall: pretty good. My kind of ba imperial stouts. So easy to drink. Nothing clashes here except maybe the bitterness finish being a tad too long but except for that this is really really good. Could drink this all day. Well maybe not all day since this is really strong abv talking but this is something I could never get bored of. Rating really isnt based on its reputation at all. I really enjoyed it. Not far from a Péché Mortel Bourbon (except for he price). Great job Founders.

Bottle. Pours nearly black with medium tan head and some lacing. Complex aroma of coffee, chocolate, and bourbon. Thick, creamy texture and medium carbonation. The sweetness and chocolate flavor are nicely balanced by some bitterness. Bourbon and hints of vanilla permeate from start to finish. The high alcohol content is well hidden. Great beer.

KBS was one of the first (if not THE first) single bottle limited release brews I tried last year when I started my beer exploring adventure! I still have a bottle from 2015...letting it get some age on. If my memory serves me properly...2015 was harsh in comparison to the current 2016 release which has a mild palate and is very easy drinking. The flavors all meld together nicely...quite pleasant. Pours a nice looking glass with long lasting lacing. I hope I can save a bottle to continue the aging process and add to my collection for comparison at a future date.

Bottle of 2016 filled exactly one month ago. Ink black in the glass. Thick structured and clingy toffee head. Nose leads to the palate, a tantalizingly complex but very well balanced mix of chocolate covered espresso beans, milk, butter maybe even some wet leather in the finish. The dryness is all about the barrel. Heavy warm boozy bourbon. Cant wait to try it again next year and see how she sets up.

Pours a thick viscous black with a surprising caramel head and just a bit of lacing. Aroma is mostly bourbon. Flavor is coffee and bitter dark chocolate, and a bit more alcohol burn than expected, probably needs to age a few months. I was expecting this to be a bit more "chewy". That being said, Im split, I thought it was a really nice beer, glad I had a chance to try it, but Im not sure its worth the upcharge over Breakfast Stout. Time will tell.

Ar- big time wood, sweet vanilla, roasty malts like coffee and espresso. No hop aroma but mild alcohol aroma. Hints of coconut, almost like a Samoa cookie. 

Ap- pours clear and black with a big bark tan head

Fl- sweet and hot up front, followed by strong vanilla and coffee, hints of caramel, toasted coconut and toffee. Roasted malt bitterness and alcohol are present throughout. Nicely balanced there. Get very slight notes of red fruit, strawberries and raspberry. 

Mf- full bodied, high alcohol warming, great carbonation, finished sweet and bitter. 

Ov- by far the best KBS I've had. Served around 60 degrees. Just a huge, delicious beer. Don't remember getting this much coconut before and I really dig it. A lot. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I was skeptical, but this deserves the hype.

2016 release, drinking fresh and at room temp.

Pitch black with dark brown head that clings to the glass. Aroma is roast, chocolate, bourbon, alcohol. Complex taste: starts off sweet with definite coffee and chocolate notes. Transitions into roastier character with alcohol heat and bourbon with a strong oak presence. Finishes with a lingering alcohol warmth, but not harsh. Full bodied and smooth on the way down except for the slight alcohol heat.

Not my favorite style of beer, but this one is great. Definitely a sipper.

2016/04/01 - Pours jet black with a frothy, light tan head that lingers and leaves moderate lacing. Aroma is chocolate, coffee, smokey notes, oaky- vanilla, licorice and light bourbon. Taste is lots of chocolate with notes of vanilla-oak, smokey malt, coffee and a strong, boozy, bourbon finish. Mouthfeel is medium and slick with smooth carbonation and a long, slightly bitter, warming aftertaste. Strikes a perfect balance between sweet, bitter and boozy. 



---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

4/1/16. Worse beer ever....April fools! Draft in snifter at Bull McCabes. Nice refined roasty nose w hint of bourbon and vanilla. Strong smoky body w the alcohol well back in the mouth. Thick mouth. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Deep brown to black color, beige head. Roasted malt nose, coffee, licorice, oak, demerara sugar, hint of bourbon. Roasted malt taste, coffee, oak, vanilla, alcohol, bitter finish. Full body, soft carbonation, oily texture, warming alcohol. Personal stats: Rating #900

Bottle. Pours cloudy very dark brown with stable tan head. Clear aroma of chocolate and malt, with notes of roast and coffee. Sweetish flavour of chocolate malt and notes of yeast, coffe and hints of fruit. Lingering, coffeelike and estery aftertaste. Good stuff, indeed.

Pours a pitch black color with medium brown head. Aroma has lots of chocolate, slightly coffee, vanilla oak, bourbon and a bit of booze. Silky mouthfeel. Taste is explosive, chocolate, vanilla, coffee, bourbon, wood, toffee, caramel and, again, booziness, finishing with a strong bourbon and bitter aftertaste.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */haras. Opaque color with small head. Aroma has coffee, dark chocolate, ripe fruits. Taste is malty with long somewhat bitter aftertaste. Flavors of dark chocolate, coffee, ripe fruits and roasted malt.

12 oz. to snifter. Dark black pour. Looks like motor oil going into the glass. Rises to a 2-finger persistent brown head with tight bubbles. Nice barrel aroma. Taste is chocolatey bitter with good barrel presence as well. Thick palate. This is great beer. Glad I could
Find so many this year.
12oz bottle. Black pour with a foamy tan head. Flavors are roasted cereals, coffee, tobacco, milk chocolate, bourbon and vanilla. Medium to full body, soft carbonation, oily texture.

5 ounce sample on tap at The Davis Beer Shoppe. Aroma has sweet chocolate notes with hints of vanilla and light bourbon. Nice. Virtually opaque black body with a medium, creamy, strong light tan head present. Starts with some sweet chocolate initially before some bourbon and wood flavors come through on the middle. Finishes warming, with bitter coffee grinds and ethanol.
On tap at Hopcat. Dark head. Dark color aromas of coffee and booziness. Simply amazing. 11/10

Bottle from Biercab Shop, Barcelona - Spain. Color: deep dark black beer with small carbonation and medium brown head. Smell: coffee, roasted malt and caramel notes. Toffee and barrel aged finish. Very amazing. Taste: full body with great roasted malt and coffee. Oily sensation. Full sweet body. Good attenuation. Nice evolution, caramel and toffee. Vanilla notes. Aftertaste: barrel notes and vanilla, coffee. Great !

Keg at Kings Arms. Pours black with a dirty tan head that dissipates to lacing around glass. Aroma is coffee, molasses and boozy bourbon. Tastes smooth, a little coffee, bourbon is well balanced. Doesnt drink at 12.4%. Fantastic
This may be one of the best barrel aged stouts I've had. Great aroma, coffee and chocolate notes... Smooth flavor profile and a bold stout overall but not obnoxious

This beer caused such a rampage during its release at my last fest that I nearly didnt even get the chance to taste it. Happily, that near-crisis was avoided. And what a crisis that wouldve been. I wouldve missed out on this impossibly rich and thick brew and all its chocolaty, boozy, and syrupy goodness. Theres a big bourbon note, but the barrel influences are exceptionally smooth. Roasted barley, cream, and coffee flavors. This is a huge beer, but I could drink way too damn much of it if given the chance.
This is a special beer, really good beer. Get it if you can. A really rich thick beer.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Bottle shared at The Booth Brewery. Aroma is heavily chocolate, dry. Pitch black with a tan head. Mouthfeel is thick with slight carbonation. You definitely feel the heat from the ABV. Flavor is chocolate, coffee, sweet. Slightly bitter finish.

Bottle cracked at Stoneface. This is an almost textbook example of a barrel aged stout -- its got just enough malt sweetness and vanilla undertones to balance against the bourbon from the barrel aging. Taste is sweet and vanilla, almost like marshmallow, followed by dryness and whisky. Exceptional -- everyone should try this.

2015 review. Tulip pour. Jet black with a thin tan head and nice lacing. Aroma is coffee, cocoa, dark and milk chocolate, bourbon, and oak. Flavor is dark coffee, cocoa, bittersweet chocolate, bourbon, oak, and vanilla. Very full and dry in the finish. Outstanding beer.

Aroma coffee, chocolate, caramel, wood, marzipan, alcohol and some vanilla. Flavour is medium sweet and light bitterness. Does remind me of a liquor. Full bodied, thick and oily texture, soft carbonation. Finish is coffee and bitter.

At Maakuns. Black with thin light brown head. Roasted chocolate malts. Coffee chocolate vanilla bourbon (just wrote vinalla, so you know) butterscotch, hazelnut. Very sweet with nice pure cocoa bitter and vnilla smoothness. Full body, smooth heavy oily texture, big bourbon and godamn a joy to drink.

Bottle shared at home, massive thanks to Santa bytemesis! One year old to the day. Pitch black with short lasting light brown head that leaves some big bubbles. Massive sweet chocolate at first, sweet bourbon with lots of vanilla, oak, and toffee. Starts with loads of sweet desert notes, and underneath theres coffee, roasted malts, and soft licorice. Theres a slight alcohol burn beneath the sweetness, but its balanced well with the sweet and roasted notes. Quite sweet and light bitter. Almost full bodied with soft carbonation. Very strong on the bourbon, but I love the chocolate notes here. Very nice.

BOD 3/5/15. Pours dark as a starless night. World class head volume, lacing and retention.

World class nose of bourbon, cocoa, vanilla, a hint of coffee and subtle roast and oak notes over a base of caramel and biscuit.

Almost full body with a texture that is creamy and possesses an oily character as well. Superb carbonation with a nice effervescent middle coupled with a very prickly finish.

The flavor profile is world class. It is intense, complex and masterfully balanced. Bourbon is the primary flavor but is buttressed by a rich malt base that pops with roast producing a somewhat sweet stout. Coffee, oak and chocolate comprise the supporting cast of this renowned stout. Bitterness is mild in the middle with roast rather evident over a subtle oak character. From the middle on, chocolate notes are ascending to challenge the bourbon. The finish has a bit of heat and subtle astringency that actually add to the complexity of this masterpiece. At the end, a long slow fade of chocolate lingers.

Strong aroma of coffee, a Lot of coffee followed immediately by a big cocoa nibs, a little bit of vanilla, maybe just a suggestion, riminiscence of milkshake, then oak, bourbon Pure black with a beige head, that disappear not so quicley. Yeah, a Lot of coffee in the mouth, just a Lot of coffee. Then cocoa , strong bourbon notes, oak presence, cherry hint, pocket coffee like aftertaste, And finally a hint of vanilla. Not so sweet like i expected, but so dry. A great beer that lacks in sweetness. With a little touche of vanilla this could be the best beer ever in my experiences. Good mouthfeel, silky/oily texiture, medium to big body. Aftertaste is almoust infinite.

Bourbon. Bourbon, bourbon, bourbon. A tad bit too much bourbon, but delicious nonetheless. Huge bourbon, chocolate, licorice aroma. Palate is a boozy plum with burnt chocolate notes. Mouth feel is strong upfront with a cooling alcohol burn that lingers and is quite pleasing. So happy to finally try this beer!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
What a beer! Despite the hefty amount of alcohol it drinks smooth, dark with gracious amounts of bourbon and coffee and vanilla notes.

355ml bottle from Good Spirits Co, Glasgow:
Fantastic stuff from Founders & well worth the wait, Im glad I picked up 2 bottles at the time. Full of flavour & quite complex with dark, ripe fruits & an oak sweetness on top of the excellent roasted flavours & dark malts. I enjoyed the warming alcohol touches that gave the beer a nice kick & despite the strength it still proved an easier than expected beer to drink. A beautiful beer & one of the best I think Ive tried, Im definitely looking forward to trying this one again now.
Two words Bur Bon. In the aroma in the flavor Kentucky through and through. Malt undertone mellows it out a bit and adds a slight sweet flavor.

An awesome bourbon barreled stout. Pours a beautiful deep black with a tan head. Smells great, vanilla and bourbon and mint. More of this in the taste, lots of vanilla and coffee and mint, with bourbon in the finish. Had on tap at 0L bottleshop.

From bottle, thanks a lot Orla!!! Pours pitch black with a brown head. Aroma of vanilla, roasted malts, coffee, chocolate, light licorice, bourbon, dark fruits, this baby has got it all! Taste is an explosion of goodness, vanilla, bourbon, woody finish, light chocolate, roasted malts, so f*cking well balanced!
8oz pour- I wish I could wake up to this every morning. It is the amazing coffee and bourbon smell. The taste is so well blended it is ludicrous. Amazing beer.
UPDATED: APR 9, 2016 Excellent. no words to describe how tasty and delicious this Imperial Stout is. Cocoa, vanilla, alcohol. Bitter and sweet. Perfect.
Chocolate and coffee aroma. Pours deep black with a tan head. Great flavor, lots of coffee bitterness and a hint of vanilla.

Aroma is full on dark chocolates with a lingering sweetness. Brown sugars and wooden vanilla. Excellent smell. Taste delivers on all levels. 
Roasted malts, sweet sweet molasses, toffee, candy, slight sting of bourbon and a hell of a lot of smooth rich malts with character.
Huge roasted aromas of whiskey and wood. Deep dark beer with creamy brown head. The creamy roasted flavor is thick and carry the vanilla bourbon softly. Really good.

I didnt rate then when I had it. Well not supposed to rate from memory but the likelihood of having this again is about zero. Hard to find and even if I did, it wasnt that great. Tastes just like their regular breakfast stout but maybe a bit more old and stale tasting. The chocolate and coffee was really worse for wear given the age and it provided a dull bitter stale acidity. or did I suffer from inverse rarity syndrome? The beer was truly amazing but I had hyped it so much that it ended up being only ok?
Pours black with a thin foam. Coffee,coconut and chocolate aroma,Taste is bold and coffee comes through.Aftertaste licorice

Pours black with a thin film of foam. The nose has hints of the sweet vanilled oak, also the fruitier bourbon notes is here. Coffee, slight roast, week coconut, wet wood. The taste is rich with big roasted notes, clear boozy wet bourbon wood. Finished with a small alc burn. The aftertaste has roasted malts, licorice, tannic wood notes and coffee. Not very sweet I must say and Im a bit of a sweet tooth.. The mouthfeel is medium full with soft carbonation.

UPDATED: SEP 4, 2016 2015 bottle, bottled 12/02/15. Appearance- black as night, pours like oil, slight tan/ruby tinges, half a finger of a light brown bubbly head which gradually dissipates. Completely opaque. Aroma- loads of it. Vanilla and bourbon notes dominate, wood, milk chocolate, fudge cake, vanilla ice cream with chocolate sauce, smoky undertones, leather jacket, Christmas pudding, cigar, coffee, cocoa beans. Wow. Taste- this is intense. Oak smoked chocolate, vanilla bourbon sweetness, backed up by chewy molasses. Vague hints of cherry skin, raisin and prune juice. Dark chocolate- 90% cocoa. Thick espresso coffee. Roasty toasty malt. Chocolate and whiskey fudge ice cream. More coffee flavour emerges as it warms. The mouthfeel is slightly chewy, sticky and oily, with a moreish bittersweet clingy finish. No booze is really detectable, but you get an alcohol warmth. Amazing stuff.

2016 edition
Bottled 02/16/16- 12.4% abv. Appearance is pitch black with a thick tan head. Aroma- rich peaty whisky, vanilla, oak barrel, leather, tar, cigar, coffee liqueur, roast dark malt, dark chocolate, booze, cherry skins, unbelievable. Taste- dark chocolate, lots of vanilla, boozy oak barrel, whisky, cherry, liquorice, earthy woody notes, chocolate fudge, espresso, dark cocoa-rich chocolate, liqueur chocolates, brandy, Christmas pudding, boozy sticky finish, slick mouthfeel. A bit more boozy than the 15. Lovely.

Best bourbon barrel aged stout that I have had. Great aroma, well balanced. Tried from both 12 oz bottle and growler

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Massive aromas of bourbon, chocolate, toffee, oak, coffee, raisins, figs, black licorice, more oak and bourbon. Pours pitch black with lively lacing. Taste is massive chocolate and bourbon upfront followed by thick, rich, chewy malts, coffee, espresso, cappuccino, toffee, dirt, earth, roasted black malts, burnt sugars, milk chocolate, cocoa powder, melted chocolate, oak and ash. Finishes bittersweet with residual chocolate milk and bourbon. Subtle vanilla notes are present in the back end. Overall, its KBS, what else is there to say? It lives up to the hype and more, absolutely decadent and delicious.

What a lovely way to end 2015. Nice smooth and powerful evening sipper.Pitch black color with a nice lasting beige head.. Good intensity in the aroma. Full body and a smooth carbonation. Ok balance between sweetness and bitterness. Balanced oak, chocolate, vanilla, roast and dark malt.[Bottle from Systembolaget web order in Sweden]

A bottle I brought home from St Andrews Scotland... Go figure. Pours dark black with thin tan head. Fantastic notes of Bourbon and vanilla... Palate is smooth with dark chocolate, espresso, sweet caramel, mellow boozy finish... One of the very best BBA stouts... Amazing!!!

UPDATED: AUG 12, 2016 Excellent beer, coffee in the aroma and taste, together with roasted malts, chocolate, a bit of vanilla and a nice amount of bourbon. Excellently balanced, smooth mouthfeel, low carbonation and a bourbon-chocolate finish.
Bottle from De Hopduvel. Oily black colour, beige foam. Sweet nose of bourbon and vanilla along with bitter roasted malts and coffee. Well balanced stout, not boozy buth smooth and drinkable. Good!
Great beer. Love the flavor and after taste. Wish I could find this more often.

Appearance: Bottled 11/2-2015. Pretty much black, tiny amount of dark tan head. Almost oily.
Aroma: Barrel, coffee, very dark malt.
Taste: Burnt, dark malt, coffee, dark chocolate. Quite strong barrel notes. Hides alcohol very well. Very nice.
Bought: Trade with Nisse666 - thanks!, 355 ml
Info: 27/12-2015, BB: 30/11-2015 (according to importer)

12oz bottle. 1 year old bottle. Pours black with tan head that fades. Smells of stout and vanilla. Medium body oaky flavor. Not a strong whiskey flavor. Finishes real dry. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours pitch black with a fantastic head; lasting and great lacing. Aroma of roasted malt, Coffee, chokolate and Bourbon; oak, tar, smoke. The flavours starts sweet and turns light bitter. Has a lasting aftertaste of coffee and Bourbon.The body is full and texture is creamy. Soft carbonation. A great beer!
Pours pitch black small tan head.Aromas of chocolate,vanilla and coffee.can taste bourbon in the finish,and some boozieness.smooth drinkin stout!😎

0,355l bottle at home from trade with Nische, big thanks. Extra sticker from the Swedish importer says BB 30-11-2015. black color, small dark-coffee colored head. smells of malty roast, bitter herbs, coffee, chocolate, cocoa, wood, bourbon, some licorice, very light ash notes. very nice smell. full body, medium carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes of roast, coffee, licorice, light ash, after a while some wood, bourbon, herbal, bitter chocolate, light marzipan, lightly sour, very light notes of chilis / light chili hotness. finishes dry with notes of coffee, bourbon and chocolate. very nice beer.

Bottle to snifter. Appearance: almost pitch black with a thin toffee colored head. Aroma: big bitter chocolate and bourbon, little hints of vanilla, oak, burnt sugar, sweet smoke, roasted coffee beans. Taste: probably drank this too soon. It?s a little overwhelming on the bourbon right now. The base beer almost gets lost, but it?s still there just a little underwhelming in flavor. Kinda flat. Mild chocolate/coffee forward base beer, hints of vanilla, oak, molasses. Wish I would?ve waited a few months. Bourbon is just too much right now.

Pours black with a thin dark tan head. Aroma is all bourbon. Taste is a disappointment. Taste is mostly boozy bourbon and little else. Did get better as it warmed but still doesnt live up to the hype.

Bottle from the Dram Shop in Sheffield. Pours inky black with a nice frothy beige head. Nice smoky bourbon aroma. The taste is rich chocolate, spice, bourbon and coffee. A bit too much bourbon for my tastes, but still fantastic.

Shared 0,355l bottle @ Vihreä Haltiatar. Pours very dark brown with a low tan head. Aroma is sweet roasted malts, alcohol and coffee. Flavor is sweet roasted malts, coffee, alcohol, chocolate and hops. Great.

Bottle. Dark brown in color, tan head. Bourbon and vanilla in aroma. Bitter coffee in taste, vanilla and more smoother chocolatey notes later on. Drinkable but feels perhaps a bit too sweet. Later on it evens out and the brew is quite enjoyable mix of chocolatey and vanilla notes. Good one.

(355ml 2015 bottle from Systembolaget web order) Pours pitch black with a fairly small tan head that lingers with lots of spotty lace. Aroma of bakers chocolate, roasted cacao, light coffee grounds, some roasted cereal grains, fairly soft whiskey notes, a little vanilla, oak and ash floating in the background. Palate is a little sweet at first a mix of bittersweet chocolate, caramel, strong coffee, bourbon with vanilla and coconut. Bitterness fed by lots of charred oak, coffee, bitter chocolate and roasted malts dries the beer out substantially, supplemented by a bit of bourbon booze. Lots of dry bourbon notes in the finish and aftertaste, some roasted malt, cacao and coffee bean notes as well. Roasted notes last for ages. Medium-full and creamy with soft carbonation. Very nice balance to the beer, not a sugar bomb or a whiskey bomb, with great bitterness. Lovely.

UPDATED: DEC 8, 2015 Pours pitch black with brown lace. Aroma of coffee, roasted malt, chocolate, citrus, oak, whiskey. Intense and heavy, but very well balanced. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours black with a thin line of nougat colored head. Aroma; Cocoa, roasted malt, dark chocolate, bourbon, vanilla, coffee. Flavours; Cocoa, roasted malt, coffee, dark chocolate woth a vanilla and sweet bourbon finish!
Coffee, vanilla, booze. Black with a thin dark tan head that fizzles away pretty quickly. Coffee, cocoa, vanilla, glassy smooth. Boozy. A little edge on the finish. So good.

Bottle, 355 ml. Acquired from The Keans Head, Nottingham. Bottled 23/3/2014. Pours black with a small amount of medium tan head. Thick brown lacing is present. 

Aroma, 5-10 minutes out of fridge: The effects of the barrel aging are immediately apparent on the nose with a prominent bourbon and oak notes permeating right through the rest of the aromas. Espresso and generally dark coffee notes are right at the forefront, with a strongly roasted/almost burned edge to them. Deeper in, chocolate becomes more prominent; thinking milk chocolate or milk chocolate digestive biscuits. Slightly burnt/smokey edges from the malt too. Tiny hints of roasted meat and a little bit of pipe tobacco. Virtually no detectable alcohol. 

Approaching room temperature: some nutty and oaty, cereal-y notes start to emerge, also quite roasted. Roasted peanuts perhaps. Chocolate notes becoming less bitter and closer to full-on milk chocolate like youd get in chocolate bar, specifically cadburys. Vanilla starting to emerge too. Peanut butter maybe as well? Little bit of alcohol now.

Taste: bitter coffee and bourbon throughout with dark chocolate, pipe tobacco, brandy/cognac, maybe some muscavado sugar or navy rum initially. The rum and brandy stick around on the edge of the tongue while the coffee and bourbon permeate across the palate. More bitter notes in the middle, burnt malts and espresso. Finish/aftertaste is more coffee and a little bit of biscuit or cereal, though not quite as bitter at this point, with much of the bitterness having been left on the tongue. Somewhat more of an abrupt/dry finish than expected. Quite dry. Bit of alcohol taste and a significant warmth, as expected, though no burn whatsoever. Lots of vanilla emerges later on, and the cognac notes become more prominent. Chocolate/chocolate biscuits also become more noticeable in the aftertaste, which starts to lengthen.

Palate: absolute delight; full body, thick, oily texture, minimal carbonation, no alcohol burn, smooth as you like. 

Pretty fantastically crafted brew overall, with a brilliant mixture of flavours while definitely tending more towards the sweeter side of things, and probably the best barrel aged beer ive had, thouh not quite the best imperial stout ive had in general. Well worth the somewhat inflated price I paid for one of the few bottles available here in the UK.

On tap at Springvale Publick house, forgot to review. While I dont enjoy whiskey, I wasnt going to pass this up. Pours jet black with thin mocha top. Aromas of whiskey dominate, but malty roast comes through as well. Flavor is similar - almost too much whiskey-ness for me to handle. But... I can very easily discern that had this not gone into a barrel, it may be my favorite imperial stout yet. So smooth and creamy mouthfeel, its notably quality brew.

Svart och lite trögflytande. Doft av choklad och torkad frukt. Djup smak med alkohol på slutet. Många lager av smaker, fint med bourbonlagringen.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap at Ale&Hop. Black colour with beige head. Borubon, wood and roasted aroma. Sweet, bourbon, wood, vanilla, roasted, coffee taste. Full body.

No retention and no lacing. Smells of chocolate, dark fruit and smoke. Tastes of chocolate, smokiness and dark fruits. Dry aftertaste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Blac color with a light tan head with god duration. Aroma has notes of roasted malts, ripe black fruit, coffee notes and some smokyness. Flavor has notes of black chocolate, coffe beans, roasty and toasty malts, some notes of bourbon. Alcohol very good hidden between roasty notes. Creamy, smoothy and dense mouthfeel on palate. Slightly bitterness in the final with a good presence of roasted malts.

Köpt på Systembolaget Fältöversten. Fantastiskt!!!!!! Bra på allt. Kropp smak lukt. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Huge roasted aromas of whiskey and wood. Deep dark beer with creamy brown head. The creamy roasted flavor is thick and carry the vanilla bourbon softly. It is better then i could have ever imagined. The thick body helps everything blend like a milk shake.

355 bottle. Pours black with moderate head. Aromas of vanilla, rich milk chocolate and very dry black coffee. Flavors carry same. Rich and smooth with a little heat and residual sweetness. Beautiful. An American in Copenhagen...

UPDATED: MAR 31, 2017 355 ml bottle from Systembolaget, edition 2017 - 11,9%. Pitch-black with a medium mocha head. Strong aroma of bourbon, burnt coffee, roasted malt, chocolate, caramel and alcohol. Taste reflects the aroma, but more burnt coffee. Full-bodied, with creamy texture. Medium bitterness. Low to medium carbonation.

Review of bottle dated 03/05/15

Pours a pitch black body with a 1/4 inch dark chocolate head. Head retention and lacing are average for a barrel aged imperial stout. 

Smells of vanilla, coffee, chocolate malt, and burnt oak. As beer warms, sweet bourbon comes through. 

Taste is of cold bitter coffee, charred oak, with a warm bourbon finish. Sweet vanilla comes in and out but bitter coffee and alcohol are main flavors. 

Mouthfeel is medium but for such a dark and high abv stout, not the desired consistency. Head added nothing to the body. 

Overall this beer had all the characteristics of a bourbon barrel coffee stout, it was one of the originals after all, but it just falls flat for me every time I try it.

(Thanks, Brandon "Clownoisseur")

Bottle.

A- Bourbon, booze, milk chocolate, tootsie rolls, subtle coffee, oak.

A- Black color, black liquid, brown head.

T- Bourbon, booze, chocolate, tootsie rolls, subtle vanilla, subtle coffee.

P- Full body, average texture, average carbonation, complex finish.

O- What a beauty of a beer. Got this bottle fresh and while it seems to be preferred fresh, I decided to wait a few month, 9 to be exact to let it settle a bit as I like the regular Breakfast Stout best at 2 years of age. Man, I almost wish Id have waited a bit longer. At first pour, this is heavy on the booze, booze, booze. Almost all you get. The head fades quick and the aroma remains but the booze subsides and out comes the chocolate. The coffee was very very subdued. The taste was a nice chocolate, rich, and complex flavor. The palate had a bit of boozy heat on the finish but still smooth. Overall, I have to admit I still prefer the regular Breakfast Stout, but this is nothing to shy away from. Amazing brew.

duft: vanilje ristet malt chokolade chokolade kage burbon. 
smag: vanilje ristet malt kaffe sød. chokolade. fad smag

On draught at both Harrys Hofbrau and Ale Arsenal for the release of Founders in CA. I have always love Breakfast Stout - and this one blows it away in complexity when side-by-side. Rich coffee and whiskey, slight vanilla. So good.

355ml bottle. Böack with two finger brown head. Aroma is whiskey, dark chocolate, coffee, oak barrels, roasted dark malts and maybe a touch of liqorice. Taste is quite but not overwhelmongly bourbon forward with bitter coffee, rich dark chocolate, roasted dark malts and oak barrel. The mouthfeel is surprisingly smooth yet filling, the carbonation soft and light, the alcohol well hidden but warming and the aftertaste a very satisfying mix of all flavours.

2x33cl @OBE2015 (Thank you mjs!) A winner of the event. Not considered overpriced at all. Super good on all frontiers. Pitch black, complex aroma. Smoked, with some oak barrel feel to it. Makes you warm inside form the very first sip. Closer to the end turns to be to sweet and sugary, and that is a good thing. Not dry, no numbing ash or anything negative.

2 finger brown head, black body. Nose: Espresso, ash, tar, soy-sauce, licorice, dark chocolate and coffee. Aroma: Coffee, espresso, coconut, dark chocolate, caramel, soy-sauce, salt licorice, alcohol-burn, vanilla, ash, tar, resin and oak. Long bitter ending.

Flaska från SB. Smak och doft av mörk choklad, kaffe, rostad malt, torkad frukt, brunt socker, marzipan, karamell, bourbon, ekfat, med toner av kokos, nötter och vanilj. Rund och len, uppfriskande stout, välbalanserad och lagom söt, fin beska med smak av bitter mörk choklad.
Black of color with a brown head. An aroma of roasted malt, vanilla, coffee, cereal, weak chocolate and wet basement. A flavor of vanilla, roasted malt, coffee, liqurice and an oily texture.

Black body with a thick brown head. Aromas of chocolate, coffee, bourbon, vanilla. Taste is sweet with bourbon, chocolate, vanilla, oak, caramel, and notes of coffee and roasted malts. Full body with low to medium carbonation.

UPDATED: DEC 26, 2016 Imbottigliata l11 febbraio 2015, aperta il 26 dicembre 2016.
Marrone molto scura con riflessi granata e caramello, schiuma nocciola poco persistente ed un po avara.
Aroma di cioccolato fondente, bourbon, melassa, caffè zuccherato, note marsalate date dallossidazione.
Al palato cioccolato fondente, cacao, amarena sotto spirito, fichi secchi quasi impercettibili, lieve bourbon che si fa più presente successivamente insieme al cioccolato fondente; dopo una breve pausa si fa avanti un bellissimo finale di caffè tostato misto a zucchero e cacao accompagnati da uva passa e da una nota etilica che riscalda e sale al naso, infine lascia una piacevole nota legnosa molto persistente.
Retrolfatto con nocciola tostata e cacao.
Corpo pieno, oleosa, poco carbonata ma non piatta.

------ l11 Febbraio 2015, aperta il 13 Ottobre 2015.
Marrone scurissima, praticamente nera, riflessi caramello, schiuma nocciola di buona persistenza, vista soprattutto lalta gradazione alcolica.
Aroma complesso: caffè tostato, cacao, vaniglia, liquirizia, amarene sotto spirito, cappuccino, zucchero caramellato, bourbon, note dinvecchiamento in botte.
Al palato prevalgono cacao e caffè che si alternano anche sul finale, insieme ad una piacevolissima nota alcolica liquorosa che ricorda ovviamente il bourbon e lo cherry che rinvigorisce la bevuta; presente anche una nota erbacea molto molto timida.
Corpo pieno, oleosa, poco carbonata, semplicemente splendida.

Bottle from Keans Head, Nottingham. Hazy almost black colour with virtually no head. Aroma is coffee, sweet molasses, roasted malt and bourbon. Taste mainly sweet with roasted malt and warmth from the high abv.
Had this last year and didnt like it at all . Will rate it again properly next time I have it .

On draft @ Ithaca Coffee Company. Aroma is largely delicious bourbon. Flavor is charred bourbon barrels, chocolate, vanilla, coffee, milk. Exquisitely well balanced, creamy mouthfeel, bittering finish. Excellent beer, lucky to try it from a personal stash.

Deep, intense mocha and coffee flavors. Undertones of chocolate and vanilla bean, oats, medium hop presence. Finishes with subdued spice and very understated bourbon nuances. Rich, creamy, intense and well balanced, yet thin on the palate for the style.
Bottle. Aroma is chocolate, truffle, Arabic coffee. Taste is nougat, toffee, coffee, molassess, tar, walnut, hazelnut, caramel, fudge, whiskey, vanilla. Great, great brew.

10/9/2010 11:21:18 PM Bottle from Cracked Kettle. Dark black pour with foamy tan head. Sweet, roasty and creamy nose. Taste of chocolate, malts, roast, coffee and sweetness. Very creamy texture, chocolate malt-like. Just wonderful.

Bottle from Mother Kellys, London. Pours black with thin head. Oak and coffee on the nose. Medium to full body. Taste is roasted barley, coffee, chocolate and a good dose of sweetness. Sweetness is well balanced out by the bitterness. Top beer!

Pours black with a tan head. Dark chocolate, roasted malt, coffee, caramel and graham cracker and oak aroma. Dark chocolate, coffee, roasted malt, caramel, graham cracker, soy sauce, licorice, vanilla and oak flavors. Full body and moderate carbonation. Dark chocolate, coffee and alcohol finish.

330ml bottle (thanks mjs). Pitch black color. Small size, brown head, stays. Chilly, coffee beans, roast, spicy, herbal in aroma. Chocolate, vanilla, nice roast, cocoa, mild chilly pepper in taste. I feel like I just eat a bar of chocolate. Fantastic brew. At that abv it feels almost watery.

UPDATED: FEB 21, 2017 Bottle (2015? release). Pours black with brown head. The head stays for a second. Aroma is intense coffee, vanilla, roast, malt. Flavor is sweet and bitter, vanilla, coffee, malty, wood. Finish is coffee bitter. Overall: great beer.
2016 release, Aroma has kind of milky touch, and some booze, also more vanilla. Flavor has also a ton more vanilla than I remembered, also bit of peanut butter. Still a great beer (worth 4.1 easily), but Im not much of vanilla guy, so no bump for the rating. I still prefer Breakfast Stout actually.

Dark brown beer, tan head. Nose is coffee, vanilla, wood, roast, alcohol. Flavor is hard roast, lots of coffee, vanilla, strong woody-oaky notes and bourbon. Roasty finish, bourbon, smoke notes, coffee, roast. Nice one.

355ml bottle from Vino, shared with Ashton McCobb. Pours opaque dark brown with a persistent tan head. Lovely tight, tiny-bubbling head. Aromas of dark chocolate, vanilla, bourbon, hazelnuts, premium coffee. Taste is all of the preceding mlud. Great structure to the palate. Long roasted, caramel biscuit and boozy finish. Yeah.

Bottle thanks to allmyvinyl.
Appearance - opaque black with a lovely fawn crema head. 
Nose - syrup and toasted sweet pancakes with chocolate. Hazelnuts.
Taste - maple syrup and chocolate with an alcohol finish. Loads of wood.
Palate - full bodied with a big creamy but slightly tannic middle section and a long dry finish, which keeps coming back with richness.
Overall - loads going on,

#2000. In dre trein met Abijen. Mooie zwarte rte kleur met een volle bruine kraag. Ruikt zoetig, vanille, koffie, crème. Mooie volle geur. Smaakt vol vanille, drop, koffie, fruitig. Mooie volle structuur.
Pik zwart met een mooie bruine kraag. Ruikt geroosterd, overrijp fruit, koffie. Smaakt koffie, chocolade, gebrand, vanille, overrijp fruit.

# 1000. Negro opaco y espuma beis uniforme. Aromas intensos de chocolate, café, bourbon, frutos negros, licor. Cuerpo denso y sedoso con inicio dulce achocolatado sabor intenso de bourbon, frutos negros y final de amargor acafetado y trago cálido.
Velvety black pour with thin mocha colored head. Bitter coffee, vanilla, oak, and TONS of bourbon. Warmth of alcohol is alluring. Definitely a sipper. Good stuff.

Bottle, pours black with a small tan head. Full bodied velvety mocha, vanilla and bourbon, silky smooth, dark chocolate and roastiness into the light bitter and smooth finish. Carbonation is soft. Lovely.

Bottle from Beerhive a while ago. Pours black with creamy brown head, slightly oily. Nose is complex and rich - vanilla, bourbon, deep roast, dark chocolate, coffee. Very promising. Palate is rich and strong. Roasted malts, chocolate, bourbon, vanilla. Warming boozy finish with dryish roast and coffee. Yes, it is delicious. Small minus from quite strong booziness at the end.

Dégustée sur la terrasse en compagnie de Ju-Lo. Merci pour le partage mon vieux! À peine décapsulée, la bouteille laisse échapper des arômes qui en un instant ont entièrement envahie la terrasse! Le bouquet olfactif de cette bière est absolument fabuleux: chocolat noir, pain grillé, un bourbon chaud et caramélisé, du bois... Suis-je en train de devenir fou? Oui et tant mieux! Plus je mattarde à ces arômes parfaites, plus jy perçois de la pâtisserie. En me fermant les yeux, je respire les effluves dun magnifique gâteau aux framboises à la crème pâtissière et aux marshmallows. Cest absolument fabuleux! La magnifique complexité de ce nectar diminue de quelques crans en bouche. En effet, les saveurs sont moins élaborées que les arômes. Sur mon palais coule un magnifique liquide chocolaté aux subtiles saveurs de bourbon chaud du Kentucky, de mélasse et de réglisse rouge. La délicieuse amertume laissée en fin de bouche est celle dun grand chocolat belge! Irréprochable texture soyeuse et souple, moins riche toutefois que limpériale stout de la même brasserie; le vieillissement en barriques de bois ayant aminci la texture de ce magnifique breuvage. Je suis émerveillé et sans voix.

Pours black with an average, lacing tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffe, chocolate, anilla and bourbon. Sweet flavor that ends up dry and slightly bitter. Full to medium bodied, oily to creamy texture and soft carbonation.

22/08/2015  sample (bottle) @ Gents Bierfestival shared by 77ships.
Black colour, tanned head. Coffee, caramel, some vanilla, boozy. Nice one!

Poured from a bottle. Dark brown color, no real head. Sweet syrup and malt aroma. Full body with a sweet malt and a coffee flavor and a medium finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma of bourbon and coffee with notes of malt and chocolate. Pours a dark brown color with no real head. An incredible taste of bourbon, coffee and chocolate. Full body creamy feel with an amazing mocha finish.

Last beer of the night at Richs Cellar Emptying Tasting. Kbs stout 11.2%

Inky deep black pour with a coffee light bourbon nose. Young bottle meaning the bookings is full on black coffee, maple syrup and light bourbon. The booze is a bit harsh. Overall it is quite nice but has a bit too much heat.

Black, beige head. Aroma of Bourbon, vanilla, caramel, sweet notes, molasses, light coffee. Sweet malty flavour, brown sugar, caramel, Bourbon, vanilla. Light boozy, full body. Sweet finish, chocolate, vanilla, Bourbon. Nice, quite balanced and full. (from 35cL bottle shared @ Gents Bier Festival 2015. Thanks Eugene for muling)
Old rating from 2012, full aroma with coffee and alcohol, taste of bourbon, vanilla and coffee

Deep black colour. The smell is dominated by alcohol.
The taste is great with lots of chocolate and caramel spiced up with tons of bourbon

Bottle from Mother Kellys. Aroma is milky chocolate, roast, coconut, bourbon, booze. Taste is good, all the above. Finish is bourbon, but smooth fade. Rest of the flavours are quite subdued. Rich finish, almost fruity. Touch of chocolate. Cant really get the coffee. Very easy drinking and hides the booze well.
Draft. Black color with a quickly dissipating tan head. Minimal lacing. Aroma roasted coffee. Taste is coffee, vanilla (cream?) and the bourbon. It has a thick mouth feel and a dry finish.

Bottle thanks to bytemesis, thanks Mike! 2014 version. Dark color. Thin brownish head. Body is light oily, super super smooth. Taste is light to medium sweet, medium bitter. Aroma is nuts, chestnuts, chocolate, vanilla, bacon. Flavour is chocolate, coffee, liquorice, alcohol, fruity.
Pours black. Medium tan head that fades fast. Wonderful chocolate marshmallow roasted oak flavor. Very smooth and balanced.

355ml bottle from Systembolaget. Black with a medium large, creamy beige head, leaves lacing on the glass. Intense aromas of oak barrels and booze, chocolate, licorice, marshmallow. Mild carbonated, thick, creamy, sweet mouth feel, full bodied. Taste has several dimensions, sweet chocolate cake, vanilla, roast almonds, oak, coffee, chocolate, bourbon. Finishing warming but still hiding the alcohol well.

How: Bottle.
Where: Systembolaget.
Appearance: Black colour with a beige head.
Aroma: Liquorice, alcohol, roasted malt, coffee, caramel, spices, some vanilla, raisin.
Body: Full body, low carbonation.
Flavour: Dried fruit, caramel, alcohol, liquorice, roasted malt, spices, raisin.

12 oz bottle. Beautiful roasty aroma with nice wood. Dark brown/black color, with no head. Terrific flavor! An awesome blend of roast, chocolate, and bourbon flavors. Full bodied, with nice carbonation. Overall, a terrific beer!
Big dark chocolate aroma with black licorice and barrel. Taste is black licorice, dark chocolate, barrel.
Very smooth, lots of coffee flavours and aromas. Very easy to drink. Doesnt taste as strong as it is. One of nicest stouts Ive tried

UPDATED: AUG 25, 2016 Bottle from 2015, 11.2%. Black with small brown head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, bourbon, vanilla and espresso. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, espresso, bourbon, vanilla, sweet, hop, little liquorice, warming and a little bitter. 9, 4, 9, 5, 18

Tap @ Mikkeller Aarhus, 12,4%. Black with small beige head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, bourbon, little vanilla, little espresso and a little wood. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, espresso, bourbon, vanilla, medium sweet, liquorice, wood, warming, hop and  medium bitter. 8, 4, 9, 5, 17

Bottle and draft. Deep black, a little smoky from the bourbon and oak, very well balanced, rich, warming, excellent strong beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Kaffe choklad bourbon vanilj. Tät svart till färgen. Smaken gudomlig, så välbalanserad och verkligen smooth. Når dock inte ända fram till speedway stout bourbon barrel aged från alesmith som fortfarande enligt mig är världens bästa öl hittills

Sampled 2015 and 2013 side by side... Both were pure black oil, pure brown head, dense. Coats the glass. Both smell sweet and bourbony, chocolate syrup. The old one had an unreal palate, can taste it in my toes like a fine whisky, very thick rich and sweet. The new one was more acidic and bitter, good hop character, but less punchy in the palate, a bit more raw but also more balanced as the old one was pure dessert. Extreme beer, certainly in the top tier.

2015 drinken in 2015
APPEARANCE - black beauty, as expected. Nice nougat head with moderate lacing.
NOSE - nice bourbon nose, without being overpowering.
FLAVOR - exceptionally smooth and well balanced. Bourbon is present but not overpowering. Signs of Breakfast Stout shoe through.
NOTES - one of the best Bourbon aged beers that hasnt been aged.
Black beer with small tan head. Aroma of chocolate, vanilla, some coffee and bourbon notes. Taste is vanilla, light bourbon, chocolate and roasted malts with some coffee.

Originally reviewed 10/28/2011. 12 oz. bottle poured into a snifter. 2011 vintage. Jet black with a small tan head. It dissipates with some wispy lacing on top. Smell is coffee, bourbon, and heavy roasted malts. Dark, burnt chocolate. Whats amazing is how well all three components shine through, without any one overshadowing the others.

Taste follows the smell. Bourbon first, then some coffee, followed by a very roasty malt character. Its fairly bitter throughout, mostly from the coffee and the roasted malts, which give off even more coffee flavor. Distinguishable is a chocolate flavor, but its very dark and very burnt. I first thought the malts were a bit harsh, but on a second tasting, I appreciate more than Founders could maintain the intense stout flavor among the bourbon and coffee. Amazingly light, considering the ABV. Low carbonation, but thats to be expected. It finishes quite bitter, which makes the lingering flavors a little bit harsh. A thicker beer might make for some mellowing of these effects.
Really spectacular blend of flavors.

UPDATED: SEP 17, 2015 Keg at Craft Beer Rising. A deep brown to black colour with a medium mocha head. Aroma of roasted malts, coffee, chocolate, bourbon, some toffee, raisins, subtle molasses and slight pepper. Taste of roasted malts, coffee, chocolate, oak, dried fruits, subtle molasses, bourbon, alcohol and slight vanilla. Full bodied and soft carbonation. A warming, roasted coffee bitterness in the finish with a bourbon aftertaste. OMG what a beer, packed with great, complex flavours. The intense roasted flavours are balanced well with fruit and whiskey tones
just number and simple notes during convesation: pitch black, oily, coffee, rich roasted, huge balance in flavour

Rating #1000. 355 ml bottle 2015 version, from a trade with Garrold, many thanks Gary!
Pitch black, oily liquid, with a small, dense, creamy, moderately lacing, coffee colored head.
Delicious, smooth aroma of bourbon, melting chocolate, vanilla, coffee, cocoa, some alcohol.
Taste is as delicious and rich, with bourbon, wood, coffee, cocoa, coconut, some vanilla, slight liquorice, booze.
Full, oily mouthfeel, with a soft carbonation.
Finishes warm, alcoholic, dry, wooden, with coffee, cocoa, liquorice, some bourbon.

Excellent! Great example of a bourbon barrel aged Imperial Stout, with the bourbon notes very well integrated, not too dominant, so that there are room for lots of other notes. Maybe a bit too alcoholic, while it is still a quite smooth sipper. Overall worth the hype and among the best Stouts Ive had.

Bottle BBE: 12.2.16. Room temp. Pours a deep, dark chocolate body with negligible head. On the nose: intense, fresh ground coffee, rich cocoa, marzipan and toasted marshmallow. Complex, developing, dark chocolate sweetness to taste with enough bitterness cutting through. Full-bodied with a chewy texture, low-medium carbonation and an extremely long, vanilla oak finish. A delicious stout thats more than bold enough for its high abv. An excellent after-dinner sipper.

2015 edition. Pours an opaque black with fluffy khaki head, doesnt appear to be pouring very thick though. Full, roasted mocca aroma, Italian espresso, dark chocolate (80% cacao), fudge brownie, hints of wet wool and some burnt grass. Medium-full bodied palate, balanced sweetness with a good amount of bitterness and long finish. I dont know how this has been in previous vintages, but I find it quite delicious now. Not quite up with the very best of them, but certainly world class.

330ml bottle, thanks to Paolo. Pours very dark brown with minimal tan head. Strong sweet bourbon aroma. Taste is sharp and clear with defined vanilla and bourbon. Espresso and dried fruits coming in but really its all about that sharp bourbon smacking you round the chops. A really quite remarkable beer that does justify the hype.

Bouteille 355ml, gracieuseté de tom10101, merci Tommy! Couleur noire opaque, mousse moka foncée riche et persistante laissant une belle dentelle. Arôme de magny torréfié, café, boisé, alcool. Goût de malt torréfié, café, alcool, Bourbon, boisé, chocolat en arrière-goût. Carbonatation faible, corps dense.
Bottle at home. Bitter chocolate, espresso, vanilla, cinnamon and dark fruit. Fine bourbon character. Dark, smooth and full of flavour. Highly enjoyable.
Tap. Black with small brown head. Aroma mainly bourbon, some roasted malts. Taste alcohol, roasted malts. A bit cloying.

UPDATED: AUG 18, 2015 Bottled. Pours black with an average, lacing tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffe, chocolate, anilla and bourbon. Sweet flavor that ends up dry and slightly bitter. Full to medium bodied, oily to creamy texture and soft carbonation. A great Impy. 🌟🌟🌟🌟

Thanks to Christian: Beer of the year for me. Its not the hops, its not the roasted malts or the sourness. Its something completly different from the usual top notch beer. What stroke me was sweetness, but it isnt sweet. Its an explosion of toffee, caramelized suger, vanilla and chocolate - but it isnt sweet, just yummy. A perfect beer for what its trying to be.
Appearance is small brown head and nearly black. Aroma is chocolate and chocolate. Taste is a nice balance between chocolate, coffee, and aged bourbon. Overall one of the very good stouts out there.

UPDATED: SEP 1, 2016 DØE. Black with a small light brown head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, chocolate, vanilla and bourbon. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish. Oily. 290515 8/4/9/5/18=4.4 --- Tap @ Mikkeller, Aarhus. Black with a light brown head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, chocolate, vanilla, wood and bourbon. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Drry and rather bitter finish with warming alcohol. Oily. 010916 9/4/9/5/18=4.5

full body, thick feel, average carbonation, soft carbonation, long finish, roasty, coffee, chocolate, vanilla, black, minimal head. I didnt like this years as much as others, but still a fantastic stout

Pours very dark brown with small light brown fully diminishing head. Heavy malty aroma with notes of roasted malts, dark chocolate, dark coffee. Moderate hoppy aroma with notes of spruce and resin. Moderate yeast aromas with notes of leather. Heavy notes of whiskey, vanilla and alcohol. Flavor is moderate sweet, heavy bitter, and moderate acidic. Long finish, moderate salty. Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonation is lively, medium astringent, heavy alcoholic finish. First beer with whiskey aromas I kinda like.

Pours black with a khaki brown head. Head retention is ok. AROMA: chocolate, coffee, alcohol, smoke, vanilla, woody, spice, brown sugar, raisin, caramel, malt, light hop bitterness and bourbon notes. TASTE: coffee, chocolate, vanilla, smoke, woody, alcohol, caramel, bourbon, malt, hop bitterness, spice, brown sugar and earthy.
Great undertones of coffee, Chocolate and bourbon. As good as Bourbon county :)

UPDATED: SEP 30, 2015 3550ml bottle (Kittys, Helsinki) (7+:4:7+:4:14+=3.6+++)
Initially a chocolate and vanilla aroma, later lots of espresso. Sweet palate, but pleasant carbonation, not too sticky. Full rich coffee, chocolate, and bourbon taste - has warming heat. Whats thre is nice, bit its not beer, its just a bottle of adjuncts. After only a few minutes in the glass, its warmed up enough to start smelling boozy. And those vapours go up the back of the nose too. Are you sure this isnt just a decent beer with bourbon added? Whatever, the mixtures tasty.
330ml bottle (300e of overpriced beer tasting) - thanks mjs! (6:4:6:4:13=3.3)
Beanier than I remember - vanilla, cocoa, and some woodiness. Watery feel almost. Some alcohol in the finish. Full palate. Again, not getting the beer in this. A poor show, considering whats in it.
Bottle at KØ 15. Black with a beige head. Aroma and flavour of roasted malt, chocolate, caramel, coffee, vanilla, oak, and bourbon.
Such a great stout. Similar to Goose Island Bourbon County Brand Stout, but superior in my opinion as th bourbon isnt as overpowering

UPDATED: JUL 31, 2015 Bottled: Feb. 2nd 2015. Colour: blackest black. Beautiful head that stays for a while. Aroma: hits you in the face with coffee; booze/bourbon, vanilla, oak, caramel, sweet fruit (melon/watermelon?), honey, waffles -- very complex, very pleasant, and not over the top. Thick, silky smooth body. Taste: sweet, but not cloying, mellow, dark chocolate, gentle alcohol bite; barrel influence is very much present, but not overpowering. Finish is warming, quite bitter (coffee really shines here), and nicely balances the sweetness. So glad I have one more bottle of this. Update 1/08/2015: tried this against another very good BA imp. stout, and KBS is head and shoulders above. A masterpiece.
Black as black can be, tiny brown lace. Bourbon, wood, coffee, hint of chocolate and vanilla. Nice bitterness, well balanced. Full body, thick with soft carbonation, long bourbon touch finish

Flaska från SB. En riktigt kraftig IS. Ganska söt och inte så besk, men kroppen är så stor att den inte känns särskilt söt, bara kraftig. Kaffe, choklad, lite vanilj och bourbon men fatlagringen dominerar inte alls smakbilden utan lägger till ytterligare en dimension till ett i grunden riktigt bra öl. Hypen kanske inte riktigt håller fullt ut men riktigt gott.

Black with small light tan head. Aroma has barrel, bourbon and raw licorice. Solid, balanced and boozy. Flavour is similar with lots of barrel flavour and coffee bitterness. Mouthfeel is smooth and sticky with a strong bitter kick. Quite boozy but well balanced by the lasting bitterness. My rating #1500.
Flaska från SB. Svart med ljusbrunt skum. Kraftig doft av kaffe. Söt och kraftig med smak av kaffe, vanilj och bourbon.

Bottle @ Zeebra 2015, small sample. Dark color, short frothy brown head. Aroma of dark roast, dark chocolate, bit coffee, molasses. Slight sweet in taste, roasty bitterness. Just a touch of vanilla. Smooth, slight creamy texture. Good stuff.
12oz bottle pours a black color with a bit of head. Harsh at first and needs some time to breathe. Some berry flavor and mild bourbon in the background. Coffee bitterness.

Wow, chocolate and coffee, mixed with the bourbon notes. It drinks very easily, with nice vanilla notes on the finish. Its great when you anticipate a beer for a long time, and it doesnt disappoint .
Flaska från systembolaget. Bourbon, alkohol och söt vanilj i doften, och svaga rökiga toner. Detsamma kommer igen i smaken, lite kaffe och choklad också, och värmande alkohol. Mycket god!

@ Basunen 15-6-19: stor fin doft av mörk choklad. Smaken är mycket len och balanserad med toner av choklad, kaffe och en svag burbon-sötma. Visst är den god men har smakat bättre. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
---- Soberness not garanteed!

Bottle.
Dark brown black, thick brown head.
Aroma of dill coffee, caramel.
Taste of deep coffee, burned caramel and butter notes.
Bottle. Black colour. Coffee, chocolate, roasted malts, aroma and flavour, a delicious stout
Flaska systembolaget. Svart kulör med gyllenbrunt skum. Doft av kaffe, choklad, fat och vanilj. Rostad och kraftfull smak med knäck, kaffe och choklad. Värmande alkohol
bottled. very salty, lightly sour, heavy cloying sweetness, medium bitterness. aroma of licorice, chocolate, coffee, glace, and roasted sponges. Good beer.

Finally I get hold of this, much talked about, KBS. Released in a limited edition (2400 bottles) in Sweden June 4 - 2015. I managed to get 6 bottles. 

The beer pours like black motoroil with a huge, three finger high, mocca-head. 

The nose is FANTASTIC! So deep, rich and creamy. Coffee, dark chocolate, cayenne pepper, marshmallows, oak, bourbon, brown sugar, roasted malt and alcohol. 
The taste just keep this up! Chocolate, oak, cayenne pepper, black pepper, brown sugar, vanilla, toffee, bourbon, molasses, red berries and dark fruit.
This is a full body beer! Complex structure. Silky smooth. Oily texture. A light bitterness and dry ending. 

This is really something special and unik. I have to go to Goose Island Bourbon County Stout to find something to match this.

Wow! Im so glad I still have five bottles left in my beercellar...
Bottle from Hop Hideout, Nether Edge - lots written about this, not going to add much, but this is a winner. Warm and complex. Not a bad un.

Bottle shared thanks to Richthevillan. Black beer with small tan head. Aroma of chocolate, vanilla, some coffee and bourbon notes. Taste is vanilla, light bourbon, chocolate and roasted malts with some coffee. Medium bodied. Very good.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Pours really thick and black, small film of beige foam. This beer has such a fantastic aroma, lots of coffee, dry chocolate, vanilla, oak, molasses, bourbon. The flavour is also fantastic, dark roasted malts, coffee, bourbon, chocolate, molasses and oak. Bit of alcohol as well. Full bodied with little carbonation. Truly a great beer!

35 cl bottle @ home. Pours black with a tan head that leaves a little lacing. Aroma and flavour are coffee, dark chocolate, pepper, liquorice, and tiny hints of vanilla and bourbon - with a smooth finish.

Bottle from Systembolaget (2015 edition). Creamy, beige head. Black body. Smells of coffee, chocolate, wine. Tastes strong from chocolate and coffee, vanilla, bourbon, a bit sweet and sour with a dark roasted finish. Complex and well-rounded. Great beer.
A: coffee, plum, chocolate T: Vanilla, marzipan, almond, chocolate, maple sirup O: Sweet with loads of flavours!

UPDATED: MAR 31, 2017 0.33 flaske på cardinal. Aroma kaffe. Vanilje whisky malt litt alkohol. Smak av kaffe whisky malt. Mild balansert og kanongod drakk den litt for kald. Prøvde den igjen på perfekt temp. Smaker også røkt. Den er bare Kanongod

Pours jet black as it should.

Aroma is coffee, chocolate, dark roasted malts and not least bourbon, lots of it on the nose!


Not a big fan of bourbon but i do see some improvements to certain stouts when done in moderation, lots of them tend to soak up to much and end up tasting like a bourbon mixed drink of sorts. Taste on this one reveals the nose is bigger than the taste on that note though, rich coffee tones, both dark and lighter tones of chocolate. Everything topped with just the right amount of bourbon. Very nice stout indeed!

Bottle from SB.

UPDATED: MAY 22, 2016 Bottle. Nose is Vanilla, bourbon, coffee, oak, smoke, hint of cherry, hint of cola, dark chocolate. An interesting and beautifully balanced nose. Taste is bourbon, coffee, dark chocolate, smoke, vanilla, chocolate ice cream, fruit cake, rum, port more chocolate, grainy coffee.

Moutfeel is surprisingly mobile and slick. 

The hype around this beer, had me approaching it looking down my pince-nez.... It is fantastic, I love founders, and this is such a beautifully balanced, outstanding beer. 

Edit: 2016: Nothing particularly to offer beyond I like it even more than last year. The temptation is always to be sniffy about these legendary beers, but I think the nose in particular is outrageous

Bottle from beerhive. Pitch black, tan head. Dusty, charcoal, woodpile. Faint vanilla and coffee grounds. Huge vanilla front, soft carbonation with coffee and bitter graininess. Oak and chocolate. Medium-long finish. Its a bit bonkers and like nothing Ive had before!
On tap at Meadhall. Aroma is... Holy crap! Maple, vanilla, coffee, chocolate, perfect. Taste is bitter, boozy, roasty, marshmallow. Booziness is high, but otherwise delicious.

Bottle from Beer Hawk, the 2015 batch. Apparently the 16th best beer in the world...quite exciting! Pours dark black, quite high carbonation, brief brown foam which vanished almost immediately. Dominated by the coffee and bourbon, any roasty malt flavours or hops play a background role here. Strong vanilla, I guess from the bourbon. Strong coffee too, a bit of an aftertaste like chewing on coffee beans, grainy, bitter and a bit harsh. Its nice. Reasonably complex I suppose. But its dominated by all the extra stuff that wouldnt normally be in beer, the coffee and the barrel ageing. I like coffee. I like bourbon. I like chocolate quite a lot. I dont mind that oaky vanilla taste. But Id prefer to have a slice of chocolate cake along with a traditionally-brewed imperial stout (maybe brewed by Founders, I love their basic dark beers), and a coffee the following morning.

UPDATED: MAR 9, 2017 12 oz bottle. Bottled on 02/12/2015. At the Molotow, Helsinki, Finland.
Im standing in the rain outside of the super crowded bar and holding the glass in my hand. Ive been looking for this for some time now... years I would say... and here it is. Looks black with a tiny light tan head. The aroma is amazing. Pure amazing. Whiskey sweetness, vanilla sweetness, alcohol depth, roasted malt, mild coffee notes and dark chocolate in the aroma. 
The flavour is at least as amazing as the aroma is... and even more... bliss. Roasted malt, sweetness from vanilla and whiskey, mild alcohol burn, dark chocolate, mild coffee and some dark fruits in the flavour. Smooth. I love this stuff.
Bottle at home, 6th June 15. Black, aroma is expresso, light liquorice and bourbon. Taste is coffee, bourbon, liquorice, molasses. Quite good, but over rated

A good beer not a great beer the hype is not ringing true. But just in case Ill try another at a later date to vett out my 1st tasting response. Example of beers I enjoyed more Parabola, Big Bad Baptist,and Sunday Morning Stout.

Bottle at home. Pours a deep black/brown with a reddy edge. Toasty, light grass, choc, vanilla, smoke, ash coffee, booze... Sweet aroma. Medium to full body, medium carbonation. Treacle, booze, choc, espresso, wood, liquorice... All that you;d expect but the abv balance is off. Its a little boozy and unbalanced. But lots of tastiness too.

Bottle from Beer Gonzo. Which is a first - Im excited just to see this beer in the UK! So excited that Ive driven back extra quickly from work to make sure I get one. Feel like Indiana Jones trying to beat his opponents on the trail of an ancient relic. And just in time - got one of the last four bottles left in the shop. Anyway...very dark of course, with a caramel coloured head and nice bit of lacing. Its thick and has an oily texture - smooth not gloopy - low carb but the alcohol keeps it lively in the mouth. On the nose I get bourbon, port, rum and coke. Flavour starts with very dark chocolate. Coffee of course, and the vanilla adds a bit of balance. Dried fruit. End result is a powerful beer but with finesse - just when you think it is going to rough you up it gives you a nice kiss instead.
Bottle at home. Pours black, nose is huge bourbon, coconut, vanilla, toffee, chocolate, taste is similar, chewy, dry, boozy.

Bottle 355ml vintage 2015 @ home
Pours black with a tan head. Aroma has notes of roasted malt, cocoa, chocolate, oak, vanilla and lots of coffee. Taste is medium to heavy sweet and medium bitter with a long warm, roasted, coffee, dark chocolate, cocoa, vanilla and oak finish. Body is full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. If I could get my hands on this beer on a regular basis I would be a happy but poor man. Superb barrel aged imp. stout that to me is close to perfection.

Bottle at 5p. Black color, brown head. Bitter taste with chocolate, nuts, vanilla, bourbon, hops, oak and roasted malts. Bitter finish with roasted malts, nuts, vanilla, oak, bourbon and a bit of chocolate. Exquisite imperial stout.

Sample from bottle @ KØ15. Pours black, with a creamy mocha head. Aroma is dark roasted malts, with coffee, burned wood, vanilla, dark fruits and lactose. Medium to full body, with soft carbonation. Quite intense and sharp flavour with bitter roasted malts, lots of coffee, spicy liquorice and bourbon, as well as herbs, camphor, and muscovado.

Bottle from The Beerhive. Black body with a tan head. Nice lacing. Rich aroma of cherry, dark chocolate, maple syrup and liquorice. Flavour of oak chips, hazelnut, coffee and vanilla. The barrel aging adds a subtle whisky note - not too overwhelming. Medium body with a smooth, creamy mouthfeel. Light fizz. A rich, full flavoured beer that hides the ABV well. It took me a while to finish the full bottle though as the sweet flavours became slightly cloying.

29-MAY-2015, bottle @DØE Ølfestival.
Black with lasting Brown head.
Bourbon, chocolate, coffee, cocoa powder. Sweet, full body, medium carbanation. Really smooth and fantastic. What makes this one stick out is not that it is bigger just that it is better on all parameters:-)
Black rimming brown head; aroma is coffee wood malt alcohol; Flava is rich woody spice sweet malt chocolate notes of alcohol; feels thick creamy some foamy fuzz tingle; finishes roasty tangy

UPDATED: FEB 27, 2017 Shared bottle at Cardinal, Stavanger. Pours black with beige head. Aroma of coffee, pepper, vanilla, dark chocolate. Tastes sweet with some roasted bitterness. Smooth mouthfeel, alcoholic and peppery warmth.

What an awesome brew, had a bottle yesterday at a local bar. Lots of caramel, toffee, vanilla, bourbon, coffee. Also some chocolate and roasted flavours. Very balanced. Lots of sweetness, medium bitterness. I was in a hurry so I had to chug like 50% of the beer which was too bad.
