Black with a small tan head. Big aroma of chocolate and licorice with a little coffee, dried fruit and oak. Sweet and thick roasted flavour with chocolate and coffee, oak and plenty vanilla.
Bottle at cbf 15. Black color, small brown head. Aroma has strong roastt, hint of whiskey, coffee. Strong taste, bourbon, alcoholic notes, coffee and some hops at the end.

Bottle from archer road beer stop, sheffield. Black with tan head. Aroma is smoky chocolate coffee brandy. Taste is sweet and smoky and bitter. Thick and oily with alcohol hum and tingly carbonation. Amazing beer.

UPDATED: JAN 31, 2016 May 2015 - 355ml bottle at home. I thought Id have to go to America to try this top 50 beer, and then it pops up all across London cheaper than half the imperial stouts on the shelves. Bottled Feb 2015 at 11.2%. Black, decent foamy brown head endures, leaves some sparse light lacing. Aroma is coffee, sandalwood, biscuity coconut. Great aroma. Body is medium, smooth, low carbonation. Taste is woody and dry with chocolate and toasted coconut, just a touch of the 11.2% showing up, salty finish. Very good imperial stout. (4.1)
Jan 2016 - Another 2015 bottle.  Aroma is now very chocolatey, some coconut and bourbon.  Body is rounded.  Taste is chocolate, bourbon, spicy, woody, light coffee, some perfume.  Has rounded out with a bit of time.  Great. (4.2)

UPDATED: MAY 9, 2016 Bottle 2015 BATCH. Dark brown colour with brown head. 
Aroma is heavily bourbon. Then comes coffee, chocolate and malt. 
Taste continues same, bourbon, chocolate, coffee, vanilla,malt, hops and hint of alcohol. 
Very smooth and rich mouth feel with soft carbonation. 
Long, bit alcoholic, bitter and dry but smooth finish, with coffee and vanilla. 
Heavy on bourbon and bit boozy, good IS but not quite the bomb I was expecting.
Bottle.at Ølbaren Elmegade.Pitch black colour with small beige head.Aroma of vanilla and bourbon,nice warming mouth feels and good full body nice taste of chocolate and even coffee nots.
Black, small light brown lacing foam. Light coffee aroma. Light bitter coffee taste, vanilla tones. Smooth, velvet drink. (Dallas 201505)

Pours pitch black with a small beige head. Strong coffee aroma with some notes of chocolate, bourbon and roasted malt. Full body. Flavor has notes of coffee, chocolate, some vanilla. Moderate bitterness.

Fantastic spelled with a capital WOW. Huge, multilayered aroma with bourbon, vanilla, chocolate and coffee distinctly smellable. Thick and chewy. If KBS is rolled over the tongue enough, count on your tongue getting just a wee numb. Sweet finish but not as sweet as other imperial stouts. High ABV is definitely there to the point of this is a one-and-done-drinking beer if youre driving the spouse home. Simply superior. Enjoyed on tap at MKEs Landmark 1850 Inn.

Founders KBS has a thin, tan head, a super-dark brown appearance, some bubble streams, and noticeable tan chunks roiling about. Lacing is minimal. The aroma is of a strong bourbon smell, with background dark-roasted malts. Taste is of the same, with vanilla, chocolate powder, dark coffee, bitterness (not so high), and sweetness. Mouthfeel is mostly heavy, with a velvety aspect coming into play, and Founders KBS finishes somewhat powdery and fairly drinkable for such a strong beer. RJT
Sample @ En Öl & Whiskymässa, Gothenburg 25/4-15. Roasted malty with coffee and chocolate. Warming alcohol in the finish.

Strong bourbon notes on the aroma with notes of oak. Appearance is a very dark brown with a good sized tan head. Flavor has notes of chocolate, bourbon, oak and notes of coffee. Mouthfeel is full bodied with medium carbonation. Overall, this is a great beer. It definitely lived up to the hype. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Archer Road Beer Stop, Sheffield. Clear, very dark, chestnut brown. Film, and halo of beige head. Its leggy, viscous, and in slow motion. Theres vanilla. Rum truffle. Chocolate caramel. A bit woody. Very rich. Taste is light sweet. Fruity dry. Palate is full, smooth, and unctuous. The coffee kicks in stealthily late. Finishes light bitter, and long, chewy, unctuously sweet. Never feels the ABV. Beautiful.
Thanks to Torben:nice Vanilla and light alcoholic aroma,black, brown foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, nice harmonic finish.

UPDATED: MAY 16, 2015 Yep this is good. Dark black. Subtle coffee. Vanilla and oak. Chocolate. Incredibly balanced.  No idea how to improve this other than copious amounts of vanilla.  Tasted at cuginos with Carter.

UPDATED: MAY 22, 2015 Great beer, Henrik, top 5.0. Just one bottle...I think. Dark black, light brown head, lasting. Heavy malty, roasted aroma, vanilla, notes of coffee. Notes of whisky and barrels, alcohol. Flavor starts roasted sweet, warming alcohol, faint smoke from the whisky. Creamy, syrupy texture.
black, clear, coffee, chocolate, full body, creamy, soft carbonation, heavy cloying sweetness, medium bitterness,
Bottle @ En Öl och Whisky Mässa. Very dark brown with a small brown head. Malty and rosted tones. Malt, coffee, vanilla, oak and hops. Full body with a lomg, bitter sweet finish.

355ml bottle. Dark brown/black with short tan head. Aroma is dark malty, charred wood, rich coffee notes. Dark chocolate and coffee taste. Plenty of coffee bitterness in effect to counter the sweetness. Bold, powerful and flavourful, but drinks pretty easily. Very good.

Poured a dark brown to opaque black with a toffee head. Aroma is coffee, toffee, chocolate, and roasted malts with a hint of alcohol. Flavor is coffee upfront followed by chocolate and dark fruits. Somewhat bittersweet. Medium to full bodied with a sweet chewy mouthfeel. Every bit worth the 2 month wait to get this beauty.

UPDATED: JUN 18, 2015 .3l bottle @ Harry?s. Pours black with tan head. Aroma is milk coffee, bourbon, dark malts, oak, chocolate and dark fruits. Flavor is bourbon, chocolate, coffee, milk chocolate, dark fruits, dark malts, syrup, bread, bourbon, alcohol nicely. Swell and smooth!

Pretty nice clean oaky aroma, sort of qualite-red-winey. Dark roast, dark chocolate, debitterd coffee too, but predominately oaky. Full bodied, soft smooth. Chocolate sweetness, vanilla cappuccino, nice balance. Creamy texture, pretty easy for the abv. Excellent ris. Bittersweet, soft. Heavy oak, but thats fine with me.-- bb

355ml bottle, William K, Kurvi. Bottled on 2/12/2015. Poured black with a thin but lasting brown head. Bourbon aroma, oak, vanilla, dark chocolate notes. Flavor has sweetness, coffee, chocolate notes, lots of vanilla, oak. Alcohol nicely hidden. Perhaps not as good as I had hoped this to be. Nonetheless, worth a try, a pleasant sipper.

Bottle at tasting. Black pour, no head. Aroma of coffee, cacao and boozy vanilla. Taste of gritty coffee, vanilla, dark cacao, stingy boozy bourbon and a mild chili. I was afraid the hype was just too big, but its actually a really good beer.

Founders KBS is a complex beer that satisfies every level of taste that we have. 
It's rich aroma, prepares you for its chocolate and coffee mouth feel. Long lasting finish is pleasant. 
Great all round beer but not one for the novice.

12 oz bottle. Pours deep black with a very small tan head. Aroma hits you with big notes of chocolate, bourbon and coffee. Very nice thick, but not too thick mouthfeel. Taste of slight bourbon notes of roasted malts, chocolate and coffee. Overall one of the best beers I have ever had!

UPDATED: SEP 8, 2015 2015
Bottled 02/17/2015
Gorgeous medium tan glossy head on top of a deep silky black body. Well integrated light earth, coffee and black chocolate on the nose. Similar on the palate but with an outrageously beautiful knitted complex body supported by such length and the thin &supple but effortless structure. Truly a beer of wonder living up to all the hype you will ever here.

335 ml bottle @ Konttori
Dark brown, almost black beer with beige head. Aroma has milk chocolate. vanilla, coffee and roasted malts. Flavor adds some bitterness. Palate is quite full with quite strong bitterness. Finish has quite mild bitterness with some alcohol. Aftertaste has milk, vanilla, coffee and wood. Its too sweet for me, like drinking a white russian with some coffee added.
Bottle 35,5cl @ Kultainen Apina. Pours black with a beige creamy head. Rich, creamy, coffee, dark chocolate aroma, some alcohol. Rich creamy coffee, cocoa, dark malts alcohol flavor. Very nice.

Bottle 12oz at William K. Kurvi, Helsinki. Bottled 02/12/2015. Colour is black with very small brownish head. Aromas and flavours: Coffee, chocolate, hints of licorice and roasted malts. Very nice drinkability and superb fresh finish.

12 oz pour from room-temperature bottle into Spiegelau stout glass. Inky black and totally opaque. Moderate pour produced a fluffy brown one-finger head that faded at a moderate taste and left considerable lacing. Very full bodied and creamy. Nose is sweet. Caramel and chocolate, malt and bourbon. Taste has many layers. Starts out with a chocolate sweetness, then some coffee bitterness, a bit of maltiness, and finally a whisky/bourbon kick on the end, just short of burning. It sits on the tongue for a while, in a very pleasant way. On the whole, the alcohol is vet well hidden. Amazing beer. I cant wait to drink more.

Poured obsidian in an IPA glass with thin, dense head that persists.

Aroma thickly vanilla bean and strong coffee, with roasted caramels and abundant chocolate.

Light body and plenty of flavor surprise, starting with chocolate malts and migrating into rich bourbon. This is more than a bourbon flavored stout, it's more or less halfway between a bourbon and a stout.

Lingers with both alcohol burn and vanilla, which is a pleasant way to go. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Phenomenal. Aromas and flavors of coffee, vanilla, roasted malt and, of course, bourbon. The last becomes more pronounced as it warms. Soft and dark with a tan head and soft, creamy and viscous.

355ml bottle enjoyed @ home. Pours pitch black with a thick tan head that leaves a lot of lacing. Aroma is coffee, chocolate, caramel, liquorice root, wood, marzipan, alcohol and some vanilla. Flavour is medium sweet and light bitterness. Full bodied, thick and oily texture, soft carbonation. Finish is coffee, earthiness and slightly bitter.

Pours pitch black with a one finger tan head with excellent lacing. Aroma is of roasted malts, bourbon, dark coco, vanilla, molasses, woody notes, coffee, and licorice. Taste is bourbon, coffee, dark and milk chocolate, vanilla, roasted malts, burnt wood, butterscotch, anise, licorice, dark fruits, caramel, and just a little booze in the finish. Has a medium-full body with a super creamy, oily mouthfeel and a semi bitter, warming, slightly hot,.long finish. Overall, a amazing, world class stout that hides its high abv very well and has some amazing bourbon, coffee, and, and vanilla notes.
Wow great beer. Pours black with a tan head. Aroma of chocolate, vanilla, and bourbon. Flavor starts with coffee but moves to chocolate, vanilla, and bourbon.

12oz bottle poured into snifter. Pours jet black with dark thick head that dissipates quickly. Aroma of coffee with hints of sweet chocolate and alcohol. Coffee forward flavor with some bitterness followed by slight bourbon notes and alcohol. More coffee forward thanI expected but overall a very solid beer.

12 oz bottle into a tulip glass. Pours black, with a small tan head that rapidly fades. Nose is coffee and dark roast malt. Taste is dark roast malt, espresso coffee, and bourbon on the finish. Very, very good. One of the best American beers I have had. Outstanding.

Bottle, 2015 release. Pours thick black with a medium sized creamy light brown head. Earthy coffee, chocolate and light bourbon in the nose. Smells great. Flavour has lots of bourbon; vanilla, coconut and white chocolate, cocoa, oak, warming alcohol, salty liquorice, rum soaked raisins. Full body, oily texture, soft carbonation, heavy sweet with balanced bitterness. Long finish with lingering bourbon. Good stuff, but also punchy, would like to try an older edition to see if it settles down.

Bottle enjoyed at Cafe Sara
Pours dark, black in glass with a big brown head. Smell of dark dark malts, roast coffee, vanilla cocoa and hints of oak. Heavy heavy sweet, dark malts, chocolate, vanilla, a touch of bourbon and oak. Moderate bitter finish, coffee tail. A bit too sweet for my taste. The flavors are good balanced off.

UPDATED: DEC 9, 2015 (Update:  10 months old bottle) The overwhelming woodiness had disappeared. Now, the beer tasted of chocolate, cocoa beans, vanilla, softly burnt malts and finished dry and bitter. Way better than the young one.

(Bottle, 0.355 l - 2015 vintage - bottled on 02/12/2015, at Viisi Penniä, 20150502) The beer poured black. Its head was medium sized and lightly brown. Aroma had vanilla, chocolate, coffee, cocoa and burnt malts. Palate was full bodied and dryish with medium carbonation. Flavours were vanilla, dark chocolate, sweetness, cocoa, coffee, wood and bitterness. Aftertaste had wood, vanilla, burnt malts and bitterness. Not really my kind of brew: too heavy vanilla, too much booze and too sweet. Still not bad though. Old rating: 8-4-6-3-12
Possibly the nicest beer Ive ever drank. It is dark, rich, has a strong bourbon taste and an aftertaste like an Irish coffee.
Dark black with tan lacing. Aroma is bourbon. Taste is coffee followed by the bourbon back. If youre not a fan of bourbon probably not your beer.
Sample @ En Öl & Whiskymässa 150425. Roasted malty, dark chocolate, vanilla and bourbon, some light alcoholic notes, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is dry and roasted with chocolate.

Are you kidding me. I wanted this to be overrated for some reason, but it was so damn good. Coffee, chocolate, vanilla. Very smooth, SO much depth. I wanted another one immediately after finishing the first. Excellent, excellent, excellent

Je suis un peu sans mots. Jai rarement bu quelque chose daussi smooth et sweet. Cest à la fois lourd et léger comme lair. Cest à la fois sucré, mais dune buvabilité déconcertante. Ça descend comme une crème glacé. Léquilibre entre le café et le chocolat est sublime. Jen avais entendu beaucoup de bien, mais jai longtemps «snobé» cette bière en croyant quelle était surfaite. Jai eu tort. Jai tellement eu tort! Je suis un abruti... et quon me serve un autre verre de ce truc divin!

Bottle from Brandons liquor Peachtree City $6.99 - 1 bottle limit. Taste of real, delicious bitter/sweet chocolate, coffee, vanilla with a hint of bourbon. As it warmes I get more bourbon. Now I see what all the hype is ! Fuckin amazing.
-2015, short review- black with smooth head. Loads and of bourbon and spicy alcohol. Some roasted malt, chocolate and coffee. Overall: one dimensional
We did a comparo, 2014 vs 2015. Both are wonderful. 2014 perhaps a bit smoother, probably because of the age. Easily one of the best stouts Ive had. And I have had many.

Sample at En Öl- & Whiskymässa, Gothenburg, 2015, april. Jet black, small tan head, leaving a ring on the surface. Deep aroma of coffee, vanilla, roasted malt, slight bourbon. Taste is moderately sweet with a bitter, roasted coffee flavour, slight vanilla, minor bourbon. Body is medium to big, low alcohol, sticky texture. Served slightly too cold, still, a rather ordinary impression, I find that the palate could be better, more creamy. Anyways, a good brew.
2015 was a huge let down i felt there no body it more light then heavy and all chocolate and coffee no bourbon at all which what i look for and love huge let down this year

this rating is only for this years kbs. ive enjoyed it thoroughly in the past. this year it tasted awful. tons of fusal alcohol cloaked with aspartame and fake coffee flavor. really gross. drain pour.

Bottle, shared with Parksy. This isnt the first time Ive had this, so Im surprised to learn that I hadnt rated it. Full bodied with nice hard roast character, leaning more toward coffee with some underlying chocolate, vanilla sweetness offsets the bitterness. The barrel is very subtle here, and the beer benefits from that fact. Superbly balanced and enjoyable. Worthy of the hype.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Flaske> Brunsort klar oel med et fint skumhoved. Lidt tynd taget de hoeje procenter i betragtning. God duft af bourbon og godt integreret smag. Fin oel men ikke wauw paa nogen maade.

12 oz bottle poured into snifter, black hue with creamy to frothy dark tan head, no lacing, smelled more initially like coffee, then to chocolate and vanilla, started at 64 degrees, very well balanced, smooth texture, oak more prevalent as it sat, sticky marshmallow holding vanilla over top of the chocolate, oak vanilla and bourbon, very nice, life up to the hype for the most part, balance and texture were the main characteristics that stood out
so good. of course I taste coffee. KBS smells so good. I totally love his beer.
Thick black with 3 inch brown head. Roasted malt and coffee aromas with a soft bourbon note. Creamy mouthfeel, coffee and bourbon are balanced. Very good but not the best.

Pours black with a thick creamy tan head that sticks around. Aroma is coffee, molasses, rich roasted malts & nuances of chocolate. Taste is all of the above perfectly blended. Coffee first, slightly bitter malts in the mid, followed by sweet chocolate for the finish. A sweet smooth ride all the way through. A true American experience. Masterful.
pours jet black with some head. always solid in all all categories, and always delightful. This beer is well balanced.

On tap at MacGregors. Great aroma, booze, coffee, chocolate just to name a few. Deep dark pour with a thin tan head. Taste is chocolate, oak, coffee, booze and slight vanilla. Palate is thick, very thick. The booze really stands out here. From the 1st sip cold. I let it sit 45 minutes. Last sip warm, still boozy. A real sipper.

12 oz bottle. Tasted on 4/23/15. Bottle from Byron's Liquor. Aroma was great with chocolate, coffee & a slight bourbon. Taste is so smooth with a similar taste to aroma. Fantastic beer!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Blackish beer with a small brownish head. Bourbon and chocolate aroma Coffee and bourbon flavor with chocolate and light toffee. Medium-plus bodied. Bourbon and vanilla lingers with chocolate, caramel, light oak, and light coffee.
Smell is sweet malt and bourbon. Taste is malt, bitter chocolate, mild bourbon, and a bit of alcohol. The alcohol note is stronger if its cold, but pretty mild when warm.  Thick creamy mouthfeel.

UPDATED: APR 17, 2016 Pours a deep black with brown head that lasts forever and leaves great lacing. Aroma is dark chocolate (dry, with cocoa), sweet red wine, mild coffee, earth, wood, smoke, alcohol - superb blending of all of these elements. Taste starts with bourbon, very sweet - then into a smoked woody chocolate in the middle, drying slightly. Booze and cocoa powder travels to the nose, and finally it finishes oily and sticky (and thin) with some coffee coming out alongside the cocoa. Aroma is very solid, but taste has all the right elements with sharp corners. Hopefully age will smooth those out, but I worry it?s too rough up front and thin in the end. Not as good as I thought. Iv?e had several imperial stouts better than this that are easier to find and the same price or less.   Update: bottle aged 13 months.  Flavors are mellowed and dulled, more ashy and smokey.  Not my favorite, so sue me.

Draft pour. Wow. Pitch black with a gently foaming dark tan head. Huge legs on this one. Aroma is dark chocolate, bourbon, oak. Taste is chocolate, chocolate malt, vanilla, strong coffee, more oak, bourbon. A little raisin, cherry skin. Some earthy notes. Finishes fairly dry, with a little alcohol burn. Mouthfeel is full and lush, carbonation is balanced. Excellent.

So happy to find this beer!!! Bought at a natural food bodega in Fort Greene in Brooklyn (On Fulton St.) It was $7 a bottle. Some of the best $7 Ive ever spent!!!! Pours a rich frothy black, with a tan head that dissipates fast and leaves some great clingy lacing on my snifter glass. I let this one warm up a long time before taking my first sip. During that time I smelled coffee, dark chocolate, malt, port/sherry, earthy and woody notes, and some smoke and slight vanilla too. First taste is a huge explosion of differing sensations- vanilla sweetness, bitter coffee and chocolate like tastes, some very subtle earthy malt in there too. As it warmed the aroma really got strong- toffee, leather, licorice coming out. The mouthfeel is perfect- the co2 levels are perfectly balanced in this beer. Its a full bodied beer, creamy texture in the mouth almost velvety. I described it to a friends as drinking a "cloud of beer" The finish is long and delicious. This beer, along with a few other stouts and some Barley wines is one of the ultimate "nightcap" beers, perfect for after a big complex dinner or a night of drinking lots of different good beer.

Pours a dark black color with a small tan head. Aroma is sweet coffee, dark cherries, and lots of vanilla. The taste is initially light coffee followed by oak, vanilla, sweet roasted malts, licorice, and dark chocolate. Overall a really solid stout.
UPDATED: NOV 25, 2016 Rich black color. Deep flavor. Slight bitter and heavy bourbon. A little after taste that is off for the type. Tap.

355ml bottle from Whole Foods - Tribeca, New York. Thanks Jesse! Bottled 03/14/2014.


Night black stuff with a beautiful dark brown head. Aroma of bourbon, alcohol, wood. Flavour of strong coffee, bourbon, dark chocolate. Long  palate. Yeah, its gooooood!

bottle. Pours jet black with a small brown head. Strong notes of chocolate along with some coffee and vanilla. Flavor is mostly chocolate with vanilla with some bourbon notes; rounded out with some coffee in the finish. Full bodied and very smooth on the palate. Excellent.
9oz draught. Pours jet black. Aroma of Chocolate, cocoa, earth, wood. Flavor of licorice, cocoa, chocolate, molasses, earth, wood, vanilla, booze. while it is good, it is slightly overrated.

On tap at the Big Texas Beer Fest. Oh my God, where to start...Poured an opaque dark brown near black with a decent khaki head. Highly complex taste of bourbon, oak, roasted dark malts, burnt malts, vanilla esters, and dark fruit all coexisting in perfect harmony. Medium to high fizzy carbonation, thick oily body. Simply put, this is the by far the best beer Ive ever had.

Poured a dark brown almost black with great lacing. Aromatics of vanilla caramel, brown sugar, dark chocolate and oak. Entry is medium viscosity with a nice chocolate note with the subtlest hint of coconut and Mexican cinnamon. There are also some cognac like fruit notes with vanilla and caramel in the mid palate as some bitterness from the cocoa nibs and oak accent the finish (the oak tannins add a touch of dryness). ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark pour with a tan head that closes quickly. Aroma of coffee, bourbon and chocolate. Flavor is outstanding ....coffee bourbon with a vanilla finish. So many different layers on this beer. This is one on my all times favorites! Close to perfection.

UPDATED: APR 21, 2016 Bottle poured into a snifter..jet black with a thin light brown head..aroma of bourbon,coffee,vanilla,oak,nuts..boozy,coffee, chocolate flavor..very good but not the be all end all of barrel aged stouts..2016 version better than 2015.

Room temp into a wine glass. Smells of coffee and bourbon, maybe chocolate? Looks perfect, jet black with no light even on the very edge, dark tan head. Same taste as aroma, only knock I can find is the burn is a bit strong. Thick and lush mouthfeel, would give 4.5 if I could, almost ideal.

Thanks to Dave for sharing this rare find with me.Appearance: dark black, medium off white head, impressive lacing as it fades.Aroma is chocolate and whiskey, nicely blended.Taste is coffee first, whiskey later. Smooth and sweet. As close to perfect as I can imagine at this point in my cabeer (beer career.)Feel is smooth, not as lively as some.A gem of a brew.Tasting side by side with the regular Founders Breakfast Stout and it is superior, which says a lot.

Appearance- black with a small Brown head
Aroma- big espresso coffee, bourbon, chocolate, vanilla.
Flavor- big coffee flavor, chocolate, some dark fruit, sweet caramel sweetness.
This is a big, boozy, slap you in the face stout. The breakfast stouts more in my wheelhouse but this is an experience. Big bourbon, coffee, light chocolate.

Tap at the owl farm. Black pour. Was served a bit chilled. Vanilla, coffee, oak. Medium to full body. Nice light but refreshing carbonation. Bitterness, Acodity and sweetness hiding alcohol well. Nice but I like CBS a bit more

Look: pours dark like coffee. Dark brown head.
Smell: chocolate. Roasted malt. Bitter coffee. 
Taste:

UPDATED: MAR 18, 2017 Fresh 2017 bottle from lcbo. Big coffee forward beer. Bourbon is there, some dark chocolate boozy but not overwhelming. So good!!

2014 Bottle at farmhouse. Pours jet black some head clumpy lacing. Nose is sweet syrup. Flavours of big espreso bourbon and lots of dark fruit. Taste big sweet big bitter. Big thck oily body with med carbonation.

12 oz into tulip. Black, very thin and short lasting tan head. Minimal lacing. Aromas of bourbon and chocolate shortly after pour fade to bourbon and malts. Taste is of roasted malts and is lightly bitter with strong notes of oak and nice notes of bourbon. Fairly sharp taste, far feom smooth.some hints of coffee and possibly a little dark chocolate. Light carbonarion. Sorta oily texture. Woody finish. This bottle was from a fresh 2015 batch, maybe a few fonths of cellaring would consition and mellow flavors out. Overall verry good barrel aged stout. Was excited to get my hands on a four pack. Do believe it is a bit oveehyped. $25 for a four pack is a bit steep but I would proably still buy again if given the opportunity. But I also believe plentt of otjer great barrel aged stouts are available till then. May let my other two bottle condition before tasting again.
Bottle. Deep brown with minimal head. Woody bourbon, molasses, charred wood, coffee and alcohol. Flavor is dryly sweet. Body is heavier with a smooth feel.

Thick oily black pour, small khaki pour. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, roasted malts and bourbon. Taste is chocolate, oatmeal, coffee, vanilla and bourbon. Very subtle alcohol burn on back end. Oily and thick mouthful. Very good. Cant wait to age and revisit.

Look - Lighter than oil, darker than coke. Nice dark cream head. Head film down the glass.

Smell  Whiskey and if anything else, vanilla. It is not overpowering.

Taste  Coffee on tongue, hit with the whiskey, mellows out to vanilla and classic stout finish. Tingle stays on the tongue but once again not overpowering.

Feel  Cream explodes in to large, heavy bubbles.

Overall  Is it worth the hype? No. Is it amazing? Yes. For a beginner BA drinker, this is the way to go. The dirty tobacco taste is almost completely lost from Breakfast Stout in the aging, but is there in the after taste. CBS is definitely better.

Bottle. Pitch black with a non-lasting coffee brown head. Loads of lacing around the glass. Coconut on the aroma, dark chocolate, coffee, some dark fruits. Taste is of chocolate, coffee, coconut, vanilla, hint of liquorice, bourbon on the finish, not overpowering at all. Texture is sticky, full bodied, medium carbonation. So smooth. Absolutely gorgeous.

UPDATED: APR 29, 2015  I find a lot of bourbon BA beers are either missing the bourbon experience or on the opposite side are overpowered by the flavor. Not KBS. The bourbon shines without masking the original beer. While I did find this enjoyable, I expected to be blown away with all the hype that surrounds this beer. From what I have heard, this was not the best batch they have released so maybe I picked the wrong year to get my first taste.

Bottled, 2015 vintage. Pours pitch black, small tan head, quickly dissipating leaving a single ring of lacing around the edge. Coffee, bourbon, vanilla all pour out of this. Chocolate and bit of toasted coconut as well. Its so balanced. The bourbon is not overdone, which sometimes happens. Incredible. Flavor is similar. A lot more bourbon there. Chocolate, coffee, and vanilla still very apparent. Theres some decent coffee bitterness in the finish. Its drinkable, for 11.2%, but theres heat to this.

2015 bottling consumed a couple of weeks after bottling. Good Lord this is good. Poured from the bottle into a snifter. The appearance is a thick black with a loose, medium khaki head that fades quickly. The aroma has vanilla and bourbon, but with a lot of sweetness. It reminds me of some candied dates in dark chocolate. I dont know that I can point to another beer with a more powerful and pleasing aroma. The first blast of taste is vanilla and bourbon, with the roasted chocolate and coffee notes coming next. A tad boozy, but it is 11.2%, so thats to be expected. The aftertaste lingers a long, long time, with bourbon dominating. Just a fantastic beer.

Aroma chocolate, coffee, roasty, woody, vanilla, alcohol, smoke, 
Appearance black, minimal head, brown foam, 
Taste bourbon, smooth, delicious
Palate full body, thick feel, creamy, long finish, 
Overall this is one of those beers that if you are lucky enough to get your hands on you will enjoy deeply. I would without a doubt suggest this beer to a friend
Pours dark with creamy tan/caramel coloured head that laces glass well. Aroma has chocolate, coffee. Taste is strong bitter.

12oz bottle ($6.00) poured to small snifter. Here it is the highly acclaimed KBS. Pours a rich dark chocolate, with beautiful clarity and and a thin inviting mocha head that quickly dissipated. The aroma earns high praise. Never overpowering in any one regard the bourbon barrel does come to the fore. Rich vanilla bean, booziness and dark roast coffee follow with a nice hint of floral/orange hop presence. There is also a nice smoky/woody underpinning that holds everything together. The taste is rich complex and well balanced, but you better like bourbon. Not overpowering yet bourbon is the star of the show. Lightly sweet and medium bitter the carbonation is soft and the finish is long and rewarding. The texture is slightly sticky but the beer is never overly heavy. It is definitely a sipper. Overall ...A huge yes please! This stout is substantial and fulfilling a tad bid boozy but a whale worth spearing. Im really liking how this opens up with time and the emerging coffee and semi-bitter chocolate notes. Overall quite good. I still prefer the Founders RIS. Its cheaper, more readily available (in season) and still impresses at the same level.

Bottle, thnx to several generous traders, rating #3000. 2011 vintage. Pours a pitch black beer with a small, brownish head on top. Aroma is very powerful exploding out of the bottle. Loads of bourbon, ashes, leather, coffee, dark chocolate, roasted malts, caramel and massive morning wood. Flavor is very sweet, boozy, malty. Again a bitter sweetness gained from the dark chocolate and caramel. A lot of sweet bourbon notes are represented big time in the palate. Aftertaste is long, sweet, mouthfeel is sticky, cloying and has light carbonation. Very nice stuff, defintely lives up to her top50 status!!
Had the 2015 on tap. A little disappointed, tasted a little bland for a RIS. Overall a very good beer, just not the whale I expected.
Of all the bourbon stouts, this one is the least "in your face" about it. Great color and head. Smooth. Disappointing the hoops you have to jump through to get it but worth the effort.

pours inky black with a foamy tan head and lots of lacing. aroma has notes of caramel, oak, butterscotch, crispy bacon, and soil. taste has notes of charred meat, oatmeal, bourbon, oak, bitter chocolate and anise. alcohol is very present throughout but mostly through the long finish. this beer does not seem to stop. outstanding.

2015 KBS bottle to snifter. Appearance: black pour, thin fluffy brown head that faded fast. Aroma: bourbon, vanilla, booze. Taste: Bourbon flavour dominated & vanilla aroma comes out after letting the beer breath. Overall: Flavourful boozy must try from Founders. Let it warm up slightly before serving.

2015 bottle to snifter. Jet black pour, thin fluffy, brown head, fades fast. Nose was all booze. The bourbon flavor dominated. Picked up some strong vanilla after sitting. Decent sipping, but had higher hopes. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottled 2/12/15, Refrigerated 5 hours, poured, rated aroma and taste, then let it sit for about 20 minutes to move towards room temp and open up a bit per the brewers instructions. Pours an oily black letting no light through with a good dark chocolate milk brown colored head. Aroma is huge oak, smoke, and vanilla, turning to chocolate and roasted coffee, oatmeal, and a slight boozy burn at the end. First taste straight from fridge is chocolate, smoke, coffee, oatmeal, tons of sweet vanilla, creamy, oatmeal, some dark fruit that are more bitter leading to a bitter finish and just a hint of booze burning for it being 11.2%, very good. After sitting for a while it warms into different notes, much stronger vanilla, a bourbon sweetness now has become very noticable, the chocolate sweetness to chocolate milk at oats are the grain of all that I pick out. The dark fruits disappear and are replaced by dark bitter chocolate, smooths out greatly and the booze/bourbon become more apparent. Awesome beer, definitely worth putting the effort forth to grab as many as allowed when it is released.

Bottle from mchughs. Pours deep black with tan head. Aroma is mellow bourbon, oak, chocolate, vanilla hints. Flavour is creamy bourbon, more vanilla, milky chocolate. The mouthfeel is so smooth and luscious. Bourbon sting on the finish. Dry earthy cream on the finish. Lives up to the hype. Fantastic.

Black as night slight ring of bubbles along the edge and no lacing to speak of. Smells of booze, chocolate, oak, bourbon, and more booze. Taste is sweet bourbon, chocolate notes, oak barrel and slight vanilla. Thick, creamy, coating on the palate with burn on the finish. One amazing stout indeed!

12oz into a tall flute. Pours a thick black sharpie midnight cant see anything but black, black. Nice shaded brown head, soft texture, seldom lacing, mellow and relaxed appearance. Aroma of a smoky backwoods of booze, coffee, rum, chocolate, more booze, bourbon, malty ambivalence. Taste of the same, all packaged and slapped in your face from a farmyard in Michigan. This packs a phat abv punch, prevalent throughout. A bit acidic and harsh after taste leaves me unsteady about the true glory of this, but its certainly not bad. Bottle from Mr. Dean. No born on date. A thick and gracious imp stout at a dire beginning of spring is certainly welcome.
Bottle ay home. Pours black with a medium brown head. Aroma is oak, coffee, chocolate, oatmeal. Taste is chocolate, coffee, and oak. its tastes like an oatmeal stout. Very good!

Vintage 2011. Lovely aromas of raisins, oak and some sweetness. The taste is really a mix between coffee, chocolate, oak, raisins and soy. Heavy bitterness that fills the mouth forever. Jeez what taste sensation. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.

12 oz bottle, thanks Clownoisseur! 2015 vintage (bottled only a little over a month ago). Aroma is chocolate milk, wood, bourbon, coconut, coffee, vanilla, dried dark fruit. Pours opaque black with a medium dark tan head that falls fairly quick into a ring of big-bubbly foam. Taste is sweet and fairly boozy--bourbon is pretty strong--finishing with above average bitterness for style; also some licorice/cough drop. Velvety and maybe a little watery mouthfeel. Medium to full body. Really good, but I was hoping for a little more from this considering its reputation.
Deep opaque black brown, light tan head. Molasses, vanilla, roasted grains. Earthiness. Lighter bitterness, very sweet. Long finish, heavy body. Long finish. Excellent.

Pours out deep black with a very small tan head. Aroma hits you with big notes of chocolate, bourbon and coffee. Very nice thick, but not too thick mouthfeel. Taste tells of bourbon, but is not over the top. Notes of roasted malts, chocolate and coffee add to the amazing cast of flavors in this beer.

2014 Bottle. Pours black with a minimal head; significant lacing left behind after a few sips. Aromas of rich chocolate and bourbon. Taste is lightly sweet, prominent alcohol, some chocolate.... I have to say that, to me, this really doesnt justify the hype.

Gets better and better with age! Sometimes you have to wait in life to fully appreciate the nectars of the gods. I have to admit this is a great tasting beer with an almost overpowering of bourbon when first released!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

5 oz pour from tap into a pint glass.

Appearance: Your standard stout - very dark brown verging on black, with a khaki head with decent retention.

Smell: Coffee, chocolate, and bourbon wafts out of the glass, with some vanilla that I primarily attribute to the bourbon.

Taste: Dark roasted malt meets some bitter chocolate and a heaping helping of coffee, much like a dark French roast. Beneath all of that, faintly, there were some vestiges of bourbon flavor - a shadow of vanilla, maybe a whisper of oak.

Mouthfeel: Full and rich, as one would want from a stout.

Overall: Had I heard no hype about this beer going in, Id have thought it was a solid beer, and would have rated it slightly below an ordinary, unbarreled Breakfast Stout. However, given the hype this beer receives, Im left with the question of why. Its solid, its good, and it has been matched and surpassed by many other stouts out there. If you can get it without serious effort or resources, its worth trying. Its assuredly not worth standing in line for.

On tap at Founders. Great aroma, booze, coffee, chocolate just to name a few. Deep dark pour with a thin tan head. Taste is chocolate, oak, coffee, booze and slight vanilla. A lot going on here. Palate is thick, very thick. A must try. If you are lucky enough.

Aroma should be an 11. Looks absolutely perfect as well. Tastes like vanilla, oak and bourbon. Other flavors too but those three are taking over. Would write more but I'm at founders taproom on KBS release day and it's crazy here. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours dark oil with brown. Caramelized head. Aromas of coffee, chocolate, and barrel. Sweet, chocolate goodness.
Very very good! This was aged a few years also so it was even better. A must try if you can find it!

[Bottle] 2012 vintage opened up last week. Jet black color with a half inch of light brown head. Aromas of milk chocolate, bourbon, vanilla and coffee grounds. Notes of bitter cocoa, oak barrel, ash, heavy roasted malts and a bit of cream in the taste. Lighter anise and earthy flavors as well. Rather subtle bourbon notes. Smooth and velvety mouthfeel. A really nice brew.
this may be blasphemy in my state but I think KBS is overrated. Dont get me wrong, its a good beer but I dont think it lives up to the hype.

Aroma: heavy milk chocolate, toasted malts, bourbon, coffee. Appearance: black, small, creamy, beige head. Taste: heavy sweet. Palate: sweets continue, intense chocolate, caramel, toffee, bourbon again, very heavy body. Overall: wonderful Imperial Stout, excellent complexity, nice bourbon flavours. Bottle at CBR2015, Shoreditch.

Bottle at Craft Beer Rising (London, 19 February 2015)

Pours dark black with a finger of coffee brown foam. 

The nose shows a lot of milk chocolate with heavy notes of bourbon, slight hints of peat, and a good round off with vanilla (more vanilla coke imo). 

The palate is very smooth and surprisingly light bodied (like most of their breakfast stouts). Slight alcohol bite in the middle, but dominant flavors of chocolate milk (most likely due to a moderate lactose sweetness and vanillin from the bourbon barrels), a very clean espresso finish & bitterness. A smoke background throughout the whole beer. All flavors are very balanced and somewhat delicate yet robust.

Sampled at tasting. Pours opaque black with beige head. Aroma is strong and a little sour, coffee - a lot of coffee, some chocolate, liqourice and leahter. Taste is like sipping a cold espresso, the coffee is so dominating it almost drowns all other tastes. Might have been a bad apple, but I expected a lot more...

Strong coffee nose with more chocolate on the finish. Very balanced. 



---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pouted from tap nice dark chocolate color and tan head. Aromas of coffee vanilla and chocolate. Taste is smooth with notes coffe and vanilla with a nice mouth feel with a hint of bourbon.
UPDATED: JUL 9, 2016 355ml bottle. Black body with a low head. Roasted flavors, vanilla, oak, alcohol, coffee, some ash & gun powder.

I have sought this beer as long as I have known that it existed, and on finding it, it did not disappoint. Poured from a bottle. Its deep black with a beige head. The aroma of coffee is strong, with bourbon notes and dark malts. The flavor is immense and satisfying - coffee with a perfect gentle sweetness. Ive had big stouts with fine reputations that are delicious and sweet, but become too much as the temperature rises after sipping a while. This one is perfect, all the way from start to finish, and is a beer that I could drink time and time again if only I could find it in my home state of Oregon. Many thanks to the Brick Store Pub in Decatur (Atlanta) for keeping an excellent selection of the finest bottles in the cellar. And many more thanks to the friends I shared this excellent beer with.

Can you truly say anything is wrong with this beer? Should be a perfect score. This new has been something Ive sought after for a very long time. Coffee is the taste as it warms. This brew is so smooth and tasty. This one is everything its said to be and more.

Bottle pour at home, thanks Andrew for sharing, this is a rear one to try over here. Black pour, strong espresso coffee aroma, sweet taste coffee, can taste the barrel age. This beer reminds me of coffee with breakfast in the morning. Great stuff.

12 oz bottle generously gifted by Chris. Much thanks! This is awesome. Pours jet black with a disappearing tan head. Smooth vanilla and bourbon aroma. Flavor is a very dense black coffee with a dark chocolate background. Coffee beans strong up front but smooths out. Vanilla and cocoa finish, with some oakiness. What an incredible treat this is. Awesome stuff.

UPDATED: FEB 2, 2016 aroma of whiskey.  taste is slightly boozy, not very sweet.  taste some bourbon and some oak.  finishes slighly sweet with a boozy bite.  not even close to bcs.  lowered my rating.

Excellent
So smooth, so dark, so mellow. So good.

The aroma is very much powered by burobon. The appearance is a brown dark enough to be almost black. The head is minimal (not it was aged in bottle over 9 months). The taste is sweet with strong, smooth burbon. The body is medium-full, with a almost creamy texture, soft carbonation (again, note bottle aging).
UPDATED: FEB 22, 2015 An incredibly well done stout, had 18months age on it. Enjoyed in DC with a friend, then again on tap.  Smooth, almost velvet mouthfeel. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12oz bottle into tulip. Minnepolis. Bottle aged 1 year (from 2014). 

Pours dark black with small brown head. Aroma is coffee, chocolate, bourbon, vanilla. Aroma has held up well, but bourbon flavor is more subdued. Taste is bitter upfront, then mellows into sweetness. Body is full, thick texture. Soft carbonation. Long finish. A nice barrel aged stout.

one of my favorite beers of all time. 

Rich, flavorful, complex, smooth and downright delicious

Pours black with a slight mocha head that recedes into a brown ring visible around the circumference of the glass. Aroma is mainly coffee with hints of bourbon. Taste is coffee, bourbon is noticeable but not overpowering and there is a large vanilla finish. Mouthfeel is quite viscous. Finish is lingering. Amazingly balanced, all the flavours and aromas mentioned are evident in even proportions.
Well this is what i call a well balanced and harmonious beer. Roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, wood, bourbon, vanilla and nice suble hoppy dry and bitter finish.

Bottle from a trade a while ago, 14. Pitch black pour which is slightly see through at the edges with some tan head. Nose has freshly ground coffee, milk chocolate and some vanilla fudge. Taste is super smooth with more coffee and chocolate, some light toffee and ash as well, fairly roasty bitter finish.

UPDATED: APR 17, 2017 For the 100th American beer rating I put on this site, it being Christmas anyway and the weather forecast spelling icy days and nights to come, I decided to treat myself to something special. This is Founders Breakfast Stout, a delightful stout I tasted some years ago, in a special luxury edition, i.e. matured on bourbon barrels in a cave for one year. Very curious to taste this, considering its impressive score on this website.  I serve it at near room temperature in an old-fashioned snifter glass used for brandy in the old days.  Pours an initially totally opaque ink black, yet warm chestnut brown on the edges, with thick consistency, under a moussy, very dense (consisting of minuscule bubbles almost invisible to the naked eye) and deep creamy brown head leaving firm lacing on the edge of the glass and remaining closed for a long time in spite of the high ABV; after a while, it does break open, but leaves a thin greyish veil over most of the beers surface. The aroma is rich, dense and beguiling in every way: the deep, dark chocolate sauce youll find on your dame blanche in any good restaurant, Belgian chocolates, high quality coffee beans or espresso, vanilla beans all over the place, bourbon, cognac, candied dates, cherries and oranges, roasted peanuts, mandarine liqueur, liquorice, oaky tannins, crème au beurre, overripe papaja, cinnamon, cloves, cured meat and leather.  Im in beer heaven. The taste is just as intense and impressive as the aroma: a densely packed bonbon of candied fruit flavours, sweet cherries, refined coffee, the finest fondant chocolate and an ever so subtle sourish hint just to take the pressure off a bit only constitute the first sip. Then, a profound maltiness unfolds, intensely chocolatey, nutty, deep and full, with a thick, viscous, fat mouthfeel; coffee and vanilla hints are dancing graciously on top of this. A tinge of alcohol appears in the back, pointed and refined, as in a good liqueur or cognac; it brings a truly enchanting warmth and makes the head light in instants. Citrus and peppery hop notes are here for balance - and balance is what this brew achieves to utter perfection. Woodiness, indeed some bourbon, a mouth-filling roasted coffee bitterness, black pepper-like yet gentle hop bitterness and most of all, an absolutely delicious chocolate sweetness remain after youve swallowed, warming the throat and leaving you flabbergastered. This kind of beers inspire me, this is why I became a beer fanatic. This is not beer, this is liquid gastronomy taken to the highest level, one could write pages of poetry about a beverage this perfect. A rare treat - and that is exactly how it should be. The best stout I ever tasted, at least to this point. Deep respect for the guys at Founders who crafted this!

Thick lacing but little head. Bourbon aroma. Strong alcohol with chocolate taste but aftertaste is cut with warm flavors of chocolate and coffee. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

First off, bottle is 8mos old. Pours motor oil black with brown/tan head. Aroma of bourbon, vanilla, dark chocolate, and stale coffee. I've had this on tap and coffee aroma was amazing! This bottle is old and shows in the coffee aroma. Taste is bourbon up front with coffee, vanilla, licorice and chocolate. Sweet but not cloying. Mouthfeel is amazing! Thick, silky, and smooth. Overall one of my favorites. Much better fresh but better than most on a bad day.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: DEC 29, 2015 Draught at BAJT cons 2014-12-08 Göteborg - Boy been waiting for this one for ever ;)
AR: floral vanilla, bourbon barrels, dark bitter chocolate, home brewed coffee with a dash of milk
AP: pitch black, stouty head
F: chocolate milk bar, coffee con latche, wee bubbly soft carbonation, medium + bitterness. caramel fudgy, hot chocolate warming feeling, finishes long lasting flavours of milk choclate infused with bourbon vanilla - Great Brew!
Almost the perfect beer. Balance, oak, aroma, bourbon........all just a shade below goose bcbs.
Found this beer this summer at Wold of beer in. Key west brought 3 home with me to share with friends good brew.

I actually waited in line for this beer just to get 2 12 oz bottles. I love bourbon barrel stouts and I am a big fan of breakfast stout. This one is amazing. Very smooth. Just enough bourbon taste. Wish I could get more. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

355ml bottle at home. Black color with nice creamy frothy brown head. Aroma is roasted malty, lot of coffee, chocolate, vanilla, light dark fruit notes, wood - bourbon whiskey alcoholic. Taste is sweet and bitter, roasted again, more chocolate than the aroma, sweet and milk chocolate, dark bitter chocolate, vanilla, coffee, wood, bourbon. Medium to full silky creamy body with soft carbonation and bitter chocolate alcoholic finish. One bottle is not enough!
Wonderful beer but was a little light on body. Deep dark with creamy tan head out of the bottle. All the notes are there. Coffee chocolate roast grains bourbon and deep oak notes

Bottles from Greg, thank you very much! 

Pours an oily, almost complete black color, with nearly no head.

The nose is defined by creamy chocolate aromas, with loads of bitter ground coffee, accompanied by a wooden bourbon note, very well integrated into the body of the beer.

Begins with toffeish malts and a pungent bourbon bite , followed by a gentle wooden note and a supportive coffee infusion, accompanied by smooth, creamy milk chocolate. Vanilla provides a delicate peak to the foundation of the beer, which gets perfectly along with the sweeter, toffeish part of the brew, while also calming the alcohol burn. The coffee falls off soon, as we paired the 14 version next to the 12, developing in a very pleasant way above the sweeter notes, followed by a hint of Bourbon. The older version, while missing the coffee, blends the different flavor directions more carefully, adding many layers, which are related to each other to the taste, also the Bourbon is more recognizable. Finishes with wooden, sweeter malts, still extremely smooth on the palate, while the recent version adds a slick, well integrated coffee bitterness, among a sharp boozy echo.

12oz bottle poured into red solo cup for the short-notice share with Justin and Morgan in FL. Black body with a thin brown head that fades to a wisp and ring. Aroma is as advertised, coffee, chocolate, vanilla, coconut and char from the barrel, solid roast malts. Flavor is excellent as well - sweet coffee and cocoa, moderate coffee and roasty bitterness. Medium-plus body, creamy, thick texture, soft carbonation, boozy bitterness on the finish.

UPDATED: DEC 7, 2014 Draft at The Answer This was offered when one of the taps went dry. This is an amazing stout. The stout pours an opaque black with a tan head and lacing down the glass. The aroma was of licorice and bourbon. This is a very balanced medium body stout with soft carbonation. Expertly hidden alcohol with bourbon and roasted malts in the background. Soothing alcohol warmth with hints of coffee conclude each impressive swallow. This is a stout to seek out.

Amazing example of barrel aging. Bottle Im drinking is from 2013 so has had almost an extra two years in the bottle. Great aroma of coffee and molasses with a hint of smoke all neatly packaged into oak. Jet black pour with negligible tan head. Smooth as smooth can be with deep roasted coffee providing flavor and bitter. Slight sweet black tar molasses with wood and smoke dancing around it. Can definitely see why this is so sought after.

After years of looking for this beer and keeping missing it on various places I got to taste it. Pitch black colour with a mediumsized beigeish brown head. Aroma is liquorice, some alcohol, mild roasted malts along with coffee and some slight vanilla as well. Flavour is very similar in a very nice balance. Thick. Big. Yet so nicely balanced.

Bottle shared at Darkness day. Pours dark brown almost black. Smells of roasted malts chocolate with slight bourbon. Taste the same with some sweet toffee and caramel notes. Very smooth. Awesome beer.

Draft at the Dutch with a lunch of chilli over rice. Yum. The only slight I can state is that I wish the nose was stronger an a bit lustier. Rich and sultry body with just the right head. Sticky fingers of lacing return to the black liquid base as if it never wished to be apart.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Beer Market Jaffa. Thanks Tom L. Pours opaque black with a beige to brown head, aroma of chocolate, Chipotle, spices, caramel, brandy, whiskey, vanilla, roasted, flavor of chocolate, coffee, spices, brandy, whiskey, great roasted tones, full bodied, amazing.

UPDATED: DEC 16, 2014 330ml bottle served in a snifter glass.
A: Pours a deep opaque oily black color forming a small but creamy beige head with medium retention that leaves some spotty and molasses lacings in the glass
S: The smell is just perfect. Sweet and molasses. Delicious roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, bourbon and oak. The smell of oak is absolutely delicious. Ive gave 5, but I would give it 10 if I could! :p
T: Sweet and roasted upfront. Strong notes of roasted malts, candy sugar, caramel, bourbon, oak, vanilla, chocolate and coffee. Strong and delicious roast bitterness in the end. Alcohol is well hidden
M: Heavy, dense, creamy and molasses body. Medium to low carbonation. Complex sweet and roasted aftertaste
O: Excellent drinkability. Masterpiece
[ BA Review @ 9/20/2013 ]

On tap at Rattle N Hum, New York, NY. A dark brown/black coloured pour with a thin beige head on top. Sweet, malty, coffee, chocolate aroma. Tastes similar, slightly sweet, malty, coffee, chocolate, vanilla, rich, smooth and utterly delicious. Great Imperial stout from Founders, so glad to find it on tap in New York City.

Sampled at the Extreme Beer Fest. Pours a pitch black color. Great aroma of roasted malt, chocolate and coffee with a bourbon feeling. Great flavor of roasted and biscuity malt, coffee and chocolate, theres also a bourbon feeling. Full body, liquorous texture. I cant say I like it better than regular breakfast stout but it is as good, which is very good.

Sample at SBWF 2014. 

Black with a medium tan head. Aroma of chocolate, vanilla, some bourbon, coffee and light dark fruit. Taste of chocolate, bourbon, vanilla, coffee and some light dark fruit. Really smooth and nicely drinkable. Very well balanced, what a great beer! Well worth the hype. I am glad that I finally got the chance to try this one.
Sample at SBWF 2014. Malty smell with chocolate and coffee. Sweet malty taste with coffee and chocolate. Very nice and well made. Well balaned. Great beer.
Strong coffee malt aroma. Pours black with dark brown head with some lacing. Strong coffee flavoring. Burbon and strong alcohol on the palate.

UPDATED: JUN 14, 2015 On tap (2014). Strong coffee, bitter chocolate. A bit of dark fruit and mellowed out roasted notes, bourbon and vanilla is in there too. Alcohol presence, and a bit thinner than respective imperial stouts. Very overrated.

7-4-7-3-15 TOT: 3.6

2011 Vintage, next to 2015 Vintage:

2011: Big bourbon aroma, dark chocolate with a nutty musty slight licorice smell, taste mimics with bourbon, all the way through chocolate and a thick mouthfeel, carbonation is noticeably lower and mouthfeel is MUCH thicker.

9-4-7-4-16 TOT: 4

2015:

Aroma of pure oak, very little bourbon, overwhelming oak without much vanilla or the nicer oak flavors, coffee cant be found only slight chocolate, tar, licorice, tastes the same, mouthfeel is very thin. This beer clearly gets worse for every year, with the last two having very obvious changes to the bourbon barrel aging to save money.

6-4-7-3-15 TOT: 3.5

12oz bottles (2013 vintage I believe), courtesy of Chicago tasting crew. -  Medium-thick motor oil with a fickle espresso cap. Dense, pungent aromatics of bourbon wood, with rummy alcohol waft overtones, burnt sugar, condensed chocolate syrup and tobacco. Tastes like cold espresso coffee reduced along with tobacco-cured chocolate syrup with a fair hop aromatic berry character, even some citrus rind. Mon Cheri and bourbon vanilla, dry wood show up at second sip. Thick, unctuous. tongue-coating mouthfeel with a dry laryngeal finish, the hidden place where those 70 IBUs finally surface. Also the Starbucks triple shot espresso linger for ever...if this is your night cap, youm even take it to bed after having brushed your teeth. - Obviously delicious, although very dense and missing the breathy elegance and chocolate mousse levity that a yeast profile would impart: instead all flavour pockets seem smothered, plastered with thick, syrupy layers of chocolate and coffee. In this sense very much a member, if not one of the founders, of the bold bourbon-barreled "black hole" class of ImpStouts, a US branch of cultural horror vacui: finding a point of entry for graceful repose of the taste buds is near impossible.

UPDATED: OCT 6, 2014 Bottle shared with Sean. Brown, black, thin tan head. Dark chocolate, espresso coffee, woody notes in the nose. Flavour is out of this world, intense dark chocolate, bitter coffee. Thick, lush mouth feel. Finish goes on forever.

Yeah this stuff is great. Smells like coffee and cinnamon and deliciousness. Dark stout with nice caramel head. Tastes like coffee and cinnamon and a little bit of cloves. Great thick mouthfeel. Id drink it again and again and again...

UPDATED: MAY 3, 2017 "Beer 2k!! I was amazed by how much the coffee aspect of the breakfast stout cuts right through the bourbon in both the aroma and flavor. the description says a "hint" of coffee? no way. the coffee is 50 50 with the bourbon, which makes this beer ridiculously smooth...smoother than the "regular" breakfast stout, also an elite beer. depending on how much you like coffee, this may be the best or one of the best bb stouts out there. the vanilla boozy oak aspects are done well, not overpowering, and blend seemlessly with the roasty goodness. For far far less...better than Surly Darkness!"

UPDATED: JUN 2, 2016 Pours dark dark with low latte brown head
Aromas very fine tuned of milk chocolate, hints of bourbon, vanilla, hints of dades and figs, hints of hazelnuts.
Taste is not overly complex, it is just perfectly balanced. Chocolate, hints of coffee, hazelnuts, hints of bourbon and vanilla, hints of molasses, wee bit ash in the ending
Mouthfeel is perfectly balanced between rich creamy dark maltyness, vanilla and chocolate, finished by subtle bourbon notes

UPDATED: MAY 21, 2016 Pours black with a finger of frothy tan head. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, vanilla, muscovado, hazel nuts. Taste is initial milk chocolate and vanilla sweet, then light bitterness, then a lingering coffee bitter finish. Incredibly balanced! Compared to Breakfast Stout, this is in a different league. Body is rich and creamy, soft carbonation.

Edit: after several bottles over the years, as well as trying it on keg several times, I need to come back to this. In light of the popularity of bourbon barrel aged stouts, it becomes even more apparent just how wonderfully balanced KBS is. Never once does any one quality take over, and most certainly the bourbon barrels never become overbearing. If I could have only one imperial stout for the rest of my life this would be it.

On tap at Bishops Arms Folkungagatan Stockholm Sweden. Pours black with a medium frothy tan head. Swirling it around leaves some nice lacings on the inside of the glass, yet its not all that thick. Aromas of chocolate, bourbon, coffee, molasses, honey and vanilla.Taste is chocolate, bourbon, coffee ,molasses vanilla, roasted malts and vanilla. Mouthfeel is smooth with low carbonation. 

My experience with bourbon barrel-aged stouts so far has been a massive up-in-your-face nose and taste with several of them bludgeoning your senses. Mind you, in a good way. This is insidious creeping its way in and insanely well balanced. Fantastic stuff and worth they hype!

12 oz bottle courtesy of Chris, served in a stem glass next to the base. Pours black with a small tan head that fades to a thin remnant and leaves a small amount of fine lace. The nose has huge bourbon notes, along with molasses, vanilla, cocoa and oak. The flavour is moderately sweet with vanilla, bourbon and molasses, along with oak, toffee and a hint of cocoa. The finish is long with bourbon and vanilla, along with molasses. On the palate it is medium-full in body with a creamy texture and soft carbonation. Overall, wow, an amazing bourbon-barrel aged brew with elegant bourbon notes. Wow, awesome. 2014-09-28

UPDATED: JUN 20, 2017 Was disappointed with it for 2014. Seems to be a theme from what I?ve heard. Look forward to next year for maybe a better showing. On tap at founders launch 2015, This is a great beer.  much Improved.  I would drink this All the time.  Still think it might be a bit over rated, but I do like it.  Better than my first go at it. 2017 release: coffee is strong with this one.  Hit of chocolate and mild bitter finish.  Slight warming at the finish. thought this was thin, but next bottle wasnt.  slight char?  I think temp was better this go around which definitely changed the taste.
Super interesting aromas of chocolate covered cherries, cocoa, vanilla, sweetness, chocolate dessert. Very smooth. Vanilla, almond, honey, subtle coffee, chocolate, cherries flavors.

I had this at Global Brew. Pours black with a tan head. Taste roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, booze. I didn't like this, to much coffee flavor (I don't like coffee). I would not drink this again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Sample at icbcf14
Full bodied, slick, warming, vanilla, coffee, chocolate, well integrated whiskey, understandably high rated but a bit OTT for me. A small measure is plenty

355 ml bottle, thanks Staffan47! Black with mocca colored head. Aroma with lots of bourbon, alcohol, dark chocolate, light coffee and roasted notes. Taste is medium bodied, lots of bourbon, dark chocolate and sweet roasted notes. Really nice stout

UPDATED: APR 4, 2016 Bottle shared @ Beer Temple (small sample), thanks Chris Knight. Black color. Beige head with little lacing. Aromas of ground coffee, roasted malts, light fruit. Additionally some caramel retronasal. Flavor is moderate bitter, roasted, with a light sweetness. Medium bodied. Finishes with heavy roast, coffee, moderate to full bitter. Nice!
Full bottle from 2015 (one year old). Black color. Beige head, thin layer retention. Lovely aromas of bourbon, roast, ground coffee, oak, vanilla. Bourbon, coffee, roast, sweetness retronasal. Flavor is moderate sweet, roasted, light bitter, coffee. Strong alcohol feel. Medium bodied. Finishes with lots of roast and bitterness.

Uh yeah! From my first trade, thanks to PreisMJ! Have been looking forward to this. Bottle. Pours pitch black with a small, beautiful brown head. Aroma has milk chocolate, vanilla, bourbon, caramel, coconut, soft licorice and coffee. Taste has a crispy, dark roast, up front, as well as a little booze, followed by looots of dark, sweet fruity chocolate notes, vanilla, dates, figs, dried plums, raisins, dried coconut. Ends off with a nice and strong alcohol heat. Very smooth and balanced beer, that i could drink lots of. Full body and low carbonation.

12oz bottle. Black, with great tan head. Heady chocolate sauce and mocha coffee on the nose; sweet twist of bourbon and oakiness in there, light touch of roasted malt adds depth. Great nose. Taste is big on the coffee and darker choc - bitter choc. Some deep figgy stuff happening, big roasted malt hit. Velvety chocolate comes in, followed by a sweet touch of bourbon. Big full mouthfeel. No booze hint at all, very well integrated. Lingering bourbon and coffee, with a slight burnt smokiness on the tongue. Yeah, first class gear.

UPDATED: APR 13, 2016 On tap, poured into a snifter. Delicious aromas of vanilla, dark cherry, chocolate chips, cookie dough, roasted notes, and a faint wood and bourbon alcohol come through to the nose. It pours black as night, with a deep brown, creamy, frothy head. The surface is a thick, soapy layer that retains well, leaving ample coverage by the end of the drink and also leaving a dense, full-sheet coating of lace along the glass. It?s highly sweet with a medium high bitter. The syrup slick texture has a full malty sweet body to it with an abundant, but very soft, soapy carbonation. It?s a very clean, with tones of dark chocolate, coffee, vanilla and secondary notes of caramel, nuts, and even mint. The finish is chocolate mint with a hint of juicy citrus. The aftertaste is mostly chocolate with a mellow, light bourbon caramel touch. This was quite an amazing treat.

Kveldens siste flaske delt på RBHD-samlinga hos Asle Bjørn: storboblet kort skum, brunsvart farge. Intens aroma av kaffe, bjørnebær, vanilje og kokesjokolade. Smak og ettersmak som kommer til å vare helt inn i drømmeland - mørkbrent kaffe, bourbon, vanilje. So smooth. Velbalansert til siste finish. Blir bare bedre og bedre ettersom temperaturen stiger. En minneverdig stout i verdensklasse. Takk til Gunnar for kveldens beste!
UPDATED: DEC 26, 2015 Given as a birthday present. This is a very good and rare beer. It?s like great lakes blackout stout bourbon barrel aged, but maybe more chocolate.

Bottle kindly shared by gunnar. Black body with a veil. Black with Coffee and vanilla dominates the nose at first, then the bourbon comes sneaking; and raisins. Thick, oily and alco warm. Coffee, vanilla, wooden notes and roasted malts.

Shared bottle at local tasting, thanks to my secret summer santa 2014 for this one. Pours black with a ruby note, no head. Aroma of dark fruits, coffee, vanilla and dark malty goodies included some bourbon. Taste is smooth,light creamy mouthfeel, vanilla, heavy dark malts, soy, caramel,tar and liquorice. Classy beer.

UPDATED: FEB 13, 2017 Shared bottle at RB/HD at ABE´s 29.08.14. Alomost black, with a hint of red. Next to none head. Aroma of coffee and vanilla, with a hint of blackberries. Taste of dark chocolate with vanilla, combined with bitterness.

Shared 355 ml bottle at local tasting. Pitch black colour, no head. Strong and intense aroma of bourbon / oak / vanilla, nearly hiding the roasty, chocolate and coffee notes in the background. Low carbonation. Sweet and rich flavour, notes of bourbon, vanilla, oak, chocolate and coffee.

bottle, from trade (2009) with ross, another in the "i havent rated this yet" series. real good aroma, sweet, coffee, bourbon, vanilla, blackish brown color, small head little to no lace. sweet flavor. heavy body. kind od a still creamy mouthfeel, sweet finish. Ive had this a bunch of times, this one is at a nice point, still get the barrel, but not hot like younger versions
user_location: the Containment Area, North Carolina, USA

text:
Had only a small sample at a beer show but it had wonderful coffee aroma and a smooth palate. I'd love to get a bottle to sit and ponder with sometime. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle 2014 version, june 20th. Pours black with a small brown head. Aroma is chocolate, coffee, oak, bourbon. Taste is medium sweet with bourbon, vanilla, light caramel, medium bitter chocolate. Finish is medium roasted bitterness with a light alcohol warmth. Body is medium, slick texture and soft carbonation.
Bottle, near black with a thin crema, burnt coffee, liquorice, black treacle, and ashy dry. Gorgeous.

Transfer from BA review on 10-14-12 with slight modification after pouring from bottle and trying again-
 Served on tap in a 10 oz chalice glass

 Appearance  Served a black colored brew with only a tiny off white head which faded very fast to leave some patchy spots of lace on the sides of the glass as well as some small islands of foam floating on the top of the brew.

 Smell  The aroma was lighter then I was initially expecting. It had nice notes of coffee, dark chocolate, some vanilla sweetness and a nice boozy bourbon aroma. While it was light it was quite nice and warming in smell.

 Taste  The taste begins with roasted malt and coffee flavors. Some sweet vanilla and dark chocolate are up front and grow stronger toward the middle. While these flavors grow stronger, some lighter bourbon flavors come to the tongue. While the bourbon starts out lighter, by the end it really picks up in intensity with the chocolate and caramel lessening some in the profile. Along with the boozy flavor increasing in intensity, so too does some of the coffee flavors, which in the end, when combined with roasted malt flavors creates a quite roasty and pleasantly bitter boozy taste on the tongue.

 Mouthfeel  The body of the beer was on the creamier side with a carbonation level that is below average. Both the lower carbonation and thicker-creamier body are fantastic for the brew and really accentuating the roasted, coffee, and bourbon flavors of the brew.

 Overall - A very tasty beer and one that is well worth a try. While it is fantastic with its wonderful roasty and bourbon flavors its reputation precedes it some. I actually think Founders Breakfast is more balanced then the Kentucky. While with this said however, the Kentucky is definitely a beer to try if you have the chance.

First time I was able to have my own bottle as opposed to a small sip from a bottle share event. Holy crap. No head. Dark black. Honestly, it doesnt look like much. Aroma of sweet bourbon. Subtle coffee and chocolate. A bit of vanilla. Woody. Mildly sweet, but subdued by the booziness, which isnt overpowering in the least. Mildly bitter on the back in. Long bourbon finish that is very smooth. Full bodied & chewy. Delicious!

I detect a faint aroma of coffee and chocolate. Its appearance is of black coffee with a light caramel brown on its edges. Theres a slight white frothy head on its very edges. It lingers on the sides of glass as you sip it. The taste is complex; coffee followed by the sweet yet bitter finish of a fine dark chocolate. It has a full creamy body with a long finish which keeps you wanting more. Overall, this is one of the best stouts that Ive ever had.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Beer Market Jaffa. Thanks Tom L. Black, opaque. Very apparent coffee aroma with some vanilla beans. Mouthful bitter-sweetness and some coffee in the mouth. No carbonation, full body, long, coffee finish. Great.

UPDATED: MAY 24, 2015 Taste from a norwegian dude, cheers mate. Pours almost pitch black with a small tanned head. Aromas of chocolate, vanilla, cherries, slight bourbon, slight booze, coffee. Taste is amazing, boomin vanilla, fudge, sweet dark fruits, nice roast and good burned coffee finish.

Dark brown, almost black pour with small beige head. Aroma of roasted coffee, chocolate, caramel, vanilla and bourbon. Taste of roasted malts, caramel, bourbon, vanilla, coffee, chocolate and faint licorice. Full bodied, medium carbonation, creamy mouth feel, perfectly balanced. Excellent beer!

Pours dark, dark brown into snifter with a very thin light brown head. Wonderful nose - vanilla, bourbon, and cherries. Taste is complex and smooth...bourbon, vanilla, oak, coffee, and a touch of bitterness. I get the hype - this is a great beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle pour, opaque black, decent lace. graham colored head. Aroma of bread, coffee, molasses. Flavor is chocolate, coffee, toffee, molasses, licorice, bourbon, vanilla, slightly spicy. Slightly sweet start, but finishes slightly bitter.Body is thick, carbonation moderate.

All I can say is, heaven in a bottle. I was lucky enough to get a few cases of this for my wedding party on wedding day. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Massively dark stout: coffee-chocolate bomb. Draft. 4 oz poor.Tasted at Holy Hound taproom, York, PA.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

At a tasting, many thanks Tom, small brown creamy head, thick pour, opaque black colour, flavour of cocoa, dirt, coffee and vanila in the back, feels quite aromatic, flavour of not too roasted coffee, cocoa, bittersweet chocolate, vanila and dark bread. Nicely balanced and really really good.

Noire aux reflets rubis avec une belle mousse moka. Nez: Truffe au chocolat. Anisé. Café corsé. Bourbon. Boisé/vanille. Bouche: nougat. Caramel au beurre salé. Bien chocolaté. Très bien équilibré. Sucré balancé avec une bonne amertume. Fine chaleur d'alcool (bourbon). Jalapeño, sans le piquant. Très bien.

Bottle. Pours a very dark brown with medium creamy tan head that lasts. The aroma is a strong roast, chocolate, oak, and booze. Slick mouthfeel with nice roasted malt, dark chocolate, and light coffee. Easy to drink, hiding alcohol well, really enjoyed this.

Got it in a bottle at house of beer. Pours kinda flat jet black. Aroma of bitter black, chocolate coffee, butter, plum, cherry. Thick and well carbonated for the style. Holy cow, so happy i found this. Light bourbon flavor with strong bitter dark chocolate much like aroma. Terrific. Super sweet. Little booze. Wish i had a fridge full.

Dark black pour with tan head... Amazing bourbon, vanilla, roasted malt aroma... Flavor is fairly mild, not terribly boozy or rich for that matter... Decent, little disappointed

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A big Thank You to Bytemesis! Simply amazing. 12oz bottle pours pitch black with a two finger head and motor oil lacing. Aromas of coffee, rich chocolate, leather, caramel, herbs, and vanilla. Slight alcohol notes but not overpowering. Delicious!

Big thinks to thoor84 for this treat! Pitch black, almost no head. Huge whiff of vanilla, sweets, slight bourbon. Very smooth palate, sweet, with vanilla dominating, subtle booze and bourbon. Very good!

pours dark brown with minimal head. aroma is bourbon some coffee. taste is bourbon with bitter dark chocolate with some coffee and vanilla and barrel thrown together. there is alot going on with this beer. great beer
This is quite possibly the best all around desert stout out there. Also pairs well with a cigar and is well worth the search to find

This 2014 batch was exceptionally smooth fresh offering the obvious components of bourbon barrel, chocolatey imperial stout, and coffee, compared to a three month aged version and a 2011 version, I cant see any reason to age this, a touch more complexity was created after three years along with a slightly less enjoyable texture, Ill keep future vintages in the fridge and drink them within the year

3/4" medium khaki frothy to somewhat smooth head settling to a solid ring with a frothy island and a short peninsula and dot of lace over a black body with miniscule dark honey highlights

Spirit forward chocolatey barrel with accents of coffee, cherry, pie crust, date, plumb, and raisin with a juicy spirit influence flowing back in to take control of the finish on a well carbonated coating medium plus body, this one was significantly more silky and integrated with a heavier weight on release week

An enjoyable chocolate syrup drenched oak and spirit laced residual trails off to traces of vanilla and dark fruit

2011 offers amplified dark fruit components, blueberries and raisins glowing against barrel, subtle spirit, and dark chocolate, cola finish

12oz bottles into Orrefors Difference Porter snifter
Would prefer just a tad more coffee taste. Great balance of bourbon and all other flavors. Delicious aroma that tempts you to taste.
Draft at railroad. Pours pitch black with minimal head. The aroma has tons of chocolate, vanilla, oak. The taste has plenty of barrel, chocolate coffee, huge palate.
UPDATED: JUL 19, 2016 Draft at Founders. Amazing beer with a massive coffee, bourbon, and chocolate party in my mouth.

Bottle marked 2010. Pours thick dark brown. Mostly flat. I loved the aroma. Vanilla, cream, cherries, wood. Not much coffee, though. A little more coffee in the taste, but still subdued. Its a rich, roasty, dark chocolate sort of flavor. A little peppery burn in the back of the mouth. Great. Would love to try fresher.

KBS was fantastic and lived up to the hype. I was only allowed 1 bottle when I purchased it and I am glad I was lucky enough to get that. The coffee is strong and the bourbon seeps in on every sip. I did what it said and let it breathe for 30 minutes or so after opening, which I recommend. For stout lovers, it is a must try.

A perfect beer. Amazing in each and every way.....Im not sure if Ive had a better barrel aged offering. Then to find out it was actually aged an additional year in a personal cellar. It was truly out of this world.

Deep black pour with a thick, dark caramel colored head. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, molasses, burnt sugar, light smoke, and of course bourbon. Really rich and luxurious. Full bodied, ultra smooth, and hides the alcohol ridiculously well. One of the best!
Strong sweet bourbon aroma, coffee starts with vanilla tones. This is a meal and a dessert all in one! Worthy of the ratings

Tasted from bottle. Black in color with a dark brown head. Incredible aroma of chocolate, coffee, caramel, oak, molasses. Taste is a mixture of dark chocolate and coffee with slight smokey notes. Very smooth and hides the high ABV incredibly well. Full bodied with a sticky heavy mouthfeel at first giving way to a dry feeling. Taste really lingers on palate. This and Bells Expedition are the 2 best stouts I've had. Very very well done. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 oz bottle, 2014 vintage, received via trade and poured into a snifter at home. Jet black appearance with a lacy brown head. Aroma of oak, vanilla, caramel, chocolate, light coffee, roasted malts, bourbon, toffee and wood. Similar flavor, everything comes together nicely. Full body, smooth and creamy with a sweet finish. Wow, what a great sipper and an incredible beverage overall.

Drove all the way to Grand Rapids to try some. Was able to come home with some bottles. Poured very heavy, giving a small tan head. Dark thick body. No light comes through. Smell is very minimal bourbon with lots of coffee. Some wood smell. Taste is coffee with more bourbon than the smell. Very good. One of the best beers Ive had. Poured the beer somewhere around 55 degrees.

Tap at Tap House in Rochester, great house! Well another year for this rare unicorn of a beer. Easily the best beer of the year. Fall into imperial bourbon bliss. If you get a chance, you should. Cheers!

Appearance - 5 - dark brown black color, mocha head, nice lacing on the glass
Aroma - 10 - huge bourbon, oak, coffee, roastiness, smoke, espresso
taste - 10 - huge bourbon, oak, coffee, dark chocolate, smoke, toasted coconut, vanilla, booze
Mouth/palate - 5 - heavy,alc present like a nice bourbon. Aftertaste is roasty coffee awesomeness. 
O - 20 - great roasty coffee Bourbon barrel beer and a great contrast to the other greats
