Great blend of flavors. Where Founders Backwoods Bastard is so, so heavily influenced (dominated really!) by the bourbon, here the bourbon is matched with other flavors to produce a wonderfully straightforward yet complex stout. I want more!

UPDATED: SEP 14, 2014 Färsk nyskuren chili i doft. Lite askfat. Krämig. De sedvanliga stouttonerna. Chili även i smak men ingen hetta. Tung raritet. Kul att uppleva.--/ 


-- rerate. Härlig mörk choklad med inslag av bittra toner. Härlig och balanserad

I don't think I really need to go crazy with this review. The ratings and reviews speak for themselves. If you find this and don't buy this... Stop drinking beer as switch to craft soda. This is one of the finest liquids that has ever been created.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours black with thing tan ring around the glass.  Aromas of coffee, oak, and roast.  Strong coffee flavors with some roasted bitterness.  As it warms, I get some flavors of green peppers.  Nice creamy mouthfeel is left over on the palate.

UPDATED: JUN 23, 2013 Bottle in a trade thanks to phatdog1! Pours a thick black with tan ring of head that leaves great lacing that slips down the glass. Aroma of bba goodness, roasted malt, vanilla and dark chocolate. Taste is coffee, vanilla, oak, bourbon; thick mouth, a bit boozy and bitter.  Solid, but not sure if it is worth the hype.

Many thanks to shrubber85 for the trade! Pours a thick jet black with a small tan head. Aromas of chocolate, coffee, bourbon, and roasted malts, with hints of oak. It tastes like a liquid bourbon ball, the chocolate and bourbon character really shine through. Long and rich finish, slightly warming from the abv. Absolutely amazing, I only wish this was more readily available, I would buy this all the time!

Pours a pitch black with little brown head and no lacing. Aroma of cold coffee, chocolate, vanilla, bourbon. Taste has dark chocolate, coffee, roasted malts, vanilla, light green peppers. Full body and low to medium carb. Very good!
So sweet and bourbony. Thick, puffy. A burn on the lungs. Coco-puffs, And heaps of vanilla. Wonderful
Bourbon aroma shines through, if you arent a bourbon fan this may be offsetting. Great beer overall.
UPDATED: JUL 31, 2013 Pours dark brown. Chocolatey Boozey Goodness. Chocolate and toffee notes. THICK. So dope. Had it on Draught at Midway Pub in ATL.

Good, but not my favorite in this style. Pours almost black with a foamy beige head. Smell of chocolate and bourbon. Taste has a little bourbon, chocolate vanilla with a thick body with small amount of carbonation. Good but prefer other barrel aged stouts like plead the 5th.

Big black pour with a thick tan head. Caramel, malt and roast. Def get the coffee aroma here. Medium body, decent amount of carbonation. Slight bourbon and slight vanilla flavors present along with the caramel and coffee flavors. Dark chocolate flavors linger on your palate. Tasty beer
Coffee punch to the face, in a good way. Sweet backbone shows itself throughout. Beautiful color, used motor oil. Fantastic.
Great smell, lots of chocolate, some alcohol and bourbon. Taste is bourbon, coffee, raisin, chocolate. Amazing beer.

UPDATED: APR 7, 2016 bottle. Black and viscous with dense mocha head. Wonderful aroma, fudge, vanilla, marshmallow, and bourbon. Taste is chocolate, oak, fudge, roasted malts, and a touch of bourbon. What makes this beer great to me is how well the barrel treatment integrates with the base beer, it manages to add complexity without overpowering. Extremely well balanced. Beautiful stuff.
Lawdamercy, where to even begin? I had this as a 10oz draft at the Map Room in Chicago. Superb- scotch, cocoa, malt, and warming alcohol finish.

Bouteille 12 fl oz. Brune foncée opaque. Nez de café, chocolat et bourbon. Bouche généreuse qui tapisse les papilles: chocolat noir, une trace de vanille, café et bourbon. Un peu de chaleur en fin de bouche, mais pas assez pour être réellement dérangeante. Très longue en bouche, un peu asséchante et tannique à la toute fin. Excellente.
Tastes of coffee, a hint of vanilla, some chocolate milk, all with bourbon notes throughout. Awesome

Bottle via toastedpuppy. Pours midnight black with minimal head. Leaves a thin lacing coat mainly made of spots. Nose of coffee, chocolate, and bourbon. Taste is balanced with previously listed elements. The roast is lingering. Body is full and burly.

Nice surprise at the Blind Tiger event didnt expect this to be there.  Pours jet black with nice head.  Rich nose of dark chocolate and some booze.  Tastes of chocolate, earthy. leather, rootbeer, resin and plenty of bourbon.  Not to rich or sweet.  pretty decent but didnt blow me away.

Small bottle @ home, poured in a sniffer. Pours deep to black brown with a lingering small beige head. Aroma is superbly balanced coffee & chocolate, with a tad too much bourbon heat, result is a deep mocca character. Medium body with sweet & roasty notes, immediately followed by alcohol glow, finished with a tad of bitterness. Taste is silky dark chocolate with some raw green paprica in the back. Unfortunately, a bit too much borubon in the taste as well. Yet, one of the most un-American RISes I have ever tasted... but why filter it... WHYYYYYYYY?

On tap at Raleigh Times. 

Poured a deep, rich brown with small head. Nice and strong bourbon aroma that pretty much disappears from taste. Strong coffee and chocolate overtones, with aftertaste favoring first the chocolate, then the coffee. 

First time having KBS.  I can appreciate folks chasing after it (and taking a half day off to try it was worth it).

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JUN 2, 2015 19.05.2013, 0,35l bottle @ home:
Nice creamy cocoa colored longlasting head. Aroma is rich and sweet, lots of chocoate, caramel, mild bourbon, vanilla, dark sugar, grass, coffee, hints of oak. Taste is rich and slightly dry, cocoa, oak, dark sugar, mild bourbon, vanilla, caramel, grass, dark chocolate, coffee, minerals. Medium bitterness, slightly dry mouthfeel with a nice warming alcohol touch. Lovely stuff!
Great smell, body.  Flavor is too much bourbon for my taste.  Probably needs a couple years to achieve perfection, IMO.  Prefer BB4d and Black Note due to smoother flavors.

Chocolate and whiskey aroma and heavy taste of each. Did i mention that it has a little bit of a whiskey taste (cold). That said KBS is a true thick stout. Little to no head on the draft pour.  The coffee is very subtle compared to normal Breakfast Stout. The overall taste mellows a little bit as it warms. Much better warm...the layers are chocolate, coffee, bourbon.

UPDATED: JAN 17, 2016 Boozy whiskey nose, super chocalatey...taste of bourbon on the tongue. Powerful yet smooth. Slight coffee. More mealy than Bells Black making it more robust but not as smooth. Almost licorice with the booze. UPDATE: KBS 2015. Super complex, well rounded, not too much sweet, not too much coffee...quite possibly one of the best stouts Ive ever had. Better than I remember from a couple years ago. 8, 5, 9, 5, 18
Such smooth character that really comes through on the finish. The slightest hint of bourbon really adds to the complexity

Pours a deep, dark black with a thin brown head. Smells of molasses, malts, chocolate, and bourbon. Palate is incredible. Drink the beer slowly as the tastes change as it warms. Everything from coffee, malts, bourbon, to dark chocolate. Absolutely fantastic taste and palate!

Doesnt get much better than this.

Roast, chocolate, and coffee all throughout the aroma and flavor. Body is big, very well attenuated. Once a beer gets this dark in color Im not sure it retains enough complexity in the visual to garner a perfect score in that category, just a personal hang up I suppose.

This is a beer all should try. Drank one now, will be drinking one in a year or two as well.

UPDATED: OCT 7, 2013 Great beer yes I gave it a perfect rating.  Is this way overrated now that Ive tried it....yep.  No beer is worth selling your liver which is what I practically had to do in order to get some of this.  If youve tried Central Waters Brewers Reserve its basically the same thing.  KBS is just a touch more chocolaty.

Believe the hype. This beer is freaking awesome. The beer pours a motor oil black with a orangish brown mild head, which dissipates quickly. The aroma is mild with notes of chocolate, vanilla, and coffee. The beer laces very well due to its high ABV. First flavors noticed are vanilla and chocolate with a nice bourbon barrel aged heated mouthfeel. As the beer warms up the coffee flavors are much more intense. It actually tastes like someone poured a few tablespoons of dark coffee into this beer while it was sitting in the glass. If you like barrel aged stouts, you will love this beer. Its wicked. Ive had the old rasputin barrel aged 750 ml and I would rather have this one any day. That beer has a higher ABV but this one is more intensely flavored. Quality stuff.
Draft poured jet black with a caramel color head. Semi sweet aroma. Initially sweet on the tongue, then a full Bourbon flavor. Cannot wait to have this again.

Bottle at home, from an IP trade with Michael C, 11/05/13.
Pours jet black with a big tan head that soon dissipates to a swirl and edgeing.
Nose carries a good kick of espresso coffee, roast malt, treacle toffee, brown sugars, bourbon evident.
Taste begins with a bourbon hit followed by roast malts, coffee, light cocoa, brown sugars, woody notes, little more bourbon, leather, ash, boozey maltesers.
Full bodied with fine carbonation pitched at just the right level to make this double digit ABVer eminently drinkable. Sweetish boozey finish where the bourbon really comes through.
Top draw, the bourbon is well drilled - noticeable but not OTT and the overall alchohol level is kept in check and well intregrated into the beer.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text:
12 oz bottle poured near black; opaque with a proper head. 

Powerful, enticing aroma of dark malts, fine bourbon, and faint wood. Slightly boozy, but less than expected for over 11% ABV.  Theres a lot going on here, with even more complexity in the flavor.  An excellent mix with good balance.  Taste is just a tad too smoky/burnt. 

Feel: full body is slightly harsh (recall over 11% ABV); Medium carbonation, if off at all, is a tad high; Smooth and warming.  

O: had 2-3x in the past on tap but this was the 1st time bottled; perhaps because it had some additional age (no way to tell at this point) this was even better than remembered.  An excellent big beer; very rich and complex, and a bit boozy in manner most may find appealing.

On tap at craftsman table & tab. Oily black pour, minimal head, lacing. Nose is smooth roasted coffee, vanilla, sweet malt and bourbon. Tastes is amazing! Follows the nose, roasted, malty, sweet, vanilla, bourbon undertones. Everything is balanced, alcohol complements and creates a warming, pleasant aftertaste. Mouth feel is medium, slick and lingers. One of the best beers Ive had. Period.

12 oz bottle pours a viscous opaque black color with virtually no head but slight lacing anyway.   Aroma is full of coffee, dark chocolate, vanilla and bourbon in the finish, but everything is well blended and not overpowering.  Taste is sweet without very much alcohol burn.  Mouthfeel is creamy with slight carbonation.  One of the best imperial stouts anywhere and worth the high price.

Pours black with a frothy tan head. Loads of coffee and vanilla on the nose with a bit of bourbon to help push along the beer. Overall bittersweet taste with a bourbony finish. Overall an amazing beer and will definitely have more of

I waited in line for three hours to get this one, and Im glad I did. This bottle pours a fairly thick black color with almost no head. Nose is quite roasty with a lot of coffee coming through. Taste is roasty and slightly bitter, but with hints of the bourbon and vanilla they suggest. So tasty.

Une belle petite bouteille, un classique. Liquide noire dencre avec une mousse brune peu durable. Le nez est complexe, les arômes se superposent, du café, des malts rôtis, du chocolat, du bois, beaucoup de bois, du whiskey. Superbe. Une bouche qui se déploie avec envergure, une texture emballante ronde, piquante. Des houblons qui amèrisent (je viens dinventer le verbe) les malts chocolats et les grains rôtis. Un exemple déquilibre.  Bue par une chaleur accablante et cette bière navait rien perdu de sa superbe.  Incroyable.
Poured a viscous black with no head. Aroma of roast coffee grinds and sweet, dark chocolate. Full body, flavour of the aroma with the alcohol of the bourbon apparent.
On tap at Capone's in Norristown, PA. Breakfast Stout was already a favorite, but this is on another level. Someone send me some CBS now!

2013 bottle into a Danish pour. Pours inky black with no head, little to no lacing. Huge, awesome coffee aroma with hints of vanilla and booze. Taste is creamy, vanilla, espresso, oak, booze burn, dark chocolate, a bit overly sweet.. Everything I was expecting. Definitely a sipper. Could definitely use sometime to cool down the booze.

at zeebra extreme festival
amazing beer. wood, earth, choco, vanilla on aroma. smooth taste, vanilla, alcohol, bourbon with a spicy aftertaste.

Bottle received in trade.  Thanks Kevin!  Aroma of bourbon, coffee, chocolate, vanilla, roasted sexiness. Rich creamy mocha head, deep dark pour, some irregular lacing. Somewhat viscous. Soft, nearly flat carbonation, full body, velvety.  Feels a shade thin on the tongue after a bit (not sure how thats possible, really). Taste follows nose, but also adds smoky (think, charred oak).  Overall: Does not disappoint. The bourbon, coffee and stout all come together beautifully in a way that leaves each flavor distinct and yet part of a cohesive whole.

Nose is dark chocolate, coffee and some molasses sweetness.  Taste is wonderful with nice hints of cocoa, coffee and bourbon booze. Pour is black as night and thick as oil. Mouthfeel is thick and yummy. Overall still awesome and I loooove this beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Dark black body with a coffee/tan colored head. Smells of dark chocolate, coffee, and notes of oats. Tastes extremely rich and of chocolate, coffee, vanilla and oats. A very thick and full mouthfeel.

Pours a black motor oil (almost) with a very thick head that may never go down. Big aromas of whiskey upfront, wood/oak, big caramel, vanilla, roasted malts, and no alcohol noticed. Flavors of light whiskey(more subdued in flavors), wood/oak, vanilla, medium alcohol only through the nose, and caramel. Very thick feel and up top on the thickness of all beers tried. Medium bitter light to medium sweet and very complex! Aromas are so big there is so much going on behind all the whiskey! I liked how you can notice a medium vanilla note in the middle of the flavors. The whiskey flavors are the only thing that turned me off slightly. Really an amazing stout that deserves its high acclaim to fame. My 700th beer rated.

On tap. Chocolate and coffee.Great oak aroma. The bourbon is perfectly balanced as opposed to other aged beers

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Poured from a growler at dark lord day. Sweet taste. Tons of chocolate and coffee. Super black and thick (unlike my penis). Love it

Cette robe noire et cette tête brune me plaisent du premier coup doeil.  À mesure que le liquide sévapore, je métonne de voir cette jolie dentelle.  Mon nez qui plonge rapidement dans cette aventure ne veut plus en sortir.  Que dire de ce bouquet appétissant de café noir, de biscuits au chocolat, de vanille et de malts rôtis qui senrobent dun délicat mais profond parfum de chêne imbibé de bourbon.  Force est dadmettre après une réflexion dune demi-seconde que je suis ici devant quelque chose qui appartient aux ligues majeures.  Une fois ce sympathique choc passé, mes lèvres se précipitent sur la paroi du verre.  Impossible de ne pas être emballé devant ces saveurs intenses de grains de café torréfiées, de chocolat au lait et de cacao pur qui se permettent dêtre légèrement réchauffées par cette présence feutrée dun bourbon qui transporte douceur et notes boisées.  En bouche, une structure corporelle extrêmement intelligente: jaime cette texture soyeuse et ces bulles qui ne sont jamais comprimées par une excessive lourdeur.  La finale est fantastique et savoureuse, chocolatée, jamais sucrée ni dominée par lalcool.  Voilà une bière vraiment impressionnante qui, à défaut dêtre un exemple de complexité, est larchétype même de lharmonie.
Bottle.  Medium bourbon barrel flavor in the initial taste.  A little sweetness that evolves into a chocolate roasted aftertaste.  Excellent overall.

The appearance of this beer fuses a black color and a tan head that dissipates quickly to leave a ring on top of the liquid, and the aroma is complex with notes of bourbon, coffee, roasted malts, and a hint of dark chocolate. The palate is more bold than the taste with its full body, long chocolatey finish, oily texture, and soft carbonation, but the taste is still an experience of a mild umami, mild sweetness, and a mild bitterness.
aroma at first was coffee then strong bourbon appearance was black. taste was amazing bourbon forward but very well balanced. this was a great beer
Very dark, very smooth, mellow even. Strong burbon a little coffee. Overall very good.

Pours viscous. Black with small, tight creamy brown head - lasting. Aroma is beautiful; chocolate, coffee, roasted, hint vanilla, clean bourbon and oak. Slightly sweet, not boozy. Full body, sumptuous mouthfeel. creamy. Lasting mellow bourbon oaky finish.  Superb balance. Flavor matches aroma. Worth the praise. Sip and enjoy.

Strong aroma of chocolate and coffee.  A little malt and alcohol too.  Vanilla bean.  
Strong alcohol taste, but very smooth and delicious.  Good mix of chocolate and coffee.  Leaves a warming sensation in the back of my throat.  The ocassional, very slight bitter taste, but mostly smooth and roasty chocolate.  malt.

Pours a beautiful brown, almost black with a thin creamy head. I forgot to catch the aroma after first pouring because I was so excited to drink it. Tastes like liquid chocolate with slight hint of coffee. This is not a bad thing. Heavy on the bourbon up front but mellows as it warms. Mouthfeel is about the best Ive had in a stout, not too thin and not too heavy. I know Im going all fanboy but this is honestly one of the top three beers Ive had. It lives up to the hype IMO. P.S. I know what it smells like...perfection.

12oz Bottle A - Pours black as night with a small mocha colored head. Little retention. Mild lacing. S - Yum! Espresso, chocolate, vanilla, praline, and a slight booze tingle to the nose hairs. S - Complex chocolate, rich coffee, vanilla bean, caramel, and toffee. Alcohol is there, but not overwhelming. M - Big bodied. Smooth and luscious mouthfeel. Chocolate/Oak notes finish. O - Big & Complex, but being ridiculously drinkalbe. Double Wow!!

This highly acclaimed stout pours a smooth, pitch black color with very little head. The aroma is rich with chocolate, coffee, and bourbon. The taste is explosive and delicious. Deep robust flavors erupt on your taste buds as the alcohol warms your stomach. It finishes with a oak, bourbon flavor. This is smooth, delicious, and just as good as expected.

Had at Glunz Global Beer Expo XIX.  Pours black with a big, tan head that doesnt dissipate.  Had strong aromas of roasty coffee grounds, milk and dark chocolate, and a slight amount of bourbon.  In your face on the tongue.  Bourbon shines through there, and the chocolate is real strong.  Very big, thick beer that leaves a strong milk and dark chocolate aftertaste.  This beer may not be branching out to do something different, but the essentials of an imperial stout are perfectly done.  What a pleasure to drink.

Got my first taste of this years batch from the owner of the Wrecking Bar a few weeks back, but I needed to try a slightly bigger sample before throwing up a rating.  Split a bottle with my wife.  For most big beers, six ounces is the ideal serving size.  1000+ years of five ounce glasses of wine cant be wrong.  Pours black with lighter head than expected.  Cant be sure that the light head wasnt due to wifes preference for colder stouts.  I waited until my portion hit cellar temperature before drinking.  Smells and tastes of coffee and chocolate.  Whiskey is there, but doesnt overpower.  Great beer and wish it was easier to find.  Bottle - Intown Market - Atlanta, GA

Very similar to many other good barrel aged stouts...nothing real special here... Very enjoyable to drink and very smooth with nothing too overpowering... Make sure to let her warm as u drink it...

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A: Pours out like 10W30, with hardly any head, but what is there is light brown - none of this tan colored head - it was the color of brown sugar. 

S: Wonderful! Tons of dark roasted coffee, dark chocolate, bourbon, hints of vanilla, maple syrup, and bread. I could catch whiffs of it a foot from the glass - it saturated my nose. 

T: It tasted superb, as well: the alcohol was perfectly present, along with the java and dark chocolate flavors, and even a hint of maple syrup. If I had to drink a beer for breakfast, this would be a good choice. There was a lingering dark roasted bourbon flavor.

M: Rich and creamy, with an appropriate measure of carbonation to complement the alcoholic bite to it. 

D: No, you couldnt keep pounding these, but its a lovely, awesome beer to drink. I love drinking it, and Im so happy to live in the city in which its brewed.

On tap at The Butcher & the Boar. Minneapolis, MN.  I must say that this beer lived up to the hype. Ive been anticipating trying it for quite some time now.  Pours a rich blackish brown color, very thick looking.  The vanilla notes were stronger than anticipated but melded well with the bourbon aroma/flavor. It had the typical stout like coffee and chocolate tastes.  Overall it had a very complex make-up that really hit the senses.  Probably the best beer Ive tried to date. Only reason for a lower than perfect score is that I havent tried enough of a variety in this genre.
12oz bottle (2012). Pours a thick black color with a thin dark brown head. Heavy bourbon aroma with a sweet hint of coffee and chocolate. Taste of strong bourbon, coffee, chocolate, and vanilla.
Aroma of bourbon and chocolate appearance black with a tan head taste bourbon and chocolate palate long on flavor

From a 12 oz bottle shared in Avon NC.  Pours black with a tan head.  Aroma of coffee and chocolate.  Oak, bourbon and toasted malts along with the coffee, chocolate and bourbon notes in the flavor.  Wow.  This is one tasty brew.

Pleasant coffee, bittersweet chocolate & cocoa, on nose with oak and hints of metal and soy sauce; the taste is full and complex with butter, vanilla, brown sugar, caramel, butterscotch, and rich chocolate, with nutty pecan and a dry coffee and bourbon finish including hints of celery and grass. This brew is rich and very smooth on the palate, simply a superlative beverage.
Pours jet black with a delightful warming aroma of bourbon and vanilla.  Rich and smooth that starts sweet and finishes dry and smooth with a subtle bourbon finish.

Pours black with a 1/4" brown head. Aroma of coffee, burnt malt and bourbon. Taste is very roasty, with burnt malt, coffee. Okay palate. Seems overly roasted to me, not a crazy amount of bourbon. And much drier than a lot of imperial stouts.
Pours a thick, dark color with a thin brown head. Huge chocolate and bourbon aroma with notes of coffee, caramel, wood, sweet malts and alcohol. A slight alcohol finish.

Had this  for the first time a coupe of days ago after hearing about it for over a year from some other beer nuts with whom I work.  Enjoyed it in a Sam Adams glass (the one made specifically for optimizing taste), and walked away thinking I may have just drank the best beer Ive ever had.  Im a huge IPA fan and usually dont fawn over stouts, but this sucker takes the cake!

UPDATED: MAY 6, 2013 This has an odd aroma. The coffee is very vegetal, and when mixed with the bourbon element, its not too good.  The beer tastes much better.  Chocolate, coffee, and vanilla.  Very smooth, and a nice creamy mouth feel.

I had such a desire to try this beer so I was a little worried that the anticipation would cloud my judgment. Keeping that in mind, as I shared this brew with a buddy, I poured the bottle into two glasses. Very dark, almost opaque, with a a very nice head. Bourbon takes the front stage in the nose and is followed by a subtle coffee scent. The taste is amazing with coffee on the front and bourbon on the back end. The bourbon is like drinking some of the best you have ever had. Oh I wish I had a cigar while drinking this beer. No further description is needed other than to say this beer is amazing. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JUN 4, 2013 Have sampled before but never a proper rating..2012 edition..the aroma from the get go is better than almost anything out there..jet black with minimal head..aroma of vanilla..bourbon and hint of coffee..the coffee has kind of disipatated after the year..but wow this does not disappoint..mouthfeel is surprisingly creamy and slick and this is even better with a year on it..forget all of  you kbs haters...absolutely mind blowing with hints of coconut...chocolate and just flat out goodness...wish I could get more of this and have on more special occasions...getting used to popping a bottle or so on masters weekend as a grand tradition...what a tasty beer....tap version this year nowhere compared to 1 yr old bottled version

2013 Bottle. Consumed 4/14/13. My first time. Pours opaque brown-black with a fluffy, resilient brown head. Aroma is excellent; bourbon, oak, chocolate, coffee, vanilla, earthy, hints of grass, cereal and dark fruit. Taste is big, boozey, spicy, acidic; coffee and bourbon lead the charge; oak, chocolate and dark fruit are all represented; big coffee and bourbon finish. Dense  lacing coats the glass. Medium-low carbonation. Creamy, full-bodied mouth feel. Founders doesnt mislead; this is coffee and bourbon, a breakfast stout aged in bourbon barrels. The bourbon is certainly more aggressive than the coffee and secondary flavors, but I like this. Full-flavored, big-bodied; an experience. Excellent. I understand the annual chase that ensues for bottles of KBS.

Here we Go!  The famous KBS!  I stumbled into this one by accident, and my expectations were astronomical and impossible to meet.  Way too much rubbing alcohol on the nose detracted immensely from the aroma.  The flavor is quite nice with enough bourbon coming through to run you through.  Look, when it is all said and done, this is a nice stout, but I enjoy their Breakfast and Imperial variety more than this.  Very happy to finally try.

was only allowed to purchase one bottle from the store.  pours oil can black a khaki head.  looks fantastic!  hints of dark fruit in the aroma, you can also pick up some of the bourbon.The mouth feel is thick, creamy, and pleasant.  There is a slight bit of carbonation but nothing overwhelming. The first taste you get is coffee, then the bourbon comes through.  The last thing that comes through is a strong dark chocolate sweetness.  This beer lives up to the hype in every way.  I am so happy I got a chance to have it!

Pours an inky brown with little to no head.  Aroma of.....whiskey.  Taste is a bombardment of flavors....a quick hit of coffee, chocolate stout flaver then whiskey, dominanting alcohol with an cloyingly sweet tartness which drops into very slight hoppiness to finish......as it warmed the whiskey overtook most every flavor except the coffee.  A bit too much of a lot.

Very velvety smooth stout with a clean finish. Flavors of cocoa, espresso and roasts barley are also present. The bourbon is well hidden but the aging smooths the beer well. This beer deserves its high praises.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
From a bottle poured a dark brown color with a small amount of head.  Strong sweet malty flavor with a lingering finish.

From a bottle. Pours opaque almost black with light head. Tastes toasty, slightly sour and bitter like raisins, red wine, fermenting fruit. Smells rich, sweet, fruity. Medium body and high carbonation.

Bottle. Pours opaque black with thin, fizzy tan head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, espresso, earthy hops, figs, plums, and light woody notes. Flavor is roast malts forward with supporting espresso, chocolate, dark fruit, earthy hops, smoke, oak, and light bourbon; dry finish. Medium body and low carbonation.

A - Dark with minimal head. Not fizzy by any means. Pours extremely thick.  Wish it had more to the pour.

S - Chocolate, Chocolate.  Wasnt able to pick up much Bourbon.

T - Chocolate, chocolate, and chocolate. Did I mention it has a strong taste of chocolate?

M - Carbonated well. Not much head, but good mouthfeel all the same.

O - A high quality beer well worth the asking price, and quite possibly the most chocolatey beer Ive ever had. Its hard to imagine anything with more dark chocolate.

Pitch black and thick, a small amount of dark tan head. Smells of chocolate, coffee, oak dominate. Thick mouthfeel with a large amount of chocolate coffee taste right up front. The oak barrel taste hits mid palate with some vanilla and a nice sweet coffee lingers in the after with a small amount of coffee like bitter. Phenomenally well balanced and you don't notice the 11 % abv at all. Well worth the hype. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2013 bottle to a tulip glass.  Pours jet black with a light brown head.  Head is small and subsides quickly.  Aroma is a deep ground coffee smell with milk chocolate and rubbing alcohol.  Taste is    coffee and a little dark fruit up front, giving way to some chocolate and ending with a woody, alcohol taste.  Little sweetness and an ever so slight bitterness at the end also.  The bourbon barrel aged character is very noticeable and is balanced against the rest of the flavors.  Nice full, semi-slick mouthfeel.  Good lacing.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAR 31, 2015 2015:  Appearance is the same as previous years.  Milk chocolate hits the nose first in the aroma followed by bourbon, cherry, vanilla and hints of wood.  The taste follows the same path as the nose with chocolate, bourbon, vanilla and a bit of cherry.  The coffee presents itself much more in the taste with a smooth flavor.  Also get some drying wood flavor.  Some lingering coffee and roast in the aftertaste.  Very nice creamy mouthfeel.  Very well made with expertly blended flavors.  2014: Pours black with ruby highlights, a finger of dark khaki head that dissipates to an attractive foam with nice lacing.  The bourbon comes through in the aroma and so does the oak from the barrels.  Also some sweet chocolate and only a faint hint of coffee.  The taste is at first sweet with cocoa and a nice vanilla, then the bourbon flavor appears along with a pleasant touch of alcohol warmth.  You then get a chocolate covered coffee bean flavor and only a touch of bitterness.  Finishes with more chocolate and a bit of oak woodiness.  Mouthfeel is creamy and somewhat sticky with a medium/full body.  Carbonation is medium with small bubbles.  Alcohol legs appear in lacing.  Exceptionally well integrated flavors that compliment each other and never overpower one another.  A sipper that is highly enjoyable. 

---Jeremy H

Tap at the Flying Saucer. Black with a good sized brown head. Aroma of vanilla, bourbon barrel, dark fruits, and a touch of coffee. Taste is rich and malty, boozy, and woody. Medium-full bodied and really smooth. Nice stuff.

Pours from bottle a almost black brown with dark khaki head. Smells of espresso, cocoa, faint bourbon, dark fruits, and a bit of vanilla. Tastes of cocoa, coffee, sweet vanilla, booze/bourbon, and oak. Creamy and rich mouthfeel. Wonderful beer!

On Draught.
The beer pours basically a black color with a good sized head & lots of lacing on the glass. 

The aroma is sort of a pleasant amalgamation of espresso and bourbon... you can tell that its boozy from the aroma but its not off putting or "cheap-vodka"-like... The aroma is very roasty & rich with some nice vanilla. 

The flavor is very bourbon forward, I drank this glass pretty much at room temperature and its far more bourbony than when its just straight cold. The beer is sweet but not "dessert sweet" ala Bourbon County Stout. Unsurprisingly its a big roasty beer with a nice level of bitter chocolate, the vanilla is mild but pleasant, there is some green pepper character but not enough to be an annoyance, the coffee character all around comes across as a touch brash and there is a pretty high level of alcohol spiciness. 

The beer sits heavy on the tongue but avoids any "syrupy" character. 

Very enjoyable beer.

My first taste of the 2013 KBS, always solid... pours a dark brown with ligt tan head that stays for a while.  The aroma has a subtle furitiness mixed with the bourbon.  Taste is also slightlt fruity with a creamy mouth feel, not heavy at all.  Drinks lke a 6% beer.

2013 Bottle.  Roasty with hints of coffee and chocolate, and a strong bourbon presence.  Has a burnt sugar characteristic from the bourbon that is particularly nice on the sides of the tongue.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured out of a bottle
Jet black with low carbonation that forms a small ring of light brown bubbles around the edge
Aroma is full of alcohol and oak which reminds you of a great bourbon
Once the nose gets through the bourbon aroma it finds some dark chocolate and a hint of coffee
The first taste matches the nose almost exactly, bourbony boozy and oak on the tip of the tongue with roasty coffee and chocolate bitterness on the finish
Palate is silky smooth with a medium to full mouthfeel. This beer is an excellent example of an imperial stout.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

a joyous glass had at valhala bar. black a beer ad can be with mix of vanilla and coffee. but in the end the over arching bourdon alcohol and barrel caramel. still with all the heavy flavor still medium body. good all around

Bottle (thanks Alex!). Pours an opaque deep stouty brown-black with a thin espresso colored head, so-so retention, good lacing.  Nose is full of bourbon barrel, cocoa, coffee, caramelly butterscotch, dates and figs. Mouth is thick and oily (the oatmeal gives this a really nice body),  mild sweetness, full of boozy goodness along with chocolatey notes, coffee and a bittersweet finish that goes down warmly but not unpleasant. Outstanding.  Wish I hadnt drank this one so fast!

UPDATED: APR 27, 2013 Poured into an oversized wine glass. Deep brown with quickly fading off-white head. Aromas of espresso, dark chocolate and a whiff of dark fruit. Taste is wonderfully complex interplay of coffee, chocolate, and dark maltiness. Thick mouthfeel with nice warmth without burning. Glad I scored two of these! ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured into a bourbon county glass. Pitch black with brownish head of quarter inch. Head quickly dissipates. 
Smell mostly chocolate with slight coffee.
Great dark chocolate taste. Hints of vanilla with some initial booziness. Alcohol taste doesnt linget but rich fantastic chocolate does.

Let it warm up for awhile but didnt notice much change in taste, smell. Great beer but not sure it deserves the incredible hype. Will have to try another one here soon to see if my mind opinion is swayed.

Delicious.  Remarkable.  Its jet black and pours with absolutely no head at all.  The aroma is huge, simultaneous chocolate and vanilla and coffee.  The flavor is very much like Founders Breakfast, with an intense dark chocolate and coffee combination, but over and behind and around all of it is a rich bourbon quality that brings out walnuts and candied fruit and dark bread.  There isnt much heat until after the swallow, when a little shows up on the exhale.  I love this stout and I hope I can find it again.

Good beer. Rich, deep brown color. Thick brown head settles to a ring. Mouthfeel is like liquid milk chocolate. Aroma is sensitively roasted malt and cocoa. Reminds me of youngs dounle chocolate luxury stout but much stronger and with a greater bittering hop presence on the finish. It hides its strength well but warms like whiskey seconds after the sip. Drink this for "breakfast" and go right back to sleep. It leaves an oily tannic coating on the glass. The spotty laces falls back to the drink in its own wake. Sometimes a coffee aftertaste comes through in the finish.
Very smooth for 11.2%.  Highly recomnend to anyone.  Worth the price.  The bourbon direct overpower the taste as in the backwoods from founders.  Such an easy, smooth, great tasting stout.
UPDATED: MAY 8, 2014 On draft at Rustico.  Pitch Black stout, aroma is Roasted malt and burbon.  Taste is huge bourbon, coffee, chocolate with an incredibly smooth finish.  Awesome beer!

Bottle. The pours deep brown with a small, tight tan head. The nose is bourbon. Sugar-coated wood. Plenty of vanilla. Toffee and brown sugar. Rich roast malts. Mild hoppy tree bark. The taste is vanilla bourbon chocolate shake. Charred grain. Dark bitter chocolate and espresso bean.. Burnt caramel. Quite hoppy on the finish. Full body, viscous. Overall, quite good.

12oz bottle, enjoyed at room temp.  Pours an oily black with a minimal amount of tan head.  Strong aroma of chocolate and bourbon, smells great.  Taste is coffee, bourbon, wood, chocolate, vanilla.  A bit of heat from the alcohol as it goes down.  Smooth and thin texture.  This was awesome.

Bottled, 2013 poured into a snifter. 

Aroma is cocoa , coffee, vanilla, bourbon. 

Black pour, thin brown head with fine lacing. 

Flavor is bourbon, vanilla, coffee, sweet malt, alcohol warmth. 

KBS is always a treat. One of the finer bourbon barrel aged Imperial Stouts out there. 

Medium-heavy body, nicely carbonated. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy from my iPad.
2013 bottle at home.  Pours black with a brown head.  Aroma is chocolate, vanilla, bourbon, malty, coffee.  Flavor is chocolate, vanilla, oak, bourbon, roasty malt.  This beer is amazing.

Appearance: It pours a beautiful pure black with absolutely no transparency.  Poured about a finger and a half of tan/khaki head.  I poured this at around 60 degrees.

Aroma: This thing smells great.  Its very intense.  Theres some deep espresso aroma, some bitter chocolate, theres a touch of bourbon all accented with a creamy sweet note.  Theres a little touch of vanilla and possibly some nut (maybe hazelnut?).  The alcohol is apparent, but not to the point of being boozy.

Taste: I had a serious beergasm when I took my first sip.  Its so intense, with so many flavors going on.  The bourbon barrel aging is apparent as there is a definite touch of the wood from the barrel and a touch of actual bourbon flavor.  Theres big espresso and deep chocolate notes that dominate the palate and those are accompanied by vanilla and caramel.

Mouthfeel: Decadent.  Luscious.  Wonderful.  

Overall: I was surprised at how much the coffee didnt smack me in the face as much as the regular breakfast stout, but thats ok.  There are so many flavors in the palate and aroma of this beer; the complexity is outstanding.  This is definitely the best beer Ive had this year, possibly the best Ive ever had. 

Score: 10/10
Pours dark black with a small tan head. Chocolate and coffee aroma. Bourbon coffee taste.
A very solid imperial stout and beer.  Not my favorite though.  Strong coffee, chocolate and oak flavor.  I actually prefer Founders Backwoods Bastard Ale to KBS.  Great beer though.

UPDATED: APR 5, 2014 Pours a thick black impenetrable to light with a small tan head. Smells just awesome, strongly chocolate with a cask wood smell giving off coffee and bourbon scents. Tastes strongly of alcohol but that may wear with aging. Strong coffee chocolate and alcohol flavors combine to almost give off a bug spray like taste, before giving off a weird but nice kind of cooling sensation in the mouth, like I just ate a mint. So no alcohol burn as well as heavy and thick. Still taste too strongly of alcohol but definately interesting with a lot of promise to be great if the alcohol mellows. Glad i got a sample and didnt pay $20 for this still

Amazing!  If there was an A+++, I would rate it as this.  Heavy cocoa, roasted malt, coffee and bourbony (alcohol) aroma.  Can't believe this is 70 IBU.  Buttery mouthfeel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tastes of coffee, a hint of vanilla, some chocolate milk, all with bourbon notes throughout. Awesome.

UPDATED: OCT 19, 2013 Rating 600 thought Id celebrate with something Ive been waiting to get my hands on. Pours a motor oil black, with medium brown swirl for head, tons of spots of lace that are left behind. Nose is a little booze, but mainly deep dark rich and semi carmalized malts. There is some vanilla in there too. Tastes silky smooth, cold coffee, bitter, dark chocolate. Malts linger, there is some booze there too, but not as much as you would expect. Cold coffee, chocolate and whiskey, what more could you want? Every time I have this I like it more and more.

Lucky to get two bottles this year. The beer that started the American BA craze, it lives up to the hype. Dark black pour with a tan head. Nose is bourbon and chocolate. Smoke, roasted chocolate and bourbon with just a hint of coffees the finish. Nice!

Poured a deep brown with a half inch of creamy espresso which dissipated quickly.  Smell of roasted vanilla beans and coffee.  Flavor of oak, vanilla bean, chocolate and bourbon.  Incredibly well balanced and delicious
Deep black stout! If you love breakfast stout KBS is money! Hints of oak ,bourbon, coffee, vanilla , chocolate. Smooth creamy body.

UPDATED: JUL 20, 2014 Aroma: caramel, chocolate milk and/or whipped chocolate ganache hit the nose, both while in the bottle and in the glass. 
Appearance: creamy tan head. body a robust coffee black. a milkyway-like constellation of lacing. swirls elegantly with no syrupy mess.
Taste: chocolate frosting on fresh cake up front. washes down a caramel flavored coffee. hints of breadiness in the background that get subdued and mellowed out by the oaky bourbon.
Palate: medium. good carbonation. lacks the thickness id expect from this beer, but its milkshake still brings this boy to the yard.

Pitch black, no light getting through with a creamy brown head. Nose is HUGE, mostly bold roasted coffee, milk chocolate, hazelnut, and light oak and vanilla bourbon notes. A lot more of the bourbon comes through in the taste, plenty of boozy vanilla and oak coming though, some roasted malt, light milky chocolate flavor, and tons of coffee. Medium bodied, a lot easier drinking than I would have thought. Some of my favorite flavors for beers melded together excellently, and not just another bourbon bomb.

Pours dark black and opaque with brown foam small head. Aroma of coffee and dark spicy chocolate. Can smell high alcohol bourbon. Tastes like an irish coffee. Starts coffee kinda smooth-edged into bourbon bite that smooths to milky chocolate and coffee that increases to large black coffee aftertaste. Considering I dont like coffee and the smell is so harsh, it is smoother and good taste.
Absolutely the best! Coffee bomb! I have tasted the mecca of stouts! Wow.Scour the Earth for this one!Can I give it better than 100!

Smells oakey and boozey.  This beer reminds me of my marriage - no head.  Tastes chocolaty and boozy.  Bourbon flavor isnt quite as pronounced as I expected, but thats not a bad thing.  Maybe not worth the hype, but definitely a really solid top tier beer.
Real nice stout. Pours thick but drinks smooth. Perfect blend off chocolate n coffee, neither is over powering.
It was just ok. I was expecting more based on its rating here and on beer advocate. C+

I drank this wonderful beer out of a snifter at room temprature.  It has an incredible nose, smelling it is half the fun.  The mouth feel is full and it just washes over your tongue.  Despite its big abv it is very well balanced with none of the flavors dominating any of the others.  Some beers live up to their hype and this one exceeded it.

Black with two finger brown head, dissipates with lacing. Bourbon, oak, cream, caramel, oatmeal, coffee, light alcohol. Moderate to heavy body with light but creamy carbonation. Bourbon, sweet oak and vanilla, toast, coffee and chocolate, creamy sweetness. Finishes with slight smokiness.

Ripe 2013 

A: Pours an incredibly dark brown, almost pitch black and sits midnight black in the glass.  Dark mocha head - huge considering the aging and abv.  Incredibly creamy retention and lacing.  Looks a lot like their imperial stout, but creamier and slightly lighter and less viscous.

S: Rich incredibly dark chocolate cake with a light vanilla icing, swimming in bourbon next to a cup of coffee.  At first when cold it smelled like pure coffee, and after about an hour it unleashed its true colors.  The bourbon is not the firestone creamy vanilla/coconut/oak - its a more raw hot flavor, like the essence of bourbon itself.  

T: Less decadent than the nose, but still pretty amazing.  Hot bourbon, huge dark roast coffee, incredibly bitter dark chocolate - slighter milk chocolate, vanilla and oak.  Definitely not too hot, a very pleasant warming. 

P: Very smooth, soft carbonation.  Its a big, full bodied beer, but not incredibly viscous.

O: Would really like to see how it evolves over a year because the coffee is so aggressive now.  Really fantastic beer, one I will remember.

UPDATED: AUG 24, 2016 Aroma is dark fruit/vinous, berries/cherries/strawberries and a very strong hint of acidity.  The flavor is dark fruit/very vinous, malts, hints of chocolate and coffee and a long acidic/mild alcoholic finish.

Espresso, cocoa, cherries, molasses, char, vanilla, tobacco, bourbon, and spices.  Black-brown with dark ruby highlights, and a nicely retaining, bubbly, tan head.  Off-dry, chocolatey, roasty, boozy, strong, and savory.  Full body, average carbonation, and finishes with strong, earthy, and slightly smokey flavors lingering.  Awesome beer.

Bourbon coffee, roasty dark chocolate aroma. light brown creamy head with solid black body. Bourbon, coffee, dark chocolate very smooth after taste. Smooth and creamy on the palate  AMAZING...IZZICK!!!!

Holy hell, this is good. Coffee on the nose, but straight Bourbon on the palate. Balanced alcohol, not sweet, creamy, toffee, coffee. Completely delicious, and a rare one that lives up to its reputation.
Pours a dark black with light brown head which disappears fast, strong bourbon aroma, very smooth with strong bourbon flavor up front with a sweet chocolate finish, cant wait to see how it cellars.
2013 bottle pour into a snifter.  Pitch black with 1/2 inch brown head that dissipates. Little lacing. Aromas of chocolate, coffee (strongest), and bourbon. Excellent stout!

UPDATED: APR 3, 2014 2013 bottle from Tiffanys Wine and Spirits, Kalamazoo MI.  Enjoyed at room temperature.  Deeeeeeeeeeeeeeeep brown to black pour with a half inch of dark brown head that had moderate density.  Aromas of sweet vanilla, roasty woodsy smokiness, sweet chocolate and cola syrup.  Bitter strong coffee taste at first then sweet chocolate, then blended whiskey.  Rich flavors, well blended and very smooth, couldnt be described as harsh whatsoever.  Advise that its not too sweet either.  Had a thin mouthfeel, maybe a bit oily and little to no carbonation.  Dry and subtle bourbon-like on finish.  Taste of smokey wood left in mouth with a little bourbon heat.  Hard to say if its as good as Canadian Breakfast Stout but basically amazing.  Ill go out of my way for this, bells black note and goose islands bourbon county stout.  not wait overnight in Grand Rapids camping in line out-of-my-way, but special lunch time trips from work for sure.  Well done.  I look forward to the 3 that are aging, possible updates may commence.
2014 note: this is definitely less bold and more harsh than its BBA kin, notably bells black note and bourbon county stout. More similarities to dragons milk.

First taste of 2013 KBS.

Aroma - smells of chocolate/coffee and oak.
Appearance - pours dark, oily and smooth. Little to no head or lacing.
Taste - chocolate, coffee and bourbon blended extremely well.
Palate - sits with a medium and creamy texture. more carbonated that I remember in years past.
Overall - extremely enjoyable beer and worthy of its world-wide status.

UPDATED: NOV 14, 2013 2013 bottle poured into a brandy snifter as directed. Extremely dark pour with a thick, almost whipped creamy milk chocolate brown head. Beautiful, almost had a red/mahogany tint to the head as it poured. The nose is mostly all chocolate with some faint coffee. Taste is dark chocolate up front, followed by hearty coffee, all tied together with the oak and bourbon flavor that takes turns and dances with the other flavors. Relatively thin, yet very smooth mouth feel. When one flavor subsides, the other comes forward. Beautiful balance. Beautiful beer.

UPDATED: FEB 15, 2014 2013 bottle. Wow the aroma is a nice sweet bourbon, the coffee and chocolatey scent is also resting very suddley back there also. First sip is a very sweet bourbon flavor, the abv warms a little bit also, the chocolate and coffee are also very prevalent, I am also getting a syrupy background also. This beer is spectacular I can’t believe that breakfast stout gets better!!

UPDATED: APR 11, 2013 poured from a 12oz bottle into a snifter at cellar temp around 55 degrees. i get a lot of chocolate and coffee smell from the bottle but more of the alcohol from the glass after the pour. initial flavor i get is boozey but the chocolate and roasty taste quickly follows. creamy and smooth mouthfeel with lingering flavors of chocolate, vanilla, dark coffee. beautiful and very tasty beer. i dont always really enjoy a stout with a strong bourbon flavor but this beer does it right and im glad i have more. probably the best barrel aged stout ive had. each sip seems a little different and more flavors come through as i go. warm, dark fruit, roasted, chocolate. great stuff.

2013 bottle picked up at the brewery today. Pours black as night with no head. Aroma of bourbon, vanilla, slight alcohol, maybe some hops and chocolate. Taste matches aroma. Mouthfeel is medium. Alcohol is fairly well hidden. This is the first time I have tried KBS. To me, it is very similar to Bourbon County Stout, but slightly thinner with less noticeable alcohol. Very good......I will put the other bottles away and see how they age.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: APR 12, 2013 Draught at Founders release. Dark pour with golden tan head. Sweet bourbon aroma. Lovely choco sweet smokey bourbon. Ultra smooth not hot at all.

Just got back from Founders with a case on release day 2013!! 12oz. bottle, poured into a KBS snifter glass.....a true corporate man! Haha!

Aroma: Big bourbon upfront. As you begin to sip, the chocolates and coffee make their way in.

Appearance: Dark brown pour, quickly diminishing medium-brown head. Fine lacing ring on sides with spotty lacing throughout. Nice oily coating on glass.

Taste: Again, big bourbon. A very nice chocolate body balances the nose. Hints of roasted malts over the middle. And yet another big dose of bourbon in the finish that is complimented with notes of coffee.

Palate: medium-heavy body, little carbonation. A meal.

Overall: Doesnt get much better. Balances being "big" with being "drinkable" quite well....especially once you get a few sips in and it warms...

Pour is very dark brown/black. Tan head that quickly dies down. Nose is light coffee, chocolate, roasted malts, and barrel. Taste is coffee, light bourbon, wood, chocolate, vanilla. Everything is very subtle and subdued. Very smooth full mouthfeel.

Bottle thanks to Hoppypocket, thanks a lot David! Pours a really deep brown with some reddish overtones and no head at all. First smell kills your nose with an intense bourbon shot but when you go back you can now smell coffee and vanilla along that intense "pure bourbon" nose. Taste is medium sweet, full of alcohol heat. Flavors are chocolate, coffee, bourbon and bourbon. Intense in every aspect it is never boring or too much (it is as balanced as it can, really), a really complex sipper!

UPDATED: MAY 16, 2013 Poured from a 12 oz bottle dated 02/17/12. Pitch black pour with a slight mocha head. Smells of bourbon, roasted malts, chocolate, and coffee. Taste follows but not overpowering with the bourbon... Really nice. Smooth finish with a slight hop bitterness. Good carbonation too. Really like this one.

UPDATE: 2013 version on tap at Strange Brew in Manchester, NH. I thought the 2013 version was a bit more heavy on the coffee and the bourbon notes were more pronounced. Still very smooth and enjoyable, but I think I prefer the 2012 vintage better. Will update again with thoughts on 2013 bottle.
Bottle. Black beer with a nice beige head. Coffee, chcoclate, bourbon, dark fruits, nutty, spicy aroma. Coffee, choclate, vanilla, dark, fruits, spicy, bourbon and woody flavour. Really a nice beer.

The Kentucky Breakfast Stout pours very dark with a dark brown head that leaves lovely lacing. The aroma is chocolate and vanilla. You can smell the bourbon a bit but it isn't a bad thing. The flavor is smokey bourbon, chocolate and vanilla. This is the best beer I have ever consumed and will find a way to collect as many of these as possible. I do not recommend you have any. I recommend you leave them all for me.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Supplied by StFun. I appreciate it; many thanks! Pours black with a trim khaki head. Aromas of booze, bourbon oak, roasted malts, raisins, grape nuts, sorghum molasses, caramel, and walnuts. Not too much coffee detected on the nose. Tastes of roast, espresso grounds, vanilla beans, wood, and raspberry syrup, You can definitely taste the bourbon in this. A bit too hot but still good.

Dark dark brown with mocha head. Aroma does not include the bourbon I expected. Chocolate and coffee dominates the nose. The tsste is next to perfect balance.  Chocolate, and coffee pair with mild vanilla and bourbon.  Love it. Dry bitter finish is great, but hangs on a little to long for my taste.
Not a big fan of bourbon barrel stuff, but this has been aged about 3 years, and its perfect. Boozy on the nose, sweet on the tongue.

UPDATED: JUN 27, 2013 2011 bottle (year and a halfish).  Whaddaya want me to say?  It smells awesome - very mellow bourbon on a smooth coffee-touch-of-cream back-bone,  And theres a skull on the label.  Small and classy, of course, but its a skull.  Im rambling.  This is the bourbon-barreled version of what may be the standard Midwest stout.  And, as you may expect, it fucking rocks. So well balanced - coffee, smoke, wood, bourbon, and roast wonderfully meshed.  

ADDTN: Drinking a fresh 2013 bottle: rated as a 4.6  (Ill leave the higher rating up).  Astrigent chocolate on the aroma.  Rich and intriguing.  Mouthfeel is much more harsh when younger.  Flavor is more based in a very dry coffee stout, with a bit of chocolate, than it is bourbon or wood.  Bourbon only really hangs around for the afterburn - and there it is.

UPDATED: JUL 3, 2013 Shared with Mathieu87.
Appearance: pitch black, nice mocha head, head stays on long, very sticky.
Nose: bourbon, burned malts, smoke, chocolate, wood, vanilla
Taste: very powerful beer, maybe a little to powerful for me... you get an all warming feeling inside when drinking, which reminds me more of liquor than actual beer. sweet, licorice candy, bitter, alcohol, liquer.
Very interesting beer, but a little to much for me. I enjoyed the Breakfast stout much more, even though this one is much more complex!

12 oz. bottle got in a trade with Adam Jackson. Bottled on 2/17/2012. Just past a year sitting and is almost perfect in every aspect. Superb. Nose is light coffee, chocolate, vanilla mixed with light oak and bourbon. The flavors just coat my palate with rich decadent goodness. Slick, oily mouthfeel. Old strong coffee, dark chocolate, vanilla with a touch of bourbon. Lingering light flavors of oaky bourbon and coffee hints. A slight warming sensation after the sip. ABV is only noticed after the sip, no alcohol flavor. My favorite thing here is the bourbon has mellowed out and really melds well with the stout.
 I know everybody here is a critic but how can anyone give this less than a 4.2?? If you dont like strong bourbon then let it sit and mellow out. I think this brew is nearly perfect.

UPDATED: APR 9, 2014 Re rate 04/14. Dropped slightly from 4.7 aroma not as great as last review. Had this one day after bcbs. MUCH prefer kbs"........................12oz bottle to glass; recd in trade from cpetrone84; I aged for 1.5 years?  holyholy - I have not enjoyed other beers aged in bourbon barrels; that has now changed -this is my highest rated beer!!  AROMA:  first thing I got was ashes; a wonderful smell + wood + vanilla + bourbon and maybe chocolate (with all that going on, I couldnt find the coffee).  perfect scores for app. and palate - palate was smooth, soft, and chewy.  Flavor was everything that is good in the world:  everything from the aroma but perfectly balanced - beer ended with a little warmth - perfect mix of chocolate, sweetness, and alcohol
unbelievable beer - guess I need o try a few more bourbon barrel beers; MUST TRY AGAIN...  Thank you Chris!!

This is a really nice barrel aged stout with chocolate, vanilla, wood and bourbon flavors. Smooth on the palate but a bit bitter at the end. A really nice beer but I really don't get the hysteria. For the availability, quality and price there are many better options.

UPDATED: DEC 8, 2014 Motor oil black, thin brown lacing. Complex blend of charred wood, syrupy chocolate, black coffee, vanilla bean, molasses, blackcurrant, plums, and roasted malt. Impeccable balance between the caramel sweetness, bourbon sourness, or alcohol bitterness. Oily, smooth, viscous, and full-bodied. Long, pleasant finish.

Poured from a 12 ounce bottle into a Cigar City snifter. Bottled on 02/08/10 printed on bottle neck. This beer was bottled over 3 years ago. Thanks to my trading partner iHEARTbeer247 for hooking me up with this one.

Appearance: Pours a motor oil black with a tiny, bubbly dark mocha brown head which dissipates quickly leaving a ring around the edge of the snifter. Excellent lacing.

Smell: Dark roasted coffee, milk chocolate, oak, vanilla and a slight hint of alcohol. Smells excellent.

Taste: Dark roasted malt with a nice amount of sweet chocolate up front followed by molasses, vanilla and before ending with oak, bourbon and a touch of black pepper at the finish. Aftertaste is coffee with a touch of sweetness. The alcohol is hidden very well in the background behind the robust and complex flavor profile. 

Mouthfeel: Full-bodied and thick with just the right amount of carbonation.

Drinkability: Excellent drinkability. This one is ridiculously smooth for a beer with 11.2% ABV. It could definitely sneak up on you.

Overall: Incredible beer overall. Rarely does a beer live up to this kind of hype, but KBS absolutely is worth all the acclaim. I cant recommend this beer enough. If you ever have the chance to try it, you must do so. I can only hope that Founders decides to ship this stuff down here to Florida at some point.

Funny this another bottle from RobertDale in a trade :) pours that black  you can't see light through it also has a tan head, massive bourbon with a hint of sweet chocolate. My mouth is overwhelmed by the bourbon spoils it off me

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2012 bottle from trade; pours a pitch black, quickly disappearing tan head, overwhelming bourbon aroma, the bourbon is present less in the taste than the aroma, slight hint of coffee and chocolate viscous mouthfeel, ultimately spoiled by bourbon BA has left the other tastes hidden enjoy its complexity.

2012 vintage. Poured into 12 oz stout glass. Smells of bourbon, coffee, and chocalate. Tastes about the same with not as much of a bourbon bite. Very well balanced and very true to the orginial breakfast stout. Compared this against BCS and Bells BN. Finished third in the bttle of the heavy weights. Not far behind Black note, but is was weaker than the other two on the bourbon flavor. But it is still excellent.

This ancient elixir pours blacker than the infinite madness between the stars themselves, and with such thick viscosity  that one wonders what diabolical mixtures the apothecary has added to this fiendishly wonderful brew. The aroma is heady, reminding one of ancient primeval forests not yet trod by the foot of man. Upon the first taste one descends into madness, knowing naught but creamy chocolate, bourboney, vanilla goodness until the spell passes. Best fucking beer I ever had.

Courtesy of GranvilleTim a four year verticle! Starting with 09 to 11. Pours dark brown. Nice lacing. Bourbon smell with coffee aromas, more so as the years progressed. Wonderfully pleasant balance of sweetness, coffee, roasted malt, bourbon undertones. The bourbon is complimentary, not front seat. Flavors are more pronounced in newer years. Older vintages much more mellow and melded. A wonderful treat. Thanks Tim!

Pours a thick silky black color with a half finger of mocha foam that rings out and sticks nicely. On the nose there is a big dose of spent coffee grounds, dark chocolate, sweet vanilla and bourbon notes mixed with just a touch of earthy dark fruit. The mouthfeel is smooth and creamy with s slight touch of heat on the late palate. Smooth chocolate and sweet caramel notes mingle with dark coffee bitterness and rich bourbon and vanilla. The oak complements the flavors wonderfully and the balanced finish keeps flowing with lingering chocolate bourbon notes.... YUM.

Bottle from Feb 2012

Much Much Much better with some age. The heat has died down a lot over the past 6 months.  Still get the bourbon/oak flavor but the chocolate, and oat come through much stronger.

UPDATED: JUN 26, 2013 Bottle. Pours a beautiful, smooth black with no head and no carbonation. Aroma is a terriffic bourbon, coffee and vanilla. Taste is bourbon on the tongue with nice creamy stout with bourbon, coffee and a little vanilla at the end. Absolutely great beer, permanent want list.

Very strong bourbon aroma with coffee and cocoa.  Heavy bourbon on the palate very earthy with a slight mild vanilla finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

chocolate, coffee, roasty, toast, caramel, alcohol

glorious, though Im not sure its significantly better than other more available alternatives.

UPDATED: AUG 4, 2013 Feb. 12 bottle enjoyed with about 10 months of age.  Very thick.  Medium bitter chocolate on nose as well as vanilla, with a little coffee.  Coffee becomes more pronounced with warmth.  Very dark roast espresso like.  Expected more in the nose.  I expected a much richer, sweeter flavor from this but was instead surprised to find that where this beer excels is instead in its incredible balance.  Flavor of espresso, barrel, earthier vanilla, soy.  Alcohol is extremely well hidden and bourbon is seamlessly integrated and very subtle.  My second favorite in a big Boxing Day rare stout tasting after an 09 BA Yeti.

>>Rerate.  12 bottle.  Only about 4 months on since I tried the last one, but this seems to have mellowed very nicely.  Coffee has moved back and this is just much better integrated.  Still expected more bourbon, but this thing just excels in balance.

>>rerate.  13 bottle.  About 4 months old.  Hops much more present and mute coffee and sweeter aspects.  Nice and interesting to compare to older vintage bottles.

Bottled Feb 2012. Drank Dec 29, 2012.  The aroma is a heady concoction of sweet dark chocolate, vanilla, bourbon, coffee, a little oxidation at this point but still quite hot. The flavor is very sweet, not cloying, rich with a little licorice and soy added to the aroma components carried through before a spicy and coffee bitter end.  At first I got a little cardboard but that seems to have blown off. The mouthfeel isnt as full or lively as a 4 month old Breakfast Stout but it is silken. The alcohol is active, hot, and drying through the middle and end.  Its been a few years since Ive had this and it was a bit more larger-than-life in my mind than in my glass.  Its exceptionally well put together and balanced for how much is going on.  The bourbon is in perfect proportion.  I wish more breweries would exercise the same measure and not overdue the barrel soaking.

12 ounce bottle. Thanks Joe!  Pours midnight black with a very small tan head.  Aroma of bourbon, malt, coffee, and chocolate.  Taste is bourbon, roasted malt, dark chocolate, tart cherries, coffee, and wood.  Most excellent!!

This is the best bourbon stout Ive ever tasted.  Rich and creamy with a bourbon burn at the end but in the best way possible.  This is the staple when it comes to bourbon stouts which is so balanced it is dangerous.  If you ever get the chance to try this please do, I promise you wont be disappointed!

Half snifter pour of motor oil with a thin to no head. Nose is mild and rich, all at once. Dark chocolate and rich chocolate, but very smooth and nice. Flavor is super smooth and rich also. Same dark chocolate malt followed with rich coffee, light booziness on the back of rich bourbon. Very very drinkable for 13 percent. Amazing!

2010 bottle. Pours reddish dark with light bubbly head. Aroma of heavy smoke with burnt tinge and slight sweet bourbon. Taste of oak and slight smoke before moving into perfectly balanced smooth bourbon with awesome light lingering finish. Lighter palate than most imp. stouts.
 Simply one of the best beers Ive ever had.

This one is tough to rate.  The 2011 bottle I had a few months back was horrible compared to the 2012 bottle I opened this evening.  This evenings bottle is the one I will rate, as I will chalk about the discrepency due to age.  I do not recommend aging this one.

A: Dark, dark, black.  Like BCS, with a bit less carbonation, but still some life.  S: borubon, bourbon,and some more bourbon, with hits of chocolate.  To be fair, I sort of drank this too cold initially, and didnt pay attention as much later to the smell.  T: Wow.  Brownie, Chocolate, and bourbon, as smoothly melded as can be.  Completely different to the boozy mess that was the 2011 bottle which was my previous experience.  Bottle variation or age?  I need to drink more of this to find out.  I pray I have more of the later (2012) experiences going forward than the 2011 experience I had a couple of months ago...

Bottle - thanks Mike! Pours pitch black with a very small brown head that dissipates quickly with some lacing. Aroma is bourbon, dark roasted malts, coffee, cocoa powder. Flavor is about the same, notes of wood. Medium sweet, light coffee bitterness coming through on the finish. Bourbon flavors are ever present, but not overpowering. Body is medium plus, mouthfeel is creamy, carbonation is low.

UPDATED: AUG 29, 2016 27th January 2011Opaque black - brown beer, tiny tan head. Wet wood and ash nose, not great. Semi dry and semi soft palate. Wet wood, dark chocolate, coffe,. bourbon. A little creamy dark malt. Finishes dry. Not bad but I am at a loss as to this beers all time great status. 3.2. 26th May 2016Mother Kellys. Keg. Opaque brown beer, good pale tan head. Palate is airy, semi dry and has decent fine carbonation. Lovely touch of dark chocolate with dark malt cream. Fruit bourbon, a little spicy bourbon. Coconut and a trace of wood. Smooth finish brings more spice. Lovely stuff and a country mild better than the one I drank all those years ago.
Pours dark darker brown with a light head. Smells of cherries and alcohol. Taste is of chocolate and alcohol. Very heavy on the tongue with a lingering taste of chocolate. Fantastic beer!

Happy t-day to me. Pours deep black with a chocolate brown head of a finger or so that settles to a ring. Multi-layered nose involving oak char, vanilla, toffee, butter, delicious bourbon, chocolate, chewy dark pit fruit, candy, and coffee among other things. Taste is very nicely sweet but with plenty of roasty bitterness for balance. Palate is full, round, soft, oily, tingly, spicy, with no noticeable alcohol. Just plain awesome, and Im glad I was able to try it. Cured at least some manner of distress for me.

2012 bottle, this one was courtesy of xscottypx. Thanks!
Black with a brown head that disappears quickly.
Aroma: chocolate covered coffee beans, cocoa, bourbon, toffee, vanilla.
Taste follows the aroma with added milk chocolate.
Quite full bodied.
Amazing balance, very good stuff! I look forward to opening up another bottle with a bit of aging.

UPDATED: MAY 21, 2014 2012 bottling.  Fantastic stuff.  Nice warm bourbon aroma.  Great balance of bourbon, coffee and chocolate.  Not as heavy on the bourbon as some of the others, but this does have some age on it.  The coffee held up remarkably well, i thought that would fade out over time.

Re rate with 13 bottle.  For some reason, this years batch didnt impress.  A little thin, bourbon was a bit light.  I guess when I had it the first time I was a bit new to the BA stout scene, and now Ive had a lot that impress me more. 



14 another year and Im even less impressed. Thin and weak. If this were a shelf 6 pack Id put it next to black butte porter.  Not worth the hype or price.

So pushkinwow sent me this over a year ago.  I was moving a few beer around and found it, i think its actually a 2010.  Thanks! Thick black with almost no head ,a light tan ring. Aroma of a bit of coffee and some oak, lots of roast chocolate malt. Mouthfeel is thick and creamy, very full body, not much carbonation left here. Taste is bourbon, lots of nice coffee, like caramel and cream. So rich and complex, but totally easy drinking. Amazing. #400

Got this 2011 in a recent trade with Jedwards, thanks man! Dark black color with a bit of a brown head. Smells like really good coffee to me, nice. The flavor was also really good coffee, not overwhelming, a hint of booze but the alcohol was well hidden. Overall I can see why people like this beer so much but given the price and availability I don;t really have any incentive to get this again.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 05-15-2011 19:11:26

a HUGE thanx to dennoman for this one . 
this is way thicker than the breakfast. but you taste more bourbon ( wich i dont realy like) . a good quality beer, yeah, but not my kind of thing ..

Without a doubt, this is the best beer Ive ever managed to get my hands on. Admittedly, as a fan of imperial stouts, Im biased, but this one got the job done. Rich, dark, and perfectly toasted, this beer belies its ABV by being suprisingly easy to drink. The bourbon flavors come through nicely, giving an almost vanilla-like accent to the dark chocolate flavors of the roasted malts. Even got a hint of caramel on the tail-end. Definitely a brew worth pursuing.

UPDATED: APR 9, 2013 Fresh from bottle (2013): Black pour with brown head. great aroma with coffee at the front with chocolate (a mocah really) and bourbon behind it. Mouthfeel is a little thinner than Id like. Coffee flavors up front, with bourbon and chocolate undertones. Great bitter/sweet balance, but I think Eclipse might beat this beer in a fresh head-to-head. Better taste than the 11 I had aged 1.5 years, but less body. Same score as last time for different reasons. Have a feeling that 9 months to 1 year is the sweet spot on this beer.

Old score and writeup: Gave it a 4.6 Had 2011 on draft (1.5 years old). Overall a very pleasing and complex beer, though it didnt age age as well as Id think. Definitely one of the better stouts up there, though Id rank bourbon county and Avery stouts above it.

From tap! Pours a black non seethrough wih minimal mocha head. Aroma is of: bourbon, wood, raisins, some sweet dark fruits, plums, toasted coconut. Taste is bourbon, vanilla, coffee, creamy, dark, biter ash, chocolate,burnt note, smoke. A very awesome stout. Soooooo smooth and complex, creamy with very well concealed alcohol! One of the best imperial stouts Ive had!

Served from 12oz bottle.  Deep black with little head.  Smells of light vanilla bourbon, fudge and oak.  The taste is chocolate, fudge, light bourbon and vanilla, really nice and well integrated.  Slick and viscous.  This is a great example of a bourbon barrel aged RIS the barrel notes are not up front but accentuate the base beer well.  Excellent
en botella.Perfecta!!muy bueno el balance que tiene con la barrica de bourbon.color i vista perfecta.muy recomendable

Shared with good friends whilst brewing, as a treat and something to really wrangle the tastebuds.  

How much I love this beer is measureed in the drool that i make, before I take the lid off.

22/10/12 Bouteille 341ml: Noire, avec beau collet de mousse blanc. Sublimes arômes de bourbon, mais non strident. Légèrement sucrée avec de délicieuses notes de bourbon, de vanille et  de boisée. Touche de chocolat-café. Très bien balancée. Corps moyen, mais drinkability parfaite. Texture soyeuse et finale légèrement alcoolisé. Le bourbon est tres bien utilisé et brille par sa présense, mais laisse toutefois de la place aux autres saveurs.

A - Pours a dark brown-black color with a thin layer of frothy chocolate colored head. The head fades down fairly quickly leaving behind some lacing.

S - Aroma is a mix of roasted dark chocolate malts, coffee, Bourbon, oak, vanilla, black licorice, earthy hops, molasses, lactose, and a bit of booze.

T - Starts off with a mix of roasted chocolate malts with some vanilla, lactose, and black licorice. Through the middle, the oak and Bourbon come through with roasted coffee and molasses and some earthy hops. The finish is a mix of roasted milk chocolate, coffee, oak, vanilla, Bourbon, and some booze.

M - Full bodied with moderate carbonation. Feels smooth with a sweet, roasted, bitter, and warming finish.

D - Very drinkable. Very smooth for how big and complex it is. Great barrel flavors alongside a very nice imperial coffee stout.

UPDATED: NOV 23, 2014 355 ml bottle courtesy of rlgk. Pours pitch black with thin dark mocha head that quickly dissipates without leaving much trace on the glass. Smell is sweet and malty with roasted malts, peppery wood, bourbon, dark roast coffee, burnt caramel, green chili, roasted coconut, vanilla fudge and bitter chocolate. Taste is sweet and malty with roasted malts, dark roast coffee, bourbon, bitter chocolate, burnt caramel, vanilla fudge, roasted coconut and hints of green chili. Mouthfeel is round, tiny sticky sweet, soft and medium to full bodied. Finish is sweet and slightly bitter with roasted malts, dark roast coffee, bourbon, bitter chocolate, vanilla fudge, coconut and hints of green chili. Very nice BA coffee stout.Re-rate! Draught @ BAJT. Had two glasses of this and could probably have sat there all day getting insanely drunk if I hadnt had other things to do. Perfectly balanced between the malts, coffee and barrel treatment. Insanely tasty and just insane to see this on tap in Sweden...
Sampled at UCTS testing. Pours pitch black with a small brown head. Smells smoky, woody and alot of coffee. Tastes salty, woody, chili, coffee, creamy roasted malt.

Bottle at USA comes to Skövde. Black beer with a small brown head. Malty chocolate aroma, whisky, vanilla, hay, peat, roasted, milk, cocoa powder, licorice, figs, raisins, spicy notes, chili, caramel, licorice, coffee notes. Bourbon flavor, hay, raisins, vanilla, figs, raisins, whisky, licorice, spicy, chili, floral, peat, dades, quite roasted, very nice.

Sampled at USSkovde
Black with a small beige head. 
Milky chocolate and coffee-beans in the aroma. 
A bit light body. 
Coffee-beans with woody notes.

UPDATED: OCT 22, 2012 Location: Shared 2 12 oz bottles w/ jcos: doing a 2 Bottle "Mini-Vertical", 10/19/12 


2011 Bottle

Aroma: A nose of roasted malts, chocolate, bourbon/wood, a little soy sauce, and a little coffee

Appearance: This one pours a dark brown-black color, with a small beige head, and spotty lace

Flavor: This one tastes medium sweet, it is a little bozzy, and has minimal bitterness

Palate: The body is medium, it has a smooth, creamy feel, and a soft carbonation

Overall Impression: 
Excellent beer that I have enjoyed before and needed to rate.  I thought the 2011 held up pretty well, though theres basically no hop left to speak of. 2011 Bottle Rating: (8/4/8/5/16)

2012 Bottle


Aroma: The nose is roasted like the 2011, more bourbon, more booze, and a little more hop

Appearance: The pour is pretty much exactly the same as the pour from the 2011 Bottle

Flavor: The taste, like the nose,has the same roast component with more booze, and a later hop presence

Palate: The body is very similar to the 2011, though theres a touch more carbonation

Overall Impression: 
The 2012 is a little better in my opinion.  The hops add a nice component that was missing in the older bottle.  Justin and I agreed, that this one is better fresher.  2012 Bottle Rating: (8/4/9/5/17)

Sampled at GABF 12. Pour is pitch black in appearance with a moderately sized dark brown head and good lacing. Huge coffee in the aroma, roasted chocolate, espresso, light biscuit, malty, sweet bourbon, and a touch of vanilla. Taste is again big coffee, earthy roasted notes, cocoa nibs, wood, and bourbon. Thick mouthfeel with soft carbonation. The overroasted coffee taste, is a bit overbearing and gives chili-like off-flavors; something is a little off. Still a delicious beer,  but it misses out on exceptional because I cant get past that chili flavor.
One of my new Top 10 beers. Perfect for breakfast or dessert. Aroma was great with the bourbon barrel aging and the coffee taste.

Wow! Thank you Hop City Bham for bringing this in! Unfortunately it only lasted for a few hours before selling out. After trying this beer, I understand why. Growler poured into a tulip glass. Oily black pour with a fluffy tan head...lacing all around the glass. Nose is absolutely fantastic! Bourbon, chocolate, burnt sugar, creamy...just wonderful. Taste is chocolate milk and bourbon with a nice alcohol burn, certainly a sipper. It gets better and better as it warms. I enjoyed the standard Breakfast Stout, but this really takes it to another level. Wonderful bourbon barrel aged stout!

Bottle. This shit is delicious. Aroma of oak, vanilla, and booze. Super dark and rich without being cloying. Smoky rich and dry likely from the bourbon barrel. Texturally big and finish is clean. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: AUG 4, 2014 Pours motor oil like with no head. Smells of heavy chocolate, vanilla, licorice, wood, bourbon and boozey. Taste is like chocolate sauce and light bourbon booze. Very good, but a bit hot. Actually like the standard breakfast stout better. Gotta find some again this year.

Tried a 2011 bottle on Dec 20, 2012. Same impression as before, like the regular FBS better, but this one is a nice warming yumminess. Only complait is theres no more coffee flavor. Just sort of bourbony, and slightly metallic but nothing serious.
